With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Gbassay T.. She was born in Magburaka town where she is currently living with her husband, who is a businessman.

For ten years now, Gbassay has been selling onions, groundnuts (peanuts), salt, Magi (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews), pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of these items in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more onions, groundnuts, salt, Magi, pepper, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Las Flores De Yanacona Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Las Flores de Yanacona”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yanacona, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nicolasa; ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 3 Hijos; La socia trabaja en crianza de animales menores y tiene una tienda de abarrotes y también tiene una pequeñas tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y arvejas, sus animales menores y los productos que cosecha lo vende en las diferentes ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Izcuchaca y en algunas oportunidades lo lleva a vender a la ciudad de Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes y para comprar animales menores como pollos y chanchos.

Los otros socios  se dedican la venta de artefactos, venta de ropa en el mercado, carpintería, venta de carne y animales menores, siembra.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This are the members of the Banco Comunal “Las Flores de Yanacona” (“Yanacona’s Flowers” Community Bank), which is located in Yanacona, a district in the Urubamba province of the Cusco region. Nicolasa is one of the members of the bank: she is 42 and has 3 children. She engages in breeding small animals as well as in a grocery store, and she also owns some land where she plants maize, potatoes and peas. She sells her animals and her crops in different fairs taking place in the Izcuchaca district, and in some occasions she also goes to the town of Cusco to sell them. She is requesting a loan to buy products for the grocery store and to buy small animals such as chickens and piglets. The other members of the group engage in sowing, selling arts and crafts, clothes sale, carpentry, meat and small animals’ sale. Nicolasa is thankful to those who will help making her dream come true through this loan, and she commits to comply with repaying her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery store proucts and to buy chickens and piglets.

loans.name: Gbla Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “G.” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva in order to improve their businesses.
 
The leader of this group is Agnes K. who is thirty-seven and was born in Magburaka. She is married with four children: two in primary school and two in secondary school.

For eight years now, Agnes has made a living through selling ready-to-wear clothes and shoes. She is requesting this loan in order to buy clothes and shoes in large quantity to add to her stock. 

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes in large quantity

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiro Nakawuka-Mpigi Group

texts.en:
50-year-old S. Dezi belongs to the Akutwala Ekiro Nakawuka-Mpigi. 

She has been selling bananas and other food produce for the last 25 years in Nakawuka-Mpigi. It is a profitable business given that many people buy food on a daily basis. What has played into her favor is the fact that she has a farm of her own where she harvests these foods. 

She joined forces with her husband who was already into this business. In a month, she reckons she makes profits that add up to about $310. With this loan she hopes to buy more fertilizers for her farm and she also hopes to pay her laborers.

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizers for her farm and to also pay off the farm laborers

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
26-year-old H. Abdu has a three year experience track record in his cattle sales business in Nakyesa-Kayunga. With this business he has taken on the responsibility for most of his family’s needs. His customers range from butcher shop business people to cattle herders. 

Abdu began as a cattle herder and later his business taste gravitated towards dealing in cattle. He also operates a commercial motorcycle business.

Abdu is married with two children. In a month his business generates him approximately $650. With this loan he wants to purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more cattle for resell

loans.name: Sabanoh United Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Sabanoh United” group. They are women with small-scale businesses residing and trading in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Hawa K. who is age fifty and was born in a place called Yoni. She is married with nine children. Her husband is a farmer and her children are all grown-ups.

For thirty years now, Hawa has sold market food – palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), groundnuts (peanuts), etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock. 

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, groundnuts, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Tabotsaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tabotsaneh” group. They are people with small-scale businesses based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Wurie T. who is age thirty-eight; he was born in Magburaka town where he is currently lives with his wife and three children. His wife is a businesswoman. One of his children is attending primary school and the other two are in secondary school.

For ten years now, Wurie has been selling medicines and locally-produced foodstuffs. He will use his share of the loan to buy one carton of Panadol (a brand name for paracetamol or acetaminophen, an over-the-counter pain reliever and fever reducer) to add to his stock.

loans.use: To buy one carton of Panadol to add to his stock

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
These are women with small-scale businesses in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will each be able to add more stock to their business, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living, send their children to school, and feed and clothe them.

Saffie C. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age thirty and is married with three children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary school.

Saffie sells used clothes, shoes, palm-oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), and rice. She has been managing this business for fifteen years now. She will invest her share of the loan in her business, buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock. 

Attached to the photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, palm-oil and rice in large quantity

loans.name: Ansorbeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Ansorbeh” group. These are entrepreneurs with small-scale businesses who have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each in order to invest in their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Adama T. who is age forty-five and was born in a place called Songo, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. Her husband is a driver and three of her children are attending primary schools and one is in secondary school.

Adama sells rice (the country’s staple food) and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

Attached to the photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy rice and palm-oil wholesale

loans.name: Astria

texts.es: Astria tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene ocho hijos. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su propia casa. Para Astria, el factor más relevante es “la creatividad y la perseverancia”; desde luego lo aplicó para el trabajo agrícola que realiza, es así que cuando sembró café, que es el producto que tiene para generarse los ingresos que necesita, pudo recolectar en cantidad y ahora sus asiduos compradores se sienten satisfechos por la calidad de este fruto. Normalmente trabaja en compañía de su familia, y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, además asegura que minimiza en gastos, ya que no necesita de mano de obra de terceras personas. Usualmente su producto de café los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y a un precio competitivo. Su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, solo que en los días domingo descansa, para que esté más tiempo con su familia. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su producción agrícola, asimismo piensa construir su casa  base de material noble, con la finalidad darle comodidad y seguridad a su familia. Este es su sexta crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal, ya que todos son responsables con sus respectivos pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, con la finalidad de que lo pueda darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Astria is 46 years old. She is married and has eight children. They live together in Quimbiri, located in Cusco's beautiful woods, where they have their own house. The most relevant thing for Astria is "creativity and perseverance"--a maxim she applies to her agricultural work. That's how she cultivates coffee, which is the source of her income. She is able to harvest a large amount of coffee, and her customers are happy with the quality of her product. She normally works alongside her family, and they work together well. There is also the additional savings in expenses, since there is no need to hire outside workers. She usually sells her coffee in distribution centers in her area and at a competitive price. Her daily routine is to leave home at 7 am and return at 6 pm. She only rests on Sunday, when she can be with her family. Her plans for the future are to increase her agricultural production so as to build a house with good materials so that her family can be safer and more comfortable. This is her six loan with microfinance partner MFP, and she promises to meet her payment schedule. She also would like to thank her community bank, where everyone is responsible for paying their respective loans. She will use this money to invest in buying supplies and fertilizer in order to adequately maintain her coffee plantation.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions and fertilizer for her coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Damacia

texts.es:
La Sra. Damacia  posee una farmacia en su domicilio, ella hace 10 diez años que se dedica a este rubro , ya que anteriormente trabajaba como vendedora en una farmacia  y D. alli  , se propuso en abrir su propia faramacia y eso lo logro con mucho esfuerzo y estudios realizados, ella es casada con 3  hijos  en edad escolar.
Con un poco D. su ahorro pudo montar su negocio y se   independizo.
Ella necesita D. este crédito para la compra D. mas mercaderia ya que tiene varios pedidos. En el futuro  desea abrir  mas locales.
texts.en:
Damacia runs a pharmacy in her house, an activity she has been running for 10 years. As she previously worked as a shop assistant in a pharmacy, she thought about opening one of her own, something she achieved with great effort and by studying hard. She is married and has three children of school age. With some of her saving s she was able to start her activity and so to get economic independence. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products, as she receives many requests. In the future she wishes to have a bigger shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yoni; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles en las diferentes ferias que hay en la ciudad de Cusco, los días sábados y domingos vende en la plaza Túpac Amaru desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda de venta de muebles, ella vende mesas, sillas, escritorios y camas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  madera y herramientas para hacer los muebles.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Yoni, a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Communal Bank, located in Wanchaq, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Yoni is 40 years old, she is married and has one son. On top of her everyday chores, she sells furniture in the different fairs taking place in the town of Cusco; on Saturdays and Sundays she sells furniture in the Túpac Amaru square form 8 am to 7 pm. She would like to own a furniture shop; she sells tables, chairs, desks and beds, and she is requesting a loan to buy wood and tools for furniture making. She is thankful to those who will help making her dream come true through this loan, and she commits to comply with repaying her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and woods for furniture making.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Hilario; el tiene 58 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 7 hijos; El socio es comerciante, él realiza el negocio de llamadas a celulares en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere tener un locutorio de llamadas. El socio solicita el préstamo comprar celulares para su negocio.

 El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilario belongs to the 'Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II' Community Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, in the province and department of Cusco. Hilario is 58, lives with his partner and has 7 children. He is a merchant. He has a cell phone call business in a street market. He works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. He wants to have a phone booth. He is requesting this loan to purchase cell phones for his business. He thanks those who will become part of this dream through this loan, and promises to repay his quotas on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cell phones for his business

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: El Señor Juan Ángel es propietario de un taxi que circula por todo león, es él una hombre trabajador tiene 57 años. Con el préstamo tiene pensado comprar repuestos para su vehículo, llantas entre otros por lo que es su principal fuente de ingresos la experiencia que ha obtenido en este trabajo ha sido de 9 años pues sabe muy bien cómo tratar a sus clientes y brindar un buen servicio. Por lo que todos los días pide por que sea un buen día. El sueña con lograr obtener otro carro nuevo, para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan Ángel owns a taxi that he drives throughout all of Leon. He is a hard-working 57-year-old man. With this loan he intends to buy spare parts for his vehicle; tires, among other items. This taxi is his main source of income. He has 9 years of experience in this work, so he knows how to treat his customers and offer a good service. Every day he prays that it will be a good day. He dreams of obtaining a new car in order to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sonia Yeni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia Yeni; ella tiene 31  años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de llamadas  a celulares, ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria en la puerta de una centro comercial de la ciudad, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes en el futuro. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  celulares y renovar sus líneas de teléfono.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sonia Yeni belongs to the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Community Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. She is 31, lives with her partner and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with a cell phone call business. She works on the street outside of a city shopping center. She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. She wants to have a grocery store in the future. She is requesting this loan to purchase cell phones and update her phone lines. She thanks those who will be part of this dream through this loan, and promises to repay the loan as established.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cell phones and update her telephone lines

loans.name: Ester Rosaura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ester Rosaura; ella tiene 28  años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio venta de fruta en el Centro Comercial de Confraternidad, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m mediante este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos y les puede dar una educación, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar variedad de fruta como manzanas, naranjas, uvas y papayas. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Ester Rosaura, a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Communal Bank, located in Wanchaq, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Ester Rosaura is 28 years old, she is a single mother and has two children. On top of everyday chores, she runs a fruits and vegetable shop in the collective shopping center, working there form 8 am to 6 pm. Thanks to this job she provides for her children and is able to pay for their education. She wants to improve her activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fruit such as apples, oranges, grapes and papayas. She is thankful to those who will help making her dream come true through this loan, and she commits to comply with repaying her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy apples, oranges, grapes and papayas to sell.

loans.name: Leydis Maria

texts.es:
La señora Leydis Maria tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general. Su negocio está ubicado de manera ambulante por lo que así tiene más facilidad de obtener clientes. El crecimiento de su negocio es notable gracias a la buena administración, la excelente atención a los clientes. 
Es una joven que ha demostrado que tiene todas las ganas de salir adelante pues siempre ha trabajado desde muy joven su Mama le enseño a ganarse la vida. El crédito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercadería y así surtir más su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Leydis Maria has sold general merchandise for 2 years. Her business is in a street market because this is the easiest way to obtain customers. Her business' growth is outstanding thanks to her good administration and excellent customer service. She is a young woman who has demonstrated the desire to succeed. She has always worked; from a very young age, her mother taught her to make a living. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise to better stock her business. She needs her earnings to cover her household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Benito; el tiene 50  años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio trabaja en arreglos de zapatos desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el tiene un puesto  en el Centro Comercial de Confraternidad, y por medio de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere tener una tienda de venta de zapatos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para arreglar los zapatos.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II". The communal bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mr. Benito. He is 50 years old. He is married and has 4 children. The member works fixing shoes from 8:00am to 7:00pm. He has a stall in the Centro Comercial de Confraternidad and because of this small business he is able to give his children a good life. The members wants to have a store that sells shoes. The member is requesting a loan to buy materials to mend shoes. The member thanks the people who are helping him with his dream through this loan and promises to make his payments in the established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is a requesting a loan to buy materials to mend shoes

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of her group, La Nueva Esperanza 5 & 6 (The New Hope). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Yolanda is excited to be taking out her 6th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for over four years, starting with cooking lunch for some people, after which she felt the need to do an activity that generated income. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying meats, rice, beans and seasonings, which she uses to cook lunch and dinner in her little Comedor. A comedor is a small restaurant located in a non-commercial area, like in the same neighborhood, where people come for a homemade lunch or dinner for a cheaper price than in restaurants or a cafeteria. She will use the profits to invest in her business by buying things it needs and to save to start building her house in the near future.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted a loan to do business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, meats, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Sugeivis

texts.es:
Sugeivis es una joven mujer que vive en San Jacinto, población de gran predominio  de artesanos de hamacas y mochilas, pero también concurren las actividades derivadas de la madera  y en menor proporción los comerciantes; allí Sugeivis tiene su negocio llamado  Muebles y Artesanías San Jacinto, desde hace dos años cuando cambió su actividad como comerciante de electrodomésticos, para dedicarse a lo que hoy hace: ella trae desde Sampues, municipio del departamento de  Sucre, mecedoras, juegos muebles para la sala y para dormitorio, los comercializa en San Jacinto y en Valledupar, lugares y en esté ultimo agrega para su venta las  famosas artesanías de su natal San Jacinto, para complacer los pedidos de sus clientes que son docentes y  trabajadores independientes. 
Sugeivis es muy feliz con su negocio y depende económicamente de él, además de tener  a cargo su abuela y una hermana; con su credikiva, comprará   hamacas, bolsos, juegos de cuarto, juegos de comedor y sillas en cuero que ya tiene encargado. Su principal meta es prosperar con el negocio, aumentar las ventas y lograr que este adquiera mayor reconocimiento de la comunidad, así mismo desea ayudar a su hermana para que siga estudiando. Entre sus desafíos cuenta que algunas veces se han presentado  clientes de difícil cobro, que  reaccionan de manera agresiva, pero finalmente ha sabido sortear cada situación y en el futuro esta experiencia le ha servido para seleccionarlos mejor, pues ella quiere progresar y ser muy exitosa por encima de todas las adversidades.
texts.en:
Sugeivis is a young woman that lives in San Jacinto, a population predominantly of hammock and backpack craftsmen, but there are also woodwork activities and a smaller number of shopkeepers. There Sugeivis has her own business called Furniture and Handicrafts of San Jacinto, for the past two years since she switched from her job as an electric household appliances shopkeeper to do the work she does today. She brings from Sampues, a municipality of the department of Sucre, rocking chairs and furniture sets for the living room and bedroom, and sells them in San Jacinto and in Valledupar. In the latter she also sells the famous handicrafts of her native San Jacinto to meet the requests of her clients that are teachers and independent workers. Sugeivis is very happy with her business and depends economically on it, in addition to having to care for her grandmother and a sister. With her Kiva credit, she will buy hammocks, bags, bedroom sets, dining room sets, and leather chairs that she has already ordered. Her main goal is to prosper with her business, increase her sales, and through this to receive more recognition in the community. Also, she wants to help her sister continue studying. Among her challenges, she says that sometimes she has customers that are difficult to collect from, that react in an aggressive matter, but she has finally figured out how to handle each situation and in the future this experience will help her make better selections. She wants to progress and be very successful despite all the adversities.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hammocks, bags, bedroom sets, dining room sets, and leather chairs which she has already ordered

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 38  años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de vendedora, ella trabaja con una empresa que vende productos de limpieza, ella ofrece estos productos a las diferentes tiendas que hay en la ciudad del Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa, para el estudio de su hija que estudia ingles.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, which belongs to the Cusco province, Cusco department. Rosa, age 38, is married and has two children. She combines her household chores with her work as a salesperson. She works for a company that sells cleaning products. She sells these products to different stores in the city of Cusco. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She wants to have a grocery store. She is requesting a loan for maintenance on her house and for her daughter’s education. Her daughter is studying English. She is grateful to those people who, through these means, form part of her dream . She promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House maintenance and her daughter's education

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Teofilo, tiene 38 años de edad él es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo el socio trabaja como preventista en cervesur que es una embotelladora de cerveza, el socio va a todas las diferentes tiendas de la zona central a preguntar si desean que se les haga el pedido para enviarles cuantas cajas de cervezas; El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar muebles para su hogar.  El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar unos muebles para su hogar.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Teofilo belongs to the Karoll Woktila Communal Bank. This bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Teofilo, age 38, is in a common-law marriage and has one child. He works as a pre-sales agent for Cervesur, a beer bottling company. He goes to all of the different stores in the central zone to ask if they want to place an order to have various cases of beer delivered. He is requesting the loan to buy furniture for his home. He is grateful for the loan granted by these means, and he promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture for his home

loans.name: Ima Sumacc

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ima Sumacc; ella tiene 30  años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de vestidos para todo tipo de ocasión como fiestas, matrimonios y quince años, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar su local para vender los vestidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para refaccionar su local y para comprar mostradores.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ima Sumacc belongs to the Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Ima Sumacc is 30 years old and single. She combines her household chores with the business of selling clothing for all occasions like parties, marriages, and 15th birthday celebrations. She works from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She wants to improve the location where she sells the clothing. She is requesting a loan to refurbish her place and to buy counters. She uses this forum to thank all those people who share in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish the location where she sells and buy counters

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Elsa; tiene 68 años de edad, la socia es divorciada, ella tiene 4 hijos y se dedica a la compra y venta de artefactos eléctricos, ella vende electrodomésticos desde hace 24 años y seta pronta a jubilarse, la socia también tiene como hobbie criar cuyes y solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y aves de corral para su casa.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Karoll Woktila community bank located in Huanchac in the Cuzco province in the city of Cuzco. Elsa is 68 years old, divorced, and has 4 children. She works buying and selling electronics. She has sold household appliances for 24 years and will soon retire. She also raises guinea pigs as a hobby and is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs and poultry for her house. She is thankful for the loan and promises to repay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano, de 49 años de edad, está casado y tiene siete hijos. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical cuzqueña, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, eso no fue un pretexto para que pueda seguir con su sueño de tener su propio negocio, es así que logró cultivar y producir café, ahora cuenta con compradores fieles que siempre acuden a él para conseguir la mejor calidad de este producto. Por otro lado, ambiciona tener un taller de planchado de pintura, solo así logrará obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir su canasta familiar. Es por ello que necesita trabajar para generarse el capital necesario para poner en práctica el taller que desea abrir. Normalmente tiene la ayuda de su familia, quienes le facilitan la extracción y selección de su producto agrícola, siendo estos vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está satisfecho con su banco comunal, debido a las buenas ventajas que lo ofrece. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de abono, con la finalidad de que lo pueda brindar un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Felciano is 49 and married with seven children. Together they live in the town of Quimbiri, located in the beautiful tropical jungle of Cusco, where they have their own house made of wood. In spite of having incomplete primary education, this was not an excuse to not continue with his dream to have his own business, and so he succeeded in cultivating and producing coffee. Now he has faithful buyers who always go to him for the high quality of this product. On the other hand, his ambition is to have an auto body shop, so he can obtain the necessary income to cover the basic needs of his family. It is because of this that he needs to work to generate the necessary capital to put into practice the workshop that he wants to open. Normally, he has the help of his family, who assist with the extraction and selection of his agricultural product, which is sold in the collection centers of their town. This is his sixth loan with MFP, for which he promises to continue following his payment schedule. He is satisfied with his communal bank, because of the good advantages it offers him. With the credit that he is asking for, he plans to buy fertilizer for the purpose of offering suitable protection for his coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to protect his coffee cultivations

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Roberto, tiene 52 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, el socio trabaja en su propio negocio, el tiene una carpintería en la calle Bolognesi, el socio desde hace 12 años trabaja en la carpintería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su carpintería, el desea comprar maquinas para implementar su carpintería.

 El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Roberto, a member of the “KAROLL WOKTILA” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Roberto is 52 years old, he lives with his live-in partner and has 3 children. He is a carpenter and he owns a carpenter’s shop in the calle Bolognesi (Bolognesi street). He has been a carpenter for 12 years. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tools for his shop: he wishes to buy machines to implement his shop. He his thankful for the loan that will be granted to him, and at the same time he commits to comply with the repayment of his dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for his carpenter's shop.

loans.name: Augusta Renee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Augusta Renee; ella tiene 55  años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cervezas y gaseosas, ella es propietaria de un bar que atiende desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, ella quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio y ampliar su local. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y cervezas para su bar.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Augusta Renee, a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Communal Bank, located in Wanchaq, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Augusta Renee is 55 years old, she is married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily chores with her job: she owns a pub where she sells beers and sodas and where she works from 10 am to 11 pm. As she wants to provide for her children, she wishes to improve her activity and extend her facility. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy beers and sodas for her pub. She is thankful to those who will form part of her dream through this loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sodas and beers for her pub.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen; ella tiene 29  años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio tienda escolar, ella vende golosinas, sándwich y refrescos en un colegio llamado San Juan de Dios  desde las 8:00 am hasta las 1:00 p.m y en las tardes trabaja en una institución en la parte administrativa, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio de tienda escolar que sea más grande. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos para su tienda escolar como galletas y golosinas.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II. The bank is located in the Wanchaq District, which belongs to the province of Cusco, Cusco Department. The member is Sra. Carmen. She is 29 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business, a school based store. From 8:00am until 1:00pm, she sells sweets, sandwiches and sodas at the San Juan de Dios school. In the afternoons, she works in the administrative part of an institution. Sra. Carmen wants to improve her school-based store by making it bigger. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase products, like cookies and sweets, for her store. The member thanks all those who are helping to make her dream come true with this loan, and she promises to comply with the re-payment of her loan in the established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan in order to purchase products, like cookies and sweets, for her school-based store.

loans.name: Dionisio Gabriel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Dionisio Gabriel; el tiene 70  años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio es propietario de un restaurant en unas de las calles de la ciudad del Cusco llamado Avenida Garcilaso en Santiago, el trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m  juntamente con su esposa sacan adelante a sus hijos por medio de este pequeño restaurant, el socio quiere tener una tienda venta de muebles más adelante. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar para su restaurant, el compra como arroz, carne y verduras al por mayor. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Dioniso Gabriel, a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Communal Bank, located in Wanchaq, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Dionisio Gabriel is 70 years old, he is married and has 4 children. He owns a restaurant in the town of Cusco: it is located in the Avenida Garcilaso en Santiago, and he works there form 9 am to 7 pm. Together with his wife, they provide for their children thanks to this small restaurant. In the future, he wishes to own a furniture sales shop. The loan he is requesting will be used for the wholesale purchase of cooking ingredients for his restaurant, such as rice, meat and vegetables. He is thankful to those who will help make his dream come true through this loan, and he commits to repaying his dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of products for his restaurant such as rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Maria; tiene 60 años D. edad ella es viuda y ya todos sus hijos son independientes, La socia se ha dedicado durante los últimos 20 años a vender ropa, ella tiene su stand en el mercado cascaparo y venD. lencería, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar D. su proveedora D. lencería y llenar su stand con nuevas propuestas.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Maria, a member of the “KAROLL WOKTILA” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Maria is 60 years old, she is a widow and all of her children are economically independent. During the past 20 years, she has been engaging in clothes sale: she has a stand in the Cascaparo market and sells linen goods. The loan she is requesting will be used for the wholesale purchase of linen goods and furnish her stand with new models. She is thankful for the loan that will be granted to her, and at the same time she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of linen goods.

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
Joven emprendedora de 39 años, soltera con un hijo, microempresaria, se dedica a la distribución de compra y venta de cervezas al por mayor y menor, actualmente tiene 150 cajas de cervezas, lleva ocho años desempeñándose en este negocio,  nos cuenta que le va muy bien, Rosa muestra siempre una valentía y le pone mucho entusiasmo a su trabajo, a pesar de los desafíos que pueda existir, a ella le sirve mucho para mejorar y darle lo mejor de si misma. 
Rosa también es propietaria de unas cabinas de internet, quien es su único hijo quien le apoya en la atención y administración de dicho negocio en horarios de la mañana, debido a sus estudios, ella se empeña mucho por trabajar e incrementar sus ganancias, en el futuro piensa expandir, mejorar y crecer como una empresa exportadora de cervecería. Darle la mejor educación a su hijo, y ofrecerle las comodidades que el requiere y espera alcanzar mas adelante..

El préstamo que se le otorgó le será útil para aumentar su capital, comprar mas cajas de cerveza, y así incrementar  más su negocio.
texts.en:
A young, 29 year old entrepreneur, single, mother of one son, micro business ower, she is a beer retailer and wholesaler. She currently has 150 cases of beer and has been in this business for 8 years. She tells us that she does quite well. Rosa is daring and always puts much enthusiasm into her work despite any challenge that might arise. Her work is of great value to her because it encourages her to improve and give the best of herself. Rosa also owns some Internet access booths and it’s her only son who helps her run this business during the morning hours because of his studies. She strives to increase her profits and plans to expand in the future, to improve and grow as a beer exporter, to provide her son with the best education possible and offer him the comforts he needs and expects to reach later on. The loan that was granted will be useful to increase working capital; she wil buy more cases of beer to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cases of beer.

loans.name: Faustino Rolando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Faustino Rolando; el tiene 75  años de edad y es viudo y tiene 5 hijos; El socio tiene un negocio de crianza de cerdos en el distrito de Poroy, también se dedica hacer servicio de taxi turístico, el trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,el socio le gustaría tener un lugar más grande para poder criar los cerdos ya que le gusta este trabajo ya que después lo vende  en las distintas ferias o también lo lleva a la ciudad del Cusco. El socio solicita el préstamo para  el negocio de crianza de chanchos, para comprar chanchos y alimentos. 
	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II. The bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province of Cuzco and the department of Cuzco. The member is Faustino Roland. He is 75 years old, is a widow, and has five children. The member has a business of raising pigs in the district of Poroy, and also works as a tourist taxi driver, working from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. The member would like to have a bigger place to be able to raise his pigs since he likes this work because later he sells them in different fairs or he also brings them to the city of Cuzco. The member asks for the loan for his business of raising pigs, in order to buy pigs and feed. The member is thankful to those that form a part of his dream through this means and he promises to fulfill the payment of his contributions in the established plan.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He asks for a loan for his business of raising pigs, to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Urbana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Urbana, tiene 57 años D. edad, la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, ella trabaja elaborando y vendiendo menus, la socia tiene un pequeño restaurante y se dedica a la cocina y todos los detalles que este le demanD.; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos y vasos para el restaurante.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Urbana, a member of the “KAROLL WOKTILA” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Urbana is 57 years old, she is married and has 5 children. She prepares and sells meals: she owns a small restaurant and takes care of the cooking and of every detail that this activity requires. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients and glasses for the restaurant. She is thankful for the loan that will be granted to her, and at the same time she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and glasses for her restaurant.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Silvia; ella tiene 35  años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de supervisora de una distribuidora de productos de limpieza, ella trabaja desde las 7:30 a.m hasta las 4:30 p.m por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para el estudio de sus hijos ya que están estudiando el idioma ingles en un instituto.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Silvia, a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Communal Bank, located in Wanchaq, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Silvia is 35 years old, she is married and has 2 children. On top of her everyday chores, she works as a supervisor for a cleaning products distribution company, working there from 7.30 am to 4:30 pm. Thanks to this job she can provide for her children. She would like to run a grocery store. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for the education of her children, who are studying English in an institute. She is thankful to those who will help making her dream come true through this loan, and she commits to comply with repaying her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena está casada y tiene un niño a su cargo. Su actividad es la brindar el servicio de joyería, por lo que tiene mucho clientes que le hacen diferentes estilos de pulsera, cadenas y anillos por lo que siempre se preocupa por proporcionar un excelente servicio y buena calidad en lo que ofrece, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado Santos Bárcenas, aquí circulan muchas personas pues le proporciona cierta ventaja. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital de trabajo, para comprar oro, plata, perlas entre otras cosas. Se siente muy dichosa de mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is married and has one child. She engages in selling jewelry: she has many customers who request different kinds of bracelets, chains and rings, and for this reason she always tries to provide an excellent service and to offer good quality products. Her shop is located in the Santos Bárcenas market, a good spot for her as it is visited by many people. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital and to buy gold, silver, and pearls among other jewelry items. She feels lucky to be able to improve her incomes to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Gloria; 39 años D. edad y es soltera, ella se dedica desD.  hace dos años a la elaboración D. viandas, la socia venD. comida D. forma ambulatoria, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ingredientes, ella desea comprar unas ollas y aceite y productos al por mayor.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Gloria, a member of the “KAROLL WOKTILA” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Gloria is 39 years old, she is single and since two years she has been working as a street vendor selling the meals she prepares. The loan she is requesting will be used for the wholesale purchase of tools and ingredients such as pans and oil. She is thankful for the loan that will be granted to her, and at the same time she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots and oil.

loans.name: Itala

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Itala; tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es natural de sicuani y es casa y tiene 2 hijos, ella es profesora trabaja en el distrito de Chacan, perteneciente a la provincia de  Anta, La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en algunos acabados de sus hogar, la socia esta trasladándose de casa y desea pintar algunas habitaciones y comprar algunas cosas para su nuevo departamento. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su nueva casa.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Itala, a member of the “KAROLL WOKTILA” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Itala is 37 years old, she comes from Sicuani, she is married and has 2 children. She is a teacher and she works in the Chacan district, located in the Anta province. The loan she is requesting will be used to do some works in her new house. She is moving from her old house and she wants to paint some rooms and to buy some new things for her new apartment. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the improvement of her new house. She is thankful for the loan that will be granted to her, and at the same time she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the improvement of her new house.

loans.name: German

texts.es: Germán tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Germán, sostiene que en un mundo de negocios, “las relaciones son muy importantes, ya que determina el éxito de la persona”, bajo esa frase, empezó a congeniarse con sus clientes potenciales, como clientes nuevos, con el propósito de que pueda ofrecer las bondades de su producto de café, de la cual le resultaba buenos ingresos económicos. No contento con ello, incursionó en otro negocio, con la necesidad de que pueda diferenciarse antes sus demás competencia, es así que tienen una tienda de abarrotes, actividad que se hace cargo su querida esposa. En ocasiones trata de ayudar en este nuevo negocio, ya que más tiempo pasa en sus cultivos de café, en donde trabaja de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 del mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde y su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma localidad. Normalmente recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero en tiempo de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, ya que de esa manera permitirá que extraigan su producto final. Su plan a futuro es incursionar en otra actividad, como la venta de ropa, con el propósito de sus ingresos aumenten de manera considerable, y a la vez tenga una buena calidad de vida. Este es su segunda cuota con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contento con su banco comunal, ya que le permite ahorrar, fruto de las ganancias que percibe en su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías, de esa manera podrá implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Germán is 38 years old, married, and has three children. They live in the town of Quimbiri, located in the beautiful Peruvian rainforest, where they have their own house made of wood. Germán says that, in the world of business, “Relationships are very important, as it is these that will determine how successful a person will be”. Germán began to associate with his potential clients with the aim of getting them interested in his coffee-selling business, from which he receives a good income. Not content with this, Germán made inroads into another business in order to distinguish himself from the competition. He therefore owns a grocery shop, which is managed by his beloved wife. Germán sometimes helps with this new business; however, he is normally busy cultivating his coffee plantations from Monday to Saturday, 7am till 6pm, and also sells his products in the locality. He normally receives help from his family, but during harvest time he relies on farm workers to assist him, which helps him with the entire harvesting process. Germán’s future plans include being able to sell clothes in order to substantially increase his income, whilst at the same time improve his standard of living. This is his second loan with MFP, and Germán promises to faithfully abide by the terms of the loan agreement. He is also happy with his community bank as it allows him to save from the profits of his business. With this loan, Germán wants to purchase merchandise for his shop and therefore be able to vary his wares.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Vilma Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma Roxana; ella tiene 27  años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de profesora del nivel inicial y también tiene un negocio de servicio de internet que trabaja desde las 2:00 a.m hasta las 10:30 p.m por medio de estos trabajos puede sacar adelante a su pequeña hija,la socia quiere ampliar  y mejorar el negocio de internet. La socia solicita mejorar el servicio de internet y comprar una computadora.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Introducing Vilma Roxana, a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Communal Bank, located in Wanchaq, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Vilma Roxana is 27 years old, she is married and has 1 daughter. She alternates her everyday chores with two job activities: she teaches in primary school and she runs an Internet services facility which is open form 2 am to 10:30 pm. Thanks to these activities she is able to provide for her young daughter. She would like to implement and improve the Internet activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy a computer to improve the Internet service she offers. She is thankful to those who will form part of her dream through this loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer to improve the Internet services she offers.

loans.name: Matilde Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Matilde, tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella administra una empresa de transportes en el terminal terrestres, desde hace 9 años, La socia junto a otros amigos decidieron tomar parte de este banco para poder incrementar sus negocios y tener otro ingreso extra . La socia requiere el dinero para invertirlo en la educación de sus hijos en el colegio y jardín.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “KAROLL WOKTILA”. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. Matilde is 34 years old, married and has three children. For the last 9 years she has managed a transport company in the bus terminal. Along with her friends, she decided to take part in this bank in order to grow her business and have some extra income. She needs the money to invest in the education of her children in elementary school and kindergarten. She is thankful for the loan through this medium and similarly commits herself to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To educate her children

loans.name: Elmer Jules

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Elmer; tiene 39 años de edad, el socio es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el socio trabaja como empleado desde hace 15 años en la agencia de turismo Real, el socio está necesitando un capital para poner un nuevo negocio que por tratarse de una cábala el prefiere mantenerlo en secreto hasta que lo haga realidad.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “KAROLL WOKTILA”. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. Elmer is 39 years old, married and has two children. He has worked for the last 15 years as an employee of the Real tourism agency. He needs capital to launch a new business that, due to a superstition, he prefers to keep a secret until it becomes a reality. He is thankful for the loan through this medium and similarly commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in a new project

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Carlos; el tiene 29  años de edad y es soltero, el socio tiene un negocio de producción de alimentos, el los produce productos como haba, trigo y cebadas y después lo vende en diferentes tiendas y centros comerciales, el socio trabaja en forma independiente, él socio quiere tener un molino  y ampliar su pequeño negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar los productos al por mayor como haba y trigo. 
	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”. This bank is located in the district of Wanchaq in the province and department of Cusco. Carlos is 29 years old and single. He has a food production business. He produces beans, wheat and barley and then sells them in various stores and commercial centers. He works independently. He wants to have a mill and expand his small business. He is seeking the loan to buy the goods, such as beans and wheat, wholesale. He is grateful to those that through this medium form part of this dream, and he commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beans and wheat wholesale.

loans.name: Rogelio Javier

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio tiene 32 años. Es soltero y propietario de una carnicería desde el año 2008.
 Su negocio esta ubicado sobre la Avda. Manuel Ortiz Guerreo (camino que une las Ciudades de San Lorenzo y Ñemby).
El necesita de este crédito para adquirir carne vacuna en planchas, pues ha aumentado su clientela al por mayor  y quiere cumplir con los pedidos de estos, para afianzar su trabajo con ellos y poder contar con un mayor ingreso en  sus ventas. En el futuro desea construir su propio salón en donde poder instalar su carnicería y ahorrar los gastos de alquiler.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 32 years old. He is single and owner of a butcher’s shop since 2008. The business is located on Manuel Ortiz Guerreo Avenue (a road that unites the cities of San Lorenzo and Ñemby). He needs the loan in order to acquire strips of beef wholesale, since his clientele has increased and he wants to meet the demand for these, strengthen his business and be able to count on a greater income from his sales. In the future he wishes to construct his own room where he can install his butcher shop and save the rental costs.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale beef, sausages and pork.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Elvis; tiene 38 años de edad, e socio es soltero y trabaja en la empresa de transportes y cargas, encargado de las encomiendas, el socio también apoya a su familia con el negocio familiar ellos tiene una tienda y el desea el préstamo para invertir en implementar el negocio de su mama y comprar aceite, arroz, azúcar y otros.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “KAROLL WOKTILA”. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. Elvis is 38 years old, single and works in the transport and delivery company. He is in charge of deliveries. He also supports his family in the family business. They have a store, and he wants the loan to invest in the implementation of his mother’s business and to buy oil, rice, sugar etc. He is thankful for the loan through this medium and similarly commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock a grocery store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. is a hairdresser who also sells hair creams and weave-ons (hair extensions) at Elmina. She has received junior high education and is married with two children. She responsibly supports her husband in providing the basic needs of her family.

Nancy’s loan will be used to buy more hair products to sell. She plans on using the new earnings from her business to save towards furthering her children’s education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more hair products for sale.

loans.name: Neyer

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Neyer;  tiene 37 años de edad, el socio es casado y tiene trabajando 8 años como administrador en el terminal de una empresa de transportes llamada Civa, el socio tiene 3 hijos y solicita el préstamo para la educación de sus menores hijos y algunos otros gastos en el hogar. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus menores hijos.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “KAROLL WOKTILA”. THis bank is located in the Huanchac district, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco. The member, Neyer, is 37 years old. He is married and has been working for 8 years as a manager in the terminal of a transportation business called Civa. He has 3 children and is asking for the loan for his youngest childrens' education as well as for some other household expenses. He is asking for the loan to invest in his youngest children's education. This member is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments according to the agreed schedule. .

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his children's education

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is married and has three children. She has been through junior high school.

Ama prepares banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) at Elmina. Her husband is a trader. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Ama will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare more banku for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to establish a banku shop where people can sit comfortably to enjoy their food.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare more banku for sale

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Sra. M. tiene 38 años. Esta casada con el Sr. Jacinto Calcena tienen una hija que esta en la Universidad.
Poseen casa propia en la ciudad de Fernando de la Mora.
La Sra. Maria alquila un local en San Lorenzo hace 5 años donde trabaja en la confección y costuras de vestidos y ropas de todo tipo. 
El Sr. Jacinto tiene un carrito de venta de hamburguesas y panchos en la ciudad de San Lorenzo sobre una de las avenida mas transitadas de la ciudad.
 La Sra. Maria necesita de este crédito para adquirir mercaderías en cantidad a menor precio.
 En el futuro desean abrir una sucursal en la ciudad de Luque donde también hay mucho movimiento comercial.
texts.en:
M. is 38 years old. She is married to Mr. Jacinto Calcena and they have a daughter who is in college. They own their own home in the city of Fernando de la Mora. Maria has rented a locale in San Lorenzo for 5 years, where she works making and sewing dresses and clothing of all types. Jacinto has a cart from which he sells hamburgers and hotdogs in the city of San Lorenzo, on one of the busiest streets in the city. Maria needs this loan to adquire merchandise in bulk at a lower pirce. In the future, they want to open another locale in the city of Luque, where there is also a lot of commercial activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, thread, buttons, appliques, etc. to make clothing

loans.name: Maame Esi

texts.en:
Maame Esi D. prepares shea butter (a natural fat extracted from the seed of the African shea tree and widely used in cosmetics as a moisturizer and salve) at Elmina for sale. She is married to a trader and has four children. She has no formal educational background. Maame feeds the family as a way of supporting her husband in taking care of the home.

Esi will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare her shea butter for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she hopes to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare shea butter for sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica N. sells provisions at Elmina. She has received junior high education and is married with three children. Her husband is a trader. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Monica’s loan will be used to buy extra provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to complete her building.

loans.use: To buy extra provisions for her store

loans.name: Juana Oilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana tiene 61 años. Esta casada con Eugenio Rojas, tienen tres hijos, dos mayores y uno menor de edad. Ella tiene su taller de confección en su domicilio desde el año 2005.
Ella necesita de este crédito para adquirir tela polar para la confección de prendas para damas y niños de temporada invierno. Ella ya tiene varios pedidos para confeccionar buzos para niños en edad escolar.
 En el futuro desea contar con un mayor numero de maquinas ya industriales para poder aumentar su producción y ampliar su pequeña empresa familiar.
texts.en:
Juana, age 60, is married to Eugenio Rojas. They have three children. Two of them are adults, and one is still a dependent. Her workshop has been in her home since 2005. She needs this loan to get polar fleece to make women’s and children’s winter clothes. She has various orders to make sweatshirts for school age children. In the future she wants to have more industrial machines in order to be able to increase her production and expand her small family business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and accessories to make clothes

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: Hilario tiene 32 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos; Jhon y Yoselin, de 7 y 3 años respectivamente. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propio techo a base de madera. En un principio, cuando se inició en la actividad agricola, cultivando y comercializando café, no lo estaba yendo, tal como él se lo había imaginado. Pero como a él le gustan los retos, no le tuvo miedo a lo que se venía, es así que insistió y se intensificó en esta labor, hoy produce cantidad de café, que son distribuidos a sus compradores asiduos. Se siente muy contento por lo que viene atravesando, incluso sus ventas aumentaron con respecto a los anteriores meses. Por lo general trabaja  con su esposa y juntos laboran de manera colectiva, pero en temporada de cosecha, tiene a cargo de sus peones, con la finalidad de que les pueda facilitar la extracción de su producto final, siendo estos vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. En el futuro, Hilario anhela comprar un lote de terreno, en la ciudad de Huanta, con la finalidad de que pueda construir su casa y con el tiempo pueda alquilar cuartos, ello lo generaría nuevos ingresos económicos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, tal como lo hizo en los anteriores préstamos, además está satisfecho con su banco comunal, debido al buen comportamiento y compromiso de sus socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, con la finalidad de que pueda preservar la calidad de sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Hilario is 32 years old, he is married and has two children, Jhon and Yoselin, aged respectively 7 and 3. They all live in the Quimbiri settlement, located at the edge of the Peruvian rainforest, where they own a wooden house. At first, when he started engaging in the agriculture activity of planting and selling coffee, things were not going as he had imagined; but as he likes challenges, he did not worry about the future and, insisting on it and intensifying this activity, he now produces a good quantity of coffee that he sells to his regular customers. He is very happy about his success, and his sales have increased compared to the previous months as well. His wife generally works with in team with him, but for the harvest season he contracts laborers, in order to more easily crop his final products, that are to be sold to the local collection centers. In the future, Hilario wishes to buy some land in the town of Huanta, in order to build a house for his family and to be able, in time, to rent rooms, as this would generate new incomes. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he commits to keeping on repaying his dues, the same way he did with his previous loans; he is also satisfied with his communal bank because of its members’ commitment and good behavior. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy materials and fertilizers in order to preserve the quality of his coffee plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to protect his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La Sra. Herminia   es separada de hecho ,tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad . 
Ella trabaja en el mercado San Lorenzo desde muy joven   vendiendo  calzados usados por  la calle con su tía  ,gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logro mantener a toda su familia . 
El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de  mercaderías  en cantidad como remera ,shor ,pantalón,blusas,camisillas y así abaratar el costo.
Herminia   anhela poder construir un salón y ofrecer mejor servicios a sus cliente.
texts.en:
Hermina is separated. She has four adult children. Ever since she was very young she has worked at the San Lorenzo market. She sells used footwear on the street with her aunt. Thanks to her efforts and dedication she managed to support her whole family. The loan will help buy large quantities of merchandise like t-shirts, shorts, pants, blouses, and tank-tops. That way the price will be cheaper. Herminia wishes to be able to build a parlor to offer her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
