loans.use: Buy large quantities of merchandise

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El Sr. Faustino  tiene 38 años y vive con su hermana.
 El desde muy joven empezó a trabajar  como limpiador de parada de taxi y luego como chofer, gracias a su esfuerzo logro comprar un vehículo y trabajar en el. 
El necesita de este crédito para la compra de cubiertas, también  realizar algunos arreglos que le  falta al vehículo  y de esta manera  brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Faustino   anhela  comprar otro vehículo y así obtener mejor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Faustino is 38 years old, and he lives with his sister. When he was very young he started working as a cleaner of a taxi stop. Then, he became a driver. Thanks to his efforts, he managed to buy a vehicle for work. He needs the loan to buy tires and to make some needed repairs on his vehicle. This way he will provide his customers with better service. Faustino is eager to buy another vehicle to get a better income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Sabanalamarino Unidos 1 Group

texts.en:
Barbara is the coordinator of her group, Sabanalamarino Unidos 1 (Sabanalamarino Together). "Sabanalamarino" is the name people receive when they were born in Sabana D. la Mar, a fishing village. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to educate her children. In the meantime, she enjoys being with her family at home.

Barbara is excited to be taking out her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for over five years, starting when she asked her father for the opportunity to sell seafood, buying it from him and other friends. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying some pounds of fish and different kinds of seafood. She will use the profits to invest in the education of her children and to have a bigger home.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she liked how the loans work, and she needed to invest in her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area around the coast called Sabana D. la Mar, a fishing village, surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy fish and sea food

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas De Serro Alto Group

texts.es:
MUJERES VICTORIOSAS DE SERRO ALTO.
DOÑA FELISA S. S. DE 32 AÑOS,  ES CASADA, VIVE EN CASERIO REAL WIT EN ALDEA CERRO ALTO ELLA ES LA LIDER DE ESTE GRUPO  Y TIENE 6 HIJOS, ES DUEÑA DE UNA TIENDA DE VENTA DE PRODUCTOS PARA CONSUMO DIARIO, SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER SURTIR MAS SU NEGOCIO YA QUE QUIERE VENDER FRUTAS Y VERDURAS YA QUE EN EL CASERIO  NO HAY TIENDA CERCANA Y EL PUEBLO PARA COMPRAR VERDURAS Y FRUTAS ESTA MUY RETIRADO POR LO TANTO ELLA SOLICITA  ESTE PRESTAMO PARA PODER LLEVAR  ACABO SUS PLANES.  TAMBIEN  DOÑA MARIA ROSA C. C. DE 32 AÑOS ES PARTE DE ESTE GRUPO,  ELLA VIVE EN CASERIO REAL WIT CERRO ALTO, TIENE 1 HIJO, ES MADRE SOLTERA Y SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE HUEVOS Y CRIANZA DE POLLOS, Y DOÑA DORA AMALIA M. R. TIENE 3 HIJOS, VIVE EN SAN JUAN SACATEPEQUEZ,  TIENE 30 AÑOS, ELLA TIENE UNA FARMACIA Y VENTA DE COSMETICOS POR CATALOGO
texts.en:
Mujeres Victoriosas ("Victorious Women") Dona Felisa S. S. is 32 years old. She is married and lives in a small rural community called Real Wit, near the village of Cerro Alto. She is the leader of the "Mujeres Victoriosas" communal bank. She has 6 children, and is the owner of a grocery store. She is seeking this loan to expand her business. She would like to sell fruit and vegetables, as there is no other store in the community where people can buy these, and the community itself is quite isolated. She is therefore seeking the loan to put her plan of selling fruit and vegetables into action. Dona Maria Rosa C. C., also 32, is also a member of the group. She too lives in Real Wit, Cerro Alto. She is the single mother of one son, and she dedicates her time to raising chickens and selling eggs. Dona Dora Amalia M. R., the third member of the group, has 3 children. She is 30 years old and lives in San Juan Sacatepequez. She has a drugstore and also sells cosmetics through a catalogue.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Productos de consumo diario

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married. She is a seamstress at Elmina. She has been educated up to the senior high level. Ekua uses her revenue from her sales to help her husband take care of the home. She supports her husband in taking care of the home. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more lining and cloth to sew for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to open up a shop in a different locality.

loans.use: purchase more lining and cloth to sew

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir I. is 51 years old and he makes a living buying and selling livestock. He's married with three children. Over the years, he has become very knowledgeable about what is required to raise cattle, their feeding, their calving, etc. He sells cattle to the local farmers and butchers. His monthly income ranges between about $315 and $415.

Now Mahir has applied for 1,000 AZN in order to purchase more cattle and increase his income. The loan will greatly improve Mahir’s income and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: purchase three baby calves

loans.name: El Buen Futuro 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, El Buen Futuro 1 (The Good Future). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her nine children, eight of whom live with her after she raised them as a single mom. She says that her most difficult challenge is to support her nine children.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying taking care of her children.

Santa is excited to be taking out her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over eight years.  Four months ago she changed and moved her business. She started with a small butcher shop in the public market of her community. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in her butcher shop and food sales (fried pork) by buying different kinds of meats. She will use the profits to repair her house and save for her future. She wants to have a better home structure and live well and quietly with her family. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to invest in her business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy meats

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq R. is a hardworking man who works in the cattle raising business. He is married with four children. He works hard to provide everything his family needs. Presently, Rafiq is sacrificing and working hard to make his business grow. He buys young calves, then raise them and sells for a profitable price to the local butchers.

He is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN that will allow him to purchase young calves. He plans to feed and raise these cows. His goal is to then get the most return from the sale of the cows' milk products. This will be his first loan with AqroInvest CU and Kiva. His experience and our evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

loans.use: To purchase three young calves

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.en:
Sharafat A. is very hardworking woman. Sharafat is single and lives with her parents. She tries to make more money for the family by working hard each day. About 3 years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. She raises calves and later sells dairy products  according to her clients' demand at the markets.  Her monthly income is 150-250 AZN. She prepares the dairy products for the eating pleasure of the people in her area.

Since Sharafat hopes for a great future, she decided to expand her businesses with the purpose of improving her family's living conditions. For this purpose she applied for 800 AZN and will buy one additional milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase one calf

loans.name: Lutviyar

texts.en: Lutviyar M. is 44, married with three children, lives in the small village of Saatli district, where he now works as a farmer. His main business is agriculture and livestock breeding, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. Lutviyar owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables. Due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy seeds, fertilizer and calves. The loan will greatly improve Lutviyar’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and two calves

loans.name: Agasef

texts.en:
Agasef A. is a man who has dedicated himself to the livestock industry from his childhood. He has been characterized as a very spirited and strong person who supports his young family, composed of his wife and  one son.

The work Agasef does is the raising of livestock for eventual sale and also from selling milk and milk products. It is necessary to point out that this is the only income that supports his family's needs. With the first loan from AqroInvest and KIVA,  Agasef was able to purchase cattle and from the income it generated he bought sheep. Now his monthly income is about 250-300 AZN.

Today, Agasef looks for second loan from AqroInvest to obtain the necessary loan to purchase one cow and six sheep to raise. He has a successful client history and AqroInvest's trust.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and six sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more agricultural equipment

loans.name: La Bendicion 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group La Bendicion 1, 2 & 4 (Bless). She makes her home here in a simple home with 4 of her 9 children and her long time partner. She says that her most difficult challenges is to raise and provide for her family.  She plans to continue enjoying visiting the church and singing to the Lord.

Ana is excited to be taking her 9th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and increased her business. She has had her business for over 7 years, starting after she realized the need to earn extra incoming for her family. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, shirts, underwear and shoes. She will use the profits to buy some school supplies her children and to invest in her business. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because a family group was formed in her community and invited her. She was in need of money to improve her sales and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican  clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her stall.

loans.name: Oneida Concepción

texts.es:
Oneida P. es una mujer muy empresaria que desde hace muchos años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización de la que ha recibido ocho financiamientos;   Oneida es muy destacada por su amabilidad, buena fe y capacidad de asesorar a las personas,  lo cual hace que quien la conozca la aprecie, especialmente  sus clientes, porque ella tiene un negocio donde vende vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños, que inició buscando la oportunidad de obtener ingresos sin descuidar a sus hijos; así fue como “regando pequeños artículos, que compraba en promoción y con descuentos,  entre vecinos y familiares llegó a consolidar su actividad comercial. Gradualmente su disciplina y buen manejo de la inversión permitió el aumento de sus ingresos y la oportunidad de hacer créditos con la Fundación y en la actualidad obtener un credikiva, para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, calzado, jeans y en general ropa femenina y masculina, que ella tiene encargada porque se acerca  el día del amor y la amistad y sus clientes quieren vestirse elegante y obsequiar detalles para llenar de alegría a su pareja y a las personas que aman.
Con su negocio ha podido influir en el mejoramiento de las condiciones de su hogar, así como ayudó a adecuar su vivienda, que al principio fue un lote y hoy tiene una casa completa que día a día intenta mejorar ;  Oneida vive en un barrio del sur de Barranquilla con sus dos hijos en las edades de 21 y 25 años; con los financiamientos de la Fundación Oneida ha logrado educarlos, uno de ellos ya es tecnólogo y el otro cursa una carrera universitaria; y es que su principal sueño, es el que sus hijos lleguen a profesionalizarse muy bien,  para que sean competitivos en el mercado laboral.
Su desafío mas relevante es la recuperación de su cartera constantemente, pero ella  siempre está pendiente de asumir nuevas estrategias para conseguir los mejores clientes y proteger su capital.
texts.en:
Oneida P. is a very entrepreneurial woman who for many years has been associated with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organisation from which she has received eight loans. Oneida is well known for her friendly, trustworthy and accessible nature, which means that she is well liked, particularly by her customers as she has a clothes-selling business for ladies, men and children. Oneida started her business as she was looking for something that would increase her earnings whilst still being able to care for her children. Oneida grew her business by “selling small items”, which she had bought on offer or discount, to neighbours and family members. Gradually, her perseverance, able management, and loans from the Fundación allowed her to increase her income. This current loan from credikiva will be used to buy blouses, footwear, jeans and general men’s, women’s and children’s clothing for the purposes of Valentine’s Day, which is coming up and people wish to look nice and buy gifts for their partners and loved ones. Oneida’s business has allowed her to improve her standard of living and turn her home into a pleasant environment. Initially her house started out as a plot of land but has gradually been improved upon. Oneida lives in a neighbourhood in the south of Barranquilla with her two children ages 21 and 25 years. She has managed to put her children through school using the loans provided by the Fundación. One of her children is a technician and the other is studying at a university. Oneida’s dream is for her children to become fully professional in order to be able to compete in the job market. Oneida’s most notable challenge is to continue to make ends meet but she is always keen to adopt new strategies to be able to build her client base and protect her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, footwear, jeans and general men and women's attire as Valentine's Day is approaching

loans.name: Florecitas De Villa Hermosa Group

texts.es: Maribel tiene una hija que aun esta en la escuela, a sus 31 años es conviviente y comparte los gastos del hogar con su pareja el cual trabaja D. chofer privado, eventualmente, se desempeña D. ama D. casa, además venD. ropas y comida desD. hace ya 5 años, teniendo 4 años trabajando ya con Edaprospo ah comprado una Laptop a su hija y espera tener un buen capital para poner su propio restauran.Ella ah cumplido ya 4 años como presidenta del grupo “Las Florecitas D. Villa Hermosa” conformado por 11 amigas y vecinas las cuales viven en la zona D. Villa Hermosa, esperan alcanzar sus propósitos con la ayuda del capital brindado por Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Maribel, with a daughter still in school, is 31 years old and in a common law union, sharing household expenses with her partner, who is a private chauffeur. At first, she was a housewife, then in addition, Maribel began selling clothes and food. She has done this for 5 years. Maribel has worked with Edaprospo for 4 years. She has bought a laptop for her daughter and now, she hopes to accumulate capital to open her own restaurant. Maribel has just completed 4 years as president of “Las Florecitas D. (The Little Flowers of) Villa Hermosa Group, which is composed of 11 friends and neighbors who live in the Villa Hermosa zone. They hope to achieve their goals with the help of capital offered by Edaprospo.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRODUCTS AND SUPPLIES FOR THEIR BUSINESSES

loans.name: La Bendicion 5 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group La Bendicion 5 (Bless). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to make a business.  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).  Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Margarita is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over four years, starting with some savings she had.  She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying bags of used clothing. She will use the profits to buy more bags and improve her business. She is also planning to save and buy a house to live with her family and stop paying rent.

loans.use: To buy some bags of used clothing

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Don Porfirio es un señor de 45 años de edad, reside en la colonia Morazán de San Francisco Gotera, él es casado y vive con su esposa, un hijo de 24 años de edad y un nieto de 2 años que dependen de él, 
Él tiene 10 años de experiencia en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, el negocio es atendido por él, su esposa y su hijo, además su esposa se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde en una pequeña granja.
Él necesita un préstamo para la compra de productos como, frijol, arroz, azúcar, aceite para ofrecer en su tienda.
Este préstamo ayudara a Don Porfirio a incrementar su capital de inversión y ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos necesarios para el Hogar, aumentando así sus ingresos familiares.
Sus aspiraciones son lograr aumentar su negocio, obtener mayores ventas que le brinden una mayor estabilidad económica y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Porfirio is 45 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Morazán de San Francisco Gotera. He is married and lives with his wife, 24-year-old son, and 2-year-old grandson that are all dependant on him. He has 10 years of experience in selling basic staples. His wife and son both help him run the business, plus his wife raises broiler chickens on a small farm. He needs a loan to purchase products such as beans, rice, sugar, and oil to sell in his store. This loan will help Don Porfirio increase his capital investment to be able to offer his customers a wider variety of home products, thereby increasing his family income. His goal is to increase his business and sell more goods to provide his family with greater economic stability and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic staples like beans, rice, sugar

loans.name: Prosperidad Leal Group

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Gladys tiene 50 años de edad es Secretaria del Grupo “Prosperidad Leal”, vive en Chaclacayo, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vendía jugos y ensaladas, de esto ya hace 5 años, lleva 1 año trabajando con Edaprospo, Ella esta contenta con su fuente de soda llamado “SIWASE”, no obstante últimamente ha implementado un mostrador para la venta de pasteles y dulces. Junto a sus vecinas de la zona, amigas y señoras responsables se han unido para alcanzar con la ayuda de Edaprospo sus metas y esperan mejorar su forma de vida y en particular la señora Gladys espera poder poner otro local, el prestamo que ha recibido estara destinado para la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Gladys is 50 years old and lives in Chaclacayo, she is married and has two children. She has been selling juices and salads for the last 5 years and for the past year she has been Secretary of the “Prosperidad Leal” (Loyal Prosperity) Group which has been working with Edaprospo for one year, She is happy with her source of soda called “SIWASE” and recently she has installed a counter for selling cakes and sweets. Together with her neighbors in the area, friends and responsible ladies they have got together to achieve, with the help of Edaprospo, their goals and they hope to improve their way of life and, in particular Gladys hopes to be able to set up another stall.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE PRODUCTS AND RAW MATERIALS

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday is 34 years old. He is married to a trader, and has one child who is six years old. He has nine additional dependents who live with him because they need assistance from him. In 1990, Foday established his alcoholic drinks business. He began his business because he could not further his education after high school. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about 1,812,400 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Foday requires a loan in order to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 571,860 SLL.  In the future, Foday plans to educate his child to university level and buy a piece of land. He also plans to rent a shop and sell wholesale. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more assorted drinks to sell in his shop

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Betzaida is the coordinator of her group Luz y Progreso 1 & 2 (light and progress). She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband.

Betzaida is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years, starting with a loan she took after a friend taught her to sell jewelry. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different kinds of silver jewelry.  She will use the profits to continue studying, and to improve her business. She dreams of having her own children and becoming a big family. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she likes the program and her business has been improving with the loans.  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).  Her group is located in L. Arcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free traD. zones are common.  This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: The Women´s Bank ¨women Of Faith¨ Group

texts.en:
The name of this group translates as The Women´s Bank ¨Women of Faith.¨ The nine women members live in Pococi, Limon, located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. 

This will be the group's first loan with Fundación Mujer. The members of this group were referred to Fundación Mujer by an acquaintance in a nearby village who had had a positive experience with the organization in the past. The name of this group, ¨Women of Faith¨ was chosen by the members and to them, it signifies that each member is a woman of faith  who is optimistic and confident that she will be successful in her endeavours.  These entrepreneurs feel that with hard work and dedication, they will have great success. 

During the Women´s Empowerment classes (which accompany the issuance of all loans granted from Fundación Mujer to groups of this size), the members of this group displayed exceptional interest in learning how best to manage their micro-businesses. They have acquired skills that provide a solid foundation on which to launch a small business in a way to maximize revenue and reduce costs. Additionally, the women who have been elected to the Board of Directors (Secundina, Yorleny, Carmen and Angela) possess a wealth of knowledge  and experience acquired by working with  women´s groups. This wisdom will surely be valuable as this group moves forward. 

The women of this group are involved mainly in two types of productive activities : pig rearing and the production of bread and tamales. Each individual member will receive 150,000 Colones  to invest in her business as she sees fit. The women involved in pig rearing will use this loan to purchase piglets as well as animal feed. The women involved in food production will use this loan to purchase raw materials necessary for bread and tamale production. Tamales are a staple Costa Rican food eaten all year round and especially around Christmas time.  

Secundina B. C. is a 54-year-old mother of 5 who lives with her husband and two children in Pococi. She is also the elected president of this group. Secundina plans to use this loan to invest in ingredients to make bread and tamales which she will sell in her community. She starts selling her products in the street at 8 AM every day, and she works until everything is sold.  A main obstacle for Secundina and other members of this group has been a lack of access to working capital, the high cost of raw materials, and difficulty securing a consistent market for her (their) goods.  Secundina´s main goal is to secure a fixed market for her goods, so as to secure a steady flow of income and to allow her to spend more time producing goods instead of spending so much time selling her products in the street. 

Secundina admits there are advantages and disadvantages to the group lending model. She says that the model allows women who would otherwise be denied a loan, the ability to secure startup capital. This is because many women in the Pococi community do not know anyone with a constant salary who can act as a guarantor. This debilitating factor is overcome by the group model, whereby each member acts as a guarantor for other group members. Secundina notes that a disadvantage of her group is that she fears some of the members may have trouble repaying their loans, but she is nevertheless a ¨Woman of Faith.¨

loans.use: For the purchase of piglets, animal feed, and raw materials for bread making.

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es: Sara es conviviente, tiene 40 años D. edad y forma parte del grupo “Cristo Salvador” el cual lleva 8 años trabajando con edaprospo. Ella venD. golosinas desD. hace 1 año y dice que si tuviera un buen capital D. dinero pondría su propia bodega y así ayudaría mejor a sus 2 hijos que aun están en la escuela. Junto a los demás miembros del grupo los cuales son sus vecinos y comparten la misma devoción por Jesús, se han puesto D. acuerdo para darse la mano y mejorar juntos su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Sara, 40, lives with a partner and is part of the group "Cristo Salvador," which has been working with EDAPROSPO for 8 years. She has been selling candy for a year, and says that if she had enough capital she would have her own store and in this way she could better help her 2 children who are in school. She and the other members of the group, who are her neighbors and share her devotion to Jesus, have agreed to join hands and improve their quality of life together.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and supplies

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 30 años, está casada y fruto de ellos, tienen dos hijos; Kevin y Franco, de 11 y 4 años respectivamente. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. Margarita, produce café y lo comercializa a un precio competitivo, parte de su éxito radica en la  buena atención hacia sus compradores, por lo que procura siempre en obtener café de calidad. Esto ha hecho que tenga protagonismo dentro del comercio cafetalero, por tal tiene resultados gratificantes y positivas con respecto a otros años. Por lo general trabaja en compañía de su esposo, pero en temporada de cosecha contrata peones para que le faciliten la extracción del  producto final, siendo estos vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad. Su plan a futuro es construir su casa a base de material noble, con la finalidad de que le pueda brindar seguridad y felicidad a su familia. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además está conforme por el buen trabajo de su banco comunal.
Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de que pueda aumentar su producción de café, para que de esa manera pueda atender la demanda.
texts.en:
Margarita, age 30, is married and has two children. Kevin is 11 years old, and Franco is 4 years old. They live together in the beautiful Peruvian tropical jungle in Quimbiri. They have their own house, which is made of wood. Margarita produces coffee and sells it for a competitive price. Part of her success stems from the good service she gives her buyers. She always tries to get quality coffee. This has made her a prominent coffee merchant. She has had gratifying and positive results in past years. She generally works with her husband. However, during harvest time she hires laborers to gather the final product. It will be sold at collection centers in her community. Her future plan is to build her house from sturdy material so that her family will be safe and happy. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She pledges to faithfully make her payments. Also, she is pleased with her communal bank’s good work. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy land to cultivate. That way she will be able to increase her coffee production in order to be able to meet the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land to extend her coffee crops

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia R. R. es una mujer muy sabia, que conoce perfectamente que estrategias poner en marcha en cada momento de su vida, especialmente en lo que se refiere a su  negocio; al principio se dedicaba al comercio de prendas de oro, pero cuando se encareció esta mercancía y las ventas empezaron a descender y a generar menos utilidades, se dedicó a ir cambiando gradualmente su actividad, justamente con los mismos clientes que había ganado con la venta de joyas; así fue como inició vendiendo  legumbres, como lentejas, frijoles y también  arroz y aceite entre vecinos,  hasta que gradualmente fue atrayendo mas clientes y con ellos mas pedidos, generando la necesidad de aumentar la inversión, por eso hace ya siete años acudió a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado con cuatro financiamientos, con los que ha logrado diversificar sus productos y mejorar sus tiempos, incluyendo carne de cerdo los fines de semana,  productos lácteos todos los días y víveres dos veces por semana.  Todo este apoyo, su disciplina e interés de crecimiento, ha logrado   mejoría en todos los aspectos de su vida; con sus 68 años sueña con    aumentando el volumen de ventas y sus ganancias día a día, aunque la competencia es su máximo desafío y siempre la obliga a recurrir a  estrategias mercadologicas para permitirle  sostener sus clientes. Su credikiva es su quinto financiamiento con la organización, con él comprará arroz, harina, leche en polvo, pastas, productos de aseo y legumbres para surtir nuevamente su negocio y seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo y con él su sueño de continuar siendo exitosa.
texts.en:
Nidia R. R. is a very wise woman who knows exactly what strategies to implement in every moment of her life; especially in regards to her business. She started out selling gold jewelry, but when the price of gold rose, sales began to decline and profits fell, so she changed her merchandise. The same customers that she had sold jewelry to, she started selling them vegetables such as lentils, beans, rice, and oil. She gradually attracted more customers and more orders, creating a need for increased investment. Thus, seven years ago, Nidia went to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organization that has supported her with four loans. She succeeded in diversifying her products and improving timeliness to market. For example, she sells pork on weekends, dairy products every day, and food supplies twice a week. With all the support of FMSD, Nidia's discipline and interest in growing her business has improved all aspects of her life. At 68 years old, she dreams of increasing sales volume and profits every day. Competition is her main obstacle and she is always forced to use marketing strategies to hold on to her customers. This is Nidia's fifth loan with FMSD. She will buy rice, flour, powdered milk, pasta, toiletries, and vegetables to supply her business and increase her working capital. With this loan, her dream of continued success will be realized.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, powdered milk, pasta, toiletries, and vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es:
CARMEN BEATRIZ C. B.
NUEVAMENTE  LA SEÑORA CARMEN BEATRIZ  C. B. SOLICITA UN REFINANCIAMIENTO DE CREDITO PARA SEGUIR INVIRTIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO.  CADA DIA ELLA TIENE NUEVOS PEDIDOS DE PARTE DE SUS CLIENTES EN UNA O DOS COSAS LAS CUALES MUCHAS ELLA NO TIENE EN SU NEGOCIO.  SIEMPRE CADA DIA ELLA DECEA SATISFACER LA NECESIDAD DE LOS COMPRADORES, CON LA AYUDA DE SU ESPOSO ELLA SIGUE LUCHANDO PARA QUE EL NEGOCIO SIGA CRECIENDO YA QUE LA META COMO FAMILIA Y PROPIETARIA DEL NEGOCIO ES TENER UN GRAN DEPOSITO DE ARTICULOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD EN LA ALDEA Y SER LOS DISTRIBUIDORES DE LAS PEQUEÑAS TIENDAS DEL AREA.
texts.en:
In order to continue investing in her business, Ms. Carmen Beatriz C. B. is once again requesting a loan. Each day, she has new orders from her customers for one or two things that she does not have many of in her store. She always wants to satisfy the needs of her customers. With the help of her husband, she continues to fight for her business to keep growing. Her goal for her family and as a business owner is to have a large stock of staple items in the village, and to be a distributor to the small stores in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock up on staple items

loans.name: Violeta 3 Group

texts.en:
Mayelin is the coordinator of her group Violeta 3 (Violet). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to become a mother; she is only 22 years old.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to study.

Mayelin is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year, starting with her first Esperanza's loan, with her sister teaching her to do business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying kids clothing and underwear. She will use the profits to invest in her business and finish her studies.  She wishes to run her own clothing store and become a professional. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because this loan program is different to others and she likes to save.  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).  Her group is located in Los Arcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free trade zones are common. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy kids underwear and clothing

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: SANTA ROSA D. YANACOTO

Socia D. L. ALCOM: “SANTA ROSA D. YANACOTO” quienes sus integrantes son personas muy emprendedoras y esforzadas cada uno en su propio negocio.

 Cecilia empezó a trabajar desD. muy niña al lado D. su madre quien vendía medicinas naturales en su tierra D. Huánuco, muy joven se casó a L. edad D. 14 años quien emprendió con el negocio D. abarrotes, pocos años después deciD. hacer lo que aprendió a su corta edad L. venta D. medicinas, medicamentos naturales, empleando los conocimientos D. su madre, como el D. curar ciertas enfermedades D. vías respiratorias, dolores musculares, infecciones leves. A su vez también vendió ropas y polos, así fue que deciD.  emigrar a L. ciudad D. Lima, esta vez tuvo que recomendarse con su propio trabajo dado que era un lugar nuevo, en L. que no había competencia en lo que elL. vendía, como nos cuenta implementó mas en mercadería con los créditos que tuvo D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, así pudo adquirir con las ventas un puesto propio en un lugar comercial donD. sus ganancias son buenas, el secreto D. ello se debe a que Cecilia es una persona que aparte D. conocer bien las propiedades curativas D. cada planta, sirve a L. sociedad especialmente a personas ancianas a quienes no les cobra el remedio que elL. prepara. Este trabajo le ayudó mucho a crecer, porque asistió a charlas y conferencias que L. invitaron, tuvo L. oportunidad D. viajar al país D. Ecuador, los exponentes eran médicos terapéuticos lo cual profundizó mas sus conocimientos, es así que también elL. compartió secretos curativos que comprobó durante tratamientos a sus clientes a estos médicos especialistas. No solamente ese trabajo pudo comprar el terreno donD. actualmente vive, además D. construirlo, adquirir artefactos, sino también educación a sus hijos; los clientes buscan su servicio quienes son muchos D. ellos gente profesional (abogados, políticos, enfermeras, doctores) y gente del pueblo, quienes agradecen a Cecilia por haberles curado D. ciertas enfermedades tales son los casos D. cáncer, tumores, quistes, miomas; siempre y cuando no sea necesario una intervención quirúrgica, si es así elL. les dice a sus clientes que deben D. hacerlo porque esto lo vio en las radiografías y ecografías. Agradece a Dios por haberle guiado en este camino, D. ayudar a personas con mucho amor a través D. sus conocimientos. Su anhelo es viajar con los médicos a Estados Unidos para que conozca y difundan esta forma D. curar.

El crédito que requiere es para incrementar jarabes, hierbas, y otros medicamentos curativos naturales.
texts.en:
ALCOM: SANTA ROSA D. YANACOTO Member of ALCOM: "SANTA ROSA OF YANACOTO” whose members are progressive and hardworking with their own businesses.

Cecilia began working since childhood with her mother who sold natural medicine in her homeland Huánuco. She married at the young age of 14 and began a grocery business. A few years later, with all she had learned, she decided to sell medicine, natural meiecine, and started applying her mother's knowledge of curing certain ailments such as respiratory tract diseases, muscle pain, and mild infections. At the same time she sold clothes and polos and it was then that she decided to move to Lima. This time she had to recommend herself since it was a new place. There was no competition for her business so she was able to implement more in merchandise with the loans she received from EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD. With the sales she was then able to have her own stand in a shopping center where her sales are very profitable. The secret is that besides Cecilia being a specialist in knowing every plant's healing property, she serves her community by helping the elders and does not charge them for remedies she prepares. This job helped her grow since she attended talks and conferences she was invited to. She had the opportunity to travel to Ecuador and the people she met there where medical therapists who enhanced her understanding. In turn, she was able to share with the medical specialists the healing discoveries she maD. while treating her patients. Not only was she able to buy the land she owns and lives on, with this job she was also able to build it, acquire artifacts, and pay for her children's education. Many of her patients are professionals (lawyers, politicians, nurses, and doctors) and locals who are grateful for Cecilia being able to cure many of their diseases such as cancer, tumors, cysts, and myomas; but only when a surgical intervention is not necessary. If they do need surgery she tells her patients they should have it since she verifies it through x-rays and ultra sound scanning. She thanks God for having guided her to this path of helping people with much love through her knowledge. Her goal is to travel with medics in the United States so they can learn about and spread this form of healing.

The loan she requests will be used to buy more syrups, herbs, and other natural healing medications.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more syrups, herbs, and other natural healing medications.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata, who is married to an Arabic teacher and has two dependents, sells gara, a type of clothing.  A quiet and hardworking businesswoman, Aminata was initially financed by her husband to establish her gara trade three years ago and now needs a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more gara.  She intends to use the additional profits resulting from her loan to help educate her children to university level and establish a savings account for her retirement.

loans.use: To buy more gara for her business

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Nació en una familia agricultora y desde entonces le enseñaron los conocimientos con respecto a esta labor. Hoy a lado de su esposo, cultivan papa y olluco sobre terrenos que le fue heredado, asimismo procuran siempre en tenerlos protegidos de la plaga de insectos. Por otro lado, también se dedica a pastar sus animales en el campo, es por ello que cuenta con la ayuda de su familia, por que saben lo duro que es este trabajo. Se siente muy tranquila porque tiene dos ingresos, tanto la venta de animales, como la de su cosecha, y por ello desea seguir ampliando sus terrenos agrícolas. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su campaña de siembra y también comprara más cerdos.
texts.en:
Eva is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She was born into a farming family and they taught her their knowledge of the business. Today, at her husband’s side, she grows potatoes and ‘olluco’ (an Andean tuber) on lands that she inherited. They also try to always have their crops protected from insects. She also works tending her animals in the countryside. She knows how hard the work is, which is why she has the help of her family. She feels calm because she has two sources of income – both her animal sales and her crops. This is why she wants to continue expanding her agricultural lands.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always been very responsible with her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive people. She is grateful for the people who will fund the loan, as it will be very useful for her in helping her business progress. With the loan requested, she will invest in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer for planting season and also to buy more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ludnila Eugenia

texts.es:
Ludnila Muñoz es una mujer muy creativa y así lo ha mostrado siempre, desde que escogió como su profesión la arquitectura, que ahora aplica a los hermosos diseños alimenticios que prepara y vende en su negocio de nombre “Mi Postre”; allí exhibe las delicias de pasteles, tortas y postres en todas las formas y en  todos los tamaños que con sus propias manos elabora y  que están llenas de su creatividad y de las mejores técnicas higiénicas y nutricionales.   
Ludnila se dedicaba a la docencia hasta el año 2007, e incursionó en la repostería como un hobbie, pero decidió perfeccionar esta actividad con mucho estudio técnico,  trabajando en una repostería, para aprender cada día mas, allí complemento su aprendizaje y se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, obtener financiamiento y  comprar una nevera exhibidora de postres, con la que empezó aprovechando en el negocio de Internet de su hermano, desde donde se ha dado a conocer mostrando su gran potencial inspirada en su profesión de arquitecta, porque en su microempresa aplica mucho de lo que sabe, como las formas, la estética, la imagen y presentación de todo lo que hace, entre lo que se destaca, el postre de las tres leches, el muy deliciosos de banano y combinados con chocolate y deliciosas frutas, además de pudines y otras exquisiteces.
En la actualidad se postuló para dispensar sus productos en el bingo que ofrece la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a cuatromil clientes en Barranquilla y Cartagena y fue seleccionada para comercializarlos  en la primera ciudad mencionada. De allí se deriva la solicitud de su credikiva, porque necesita comprar en un gran volumen materias primas, para responder al tamaño del evento y para la elaboración de su material publicitario,  como pendones tarjetas y sus propios catálogos.
Ludnila es una mujer digna de admirar por su gran compromiso de crecimiento de si misma,  de su negocio, por eso ella continuamente está capacitando tanto a nivel administrativo como técnicamente, por eso siempre ofrece lo mejor y a un nivel de calidad que hace de sus productos los mas apetecibles en su mercado objetivo.
texts.en:
Ludnila Muñoz is a very creative woman, and she has always shown this since she chose architecture as her profession, which she now applies to the beautifully designed foods that she prepares and sells in her business called “Mi Postre” (My Dessert). There she exhibits delightful cakes, tarts and desserts of all shapes and sizes that she makes with her own hands and that are full of her creativity and the best hygienic and nutritional techniques. Ludnila worked as a teacher until 2007, and she tried her hand at cakes and pastries as a hobby, but she decided to perfect this activity with much technical study, working in a pastry shop to learn more everyday. She complemented her learning there, and she joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to obtain financing and buy a new display refrigerator for desserts, with which she began taking advantage of her brother's Internet business. She has become known for showing her great potential inspired by her architectural profession because in her microbusiness she applies much of what she knows, such as in the form, aesthetics, image and presentation of everything she makes, among which standouts are the tres leches cake, the very delicious banana cake and combinations of chocolate and delicious fruits, along with puddings and other delicacies. At present she has applied to distribute her products at the bingo event that Fundación Mario Santo Domingo offers to four thousand customers in Barranquilla and Cartagena, and she was selected to sell them in the first city mentioned. From there she developed the application for her Kiva loan, because she needs to purchase a large amount of raw materials to respond to the size of the event and for preparation of her publicity materials, such as banners, cards and her own catalogs. Ludnila is a woman worthy of admiration for her great commitment to personal growth and growth of her business. For this reason she is continually training as much at an administrative level as technically. Because of this she always offers the best and maintains a level of quality that makes her products the most attractive in her target market.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large amounts of raw materials for her desserts and prepare publicity materials

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa  propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado en las tareas del campo, pero hasta algunos años optó por intensificar la actividad ganadera, es así que tiene ahora vacas en su establo, que cuida con mucho empeño, convirtiéndose en una actividad familiar. Sin embargo no deja de cultivar papa, olluco, oca, trigo y pastizales, éste último le sirve de forraje para sus animales. Esta muy habituada a las tareas del campo  desde su niñez y disfruta realizar estas tareas porque le permite  tener el alimento disponible para su familia. Para el futuro desea mejorar la infraestructura de su establo, así como su producción agrícola. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 51 years old. She lives with her husband and their six children in their own house. All her life she has worked the land, but some years ago she chose to intensify her ranching activity, and that is how she now has cows in her stable, which she cares for with much effort, turning it into a family activity. However, she has not stopped growing potatoes, olluco, oca [two different types of tubers], wheat and pastures; these last fields serve as forage for her animals. She is very accustomed to working the land from her childhood, and she enjoys carrying out these tasks because it allows her to have food available for her family. For the future, she wants to improve the infrastructure of her stable, as well as her agricultural production. This is Hermelinda's seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she has always shown responsibility with her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible people and are very united. She thanks the people who will be managers of the loan she is requesting, and it will be very useful to her in her business' progress. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy sacks of manure and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es: Doña Esmirna tienen 60 años D. edad, ella vive con su esposo, se dedica a la venta D. materiales para manualidades, los cuales se utilizan en bodas, bautizos, quince años, etc. Tiene treinta años D. contar con el negocio el cual la ha ayudado a mantenerse, por la falta D. capital no ha logrado surtir bien su tienda. Se organiza con otras vecinas quienes se conocen desD. hace mucho tiempo, el Banco Comunal le eligen el nombre D.  PROSPERIDAD, es integrado por diez mujeres quien cada una D. ellas cuenta con su propio negocio. Ella espera que el préstamo la ayuD. a salir adelante e incrementar la clientela y el volumen D. las ventas.
texts.en:
Doña Esmirna is 60 years old and lives with her husband. She spends her time selling craft supplies used for weddings, baptisms, girls’ fifteenth birthday parties, and other events. Esmirna has thirty years of experience in this business which has helped her to support herself. However, she lacks the capital needed to keep her store well-stocked. She organized a group of neighbors who have known each other for a long time. This Communal Bank chose the name “Prosperidad” (Prosperity) and consists of ten women who each have their own business. Esmirna expects that the loan will help her get ahead, expand her customer base, and increase her sales volume.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy craft materials

loans.name: The Women´s Bank ¨ Women Of Power¨ Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of three women members who reside in Pococí, Limón, located in the hot and humid Caribbean region of Costa Rica. This group was formed at the beginning of 2007, however, this will be the members' first loan with Fundación Mujer.  The loan consultant who has been working with this group has described the members as hard-working entrepreneurs with the desire and ability to improve standards of living for themselves as well as their families.  A major limiting factor for the women of this group has been a lack of access to working capital. This loan will help to address this problem. 

The members of this group are involved in various productive activities including clothing sales and agricultural activities. Isabel Guzmán A. has a business selling clothing. For her female clients, Isabel offers both casual and intimate clothing. She also offers men´s and children´s clothing to her clients, most of whom are acquaintances who live in her neighbourhood.  Isabel plans to use this loan to finance the purchase of more clothing items which she plans to sell at a margin in order to earn a profit.

Leyla G. C. is involved in agricultural activities such as the rearing and selling of pigs and cows. She plans to use this loan to finance the purchase of a calf, animal feed, and if there is any money left over, she hopes to purchase a piglet.

loans.use: For the purchase of animals, animal feed, and clothing to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 56 años, vive con sus hermanas en su casa que es propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las diversas tareas del campo sembrando papa, olluco, trigo entre otros productos más y para realizar estas tareas recibe el apoyo de sus hermanas, pero cuando requiere de hacer un trabajo más arduo, contrata el servicio de mano de obra de peones.  Cada día verifica las tierras que ha cultivado, asimismo se va a pastear sus ovejas al campo mientras espera que maduren los productos sembrados para que pueda cosecharlos y ser llevados al mercado de abastos de la ciudad mas cercana para su respectiva comercialización. Los recursos económicos que le genera esta actividad le ha motivado a seguir esforzándose, es por ello que desea intensificarse en esta actividad. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de papa y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Lucia is 56 years old and lives with her sisters in her own house. Since her childhood she has worked at different jobs in the countryside sowing potatoes, olluco [a tuber] and wheat among other products, and to carry out these tasks she receives her sisters' support, but when she needs to do a more arduous job, she hires laborers. Each day she checks over the lands she has farmed. She also goes to graze her sheep in the countryside while she waits for the planted products to mature so she can harvest them and take them to the suppliers' market in the nearest city so they can be sold. The economic resources that this activity generates for her have motivated her to keep trying. For this reason she wants to increase this activity. It is Lucia's seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she has always shown that she is responsible with her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible people and are very united. She thanks those people who will be managers of the loan she is requesting, and it will be very useful to her in the progress of her business. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy potato seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital, purchase tools for work

loans.name: Esperanza En Paraiso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria, the coordinator of her group Esperanza en Paraiso 1 & 2 (Hope in Paradise), makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and four children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to confront a serious problem that happened to her in the past. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying learning new things.

Maria, who is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza, has had her business for a year and two months, having started with clothing sales which led to her establishing a small colmado (a general store with all the ingredients for one's daily food needs, conveniently located a short distance from any home in the neighborhood). She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying a freezer for her colmado, and will use the profits to pursue her life goals.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she feels comfortable with the repayment schedule and likes to belong to a group, have the group meetings and save. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer

loans.name: Faride Esther

texts.es: Desde hace 13 años cuando se casó se dedicó a su hogar y para no descuidarlo se invento su propio negocio, así comenzó Faride Carbonó su microempresa de “Miscelánea y variedades Fari”, ella es una mujer casada y con dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 12 años, que consiguió su clientela primaria haciendo manicure y pedicure y simultáneamente aprendió el arte de la bisutería de manera autodidacta a través de revistas especializadas, con ello agregó este producto a su negocio  y posteriormente, la venta de minutos de celulares; también fue apoyada por  una amiga que vive en  Estados Unidos, ella le mandaba mercancías cosméticas, perfumes y Faride las vendía, así también fue como agregó multiusos a crédito y gradualmente ha ido adicionando muchos productos como ropa femenina y cosméticos. De esta manera y ha ido creciendo y  desarrollando lo que hoy tiene: una miscelánea. Su credikiva, es su primer crédito, con él quiere obtener un capital adicional para comprar productos que han solicitado sus clientes y que ampliaran el espectro de otras personas que nunca le han comprado, como jeans para damas, perfumería, cosmético e insumos para elaborar productos de bisutería.  Su sueño es aumentar sus ingresos mediante su trabajo para dejarle algo para que sus hijos tengan un futuro promisorio.
texts.en:
Since she was married 13 years ago, she has taken care of her home, and so as not to neglect it she created her own business. This is how Faride Carbonó began her microbusiness “Miscelánea y variedades Fari” (Fari's Variety and Miscellany). She is a married woman with two children ages 9 and 12 who found her first customers doing manicures and pedicures, and at the same time she taught herself the art of costume jewelry through specialist magazines. She then added this product to her business and later added sales of cell phone minutes; she was also supported by a friend who lives in the United States. This friend sent her cosmetics merchandise and perfumes, and Faride sold them. This was also how she added multi-use credits and gradually she has added many products like women's clothing and cosmetics. In this manner, she has been growing and developing what she now has: a miscellany. Her Kiva loan is her first loan. With it, she wants to obtain additional capital to buy products that her customers have requested and that would broaden the spectrum to other people who have never bought from her, such as ladies' jeans, perfumes, cosmetics and supplies for making costume jewelry. Her dream is to increase her income through her work to leave something so her children have a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ladies' jeans, perfumes, cosmetics and supplies for making costume jewelry

loans.name: Mujeres De Chilcatotoras (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras esta formado por un grupo de 10 mujeres  que buscan con el trabajo diario mejorar la economía de sus hogares y así ofrecerles sus hijos un mejor futuro. Viven en la comunidad de Chilcatororas que es perteneciente a la parroquia Tarqui, la que es reconocida por su exuberante vegetación,  la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, es de clima frió.

La Señora Nelly Estela L.  vive en la comunidad de Chilcatotoras que es perteneciente a la parroquia Tarqui, tiene  27 años,  es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 4, 2 años de edad, su hijo de 8 años estudia en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo trabaja en el campo de la construcción, la casa en la que habitan es de su mamá en donde comparten los gastos. 
Doña Nelly se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su hogar debido a que sus hijos aun son pequeños y dependen mucho de ella, aprovecha su tiempo para dedicarse a  la cría de animales como: cuyes, pollos y ganado. Este es su primer crédito en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, en sus vacunas y alimentos. Su   sueño es tener una casa propia.

La Señora Ruth Melania L. vive en la comunidad de Chilcatotoras,  Este es el  tercer  crédito que realiza en la banca comuna, está muy contenta ya que han forman un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que busca  un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de animales como: cuyes, vacas, chanchos y gallinas  que los vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a realizar cualquier trabajo cuando sus conocidas le dan la oportunidad de trabajar.
La Señora Ruth tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, su niño estudia en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposo se dedica a varios oficios, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad la misma que fue construida con el esfuerzo de los dos.  Con el nuevo crédito que la  FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en  comprar  animales como  cuyes. Su meta es de terminar su casa ya que aun le falta  realizar varios arreglos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres de Chilcatotoras” (Women of Chilcatotoras) communal bank has ten members all of whom are women seeking to improve their home’s economy through daily work thereby offereing a better future to their children. They live in the community of Chilcatotoras which is in Tarqui parish. It is famous for its exhuberant vegetation. Most of its residents are farmers and cattlemen. Its climate is cold. Nelly Estela L. lives in Chilcatotoras which is part of Tarqui parish. She’s 27 years old, married and has three children who are 8, 4, and 2 years of age. Her eight-year-old is going to a local school. Her husand works in construction. The house they live in belongs to his mother and they all share expenses. Nelly’s children are still small so they depend a lot on her so she is dedicated to household chores. However, she uses her time to raise small farm animals like: guinea pigs, chickens and cattle. This is her first loan in the communal bank and she will use it to buy a cow, its vaccines and feed. Her dream is to have a house of her own. Ruth Melania L. lives in Chilcatotoras. This is her third loan with the communal bank. She is very happy because they form a group of tenacious woman who seek better futures for their children. She raises animals like: guinea pigs, cows, pigs and chickens for sale in her community. She also does any other kind of job when her acquaintances give her the opportunity to work. Ruth is 24 years old, married and has a 7-year-old son. Her son goes to the local school. Her husband does a variety of jobs. The house they live in is their own and it was built through their mutual effort. She will use the new loan that FUNDACION ESPOIR has grantd to buy animals like guinea pigs. Her goal is to finish building her house since it still lacks several finishing touches.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, a cow, vaccines and animal feed.

loans.name: Salud Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal "SALUD"; este banco se encuantra ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huancha perteneciendo a la provincia del Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Catalina, tiene 53 años de edad, la socia es divorciada y trabaaj vendiendo en la esquina de sus casa Salchipapas, una deliciosa comida, esta hecho a base de papas fritas y salchichas fritas en rodajas acompañado de mayonesa, mostasa y otros, La socia también vende productos de belleza por catalogo. La scoai solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para su negocio de salchipapas y comprar al por mayor. La socia invertirá en la compra de papas, salchichas y otros.
Los otros socios alternan sus actividades con la docencia, trabajadores del sector publico, venta de peluches y otros.

La socia agradece y valora el prestamo comprometiendose a cumplir con el pago correspondiente en las cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
These individuals belong to the communal bank "Salud." This bank is located in the city of Cusco in the Huanchac district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco. One member is Catalina, 53, who is divorced and works selling Salchipapas on the corner in front of her house. This is a delicious dish, made from fried potatoes and slices of fried sausages, along with mayonnaise, mustard and other accompaniments. Catalina also sells beauty products from a catalog. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for her salchipapas business to buy at wholesale. She will purchase potatoes, sausages, and other items. These members alternate their activities, such as teaching and working in the public sector, with the sale of stuffed animals and other items. Catalina appreciates and values the loan, and is committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of potatoes, sausages and other supplies

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena  tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su  casa propia. Hace más de 20 años que ella posee animales ovinos en su establo, por lo que los lleva a pastear en el campo todos los días, asimismo su esposo y sus hijos comparten esta tarea, pero hasta hace 4 años se dedica a elaborar bordados artesanales. Por otro lado tiene extensiones de terreno de las cuales cultiva papa, olluco y maíz; siendo lo cosechado vendido al mercado de la ciudad mas cercana de su comunidad. Le gusta trabajar en el campo, puesto que le permite cubrir la necesidades de su familia, es por ello que desea seguir creciendo tanto en la agricultura, como en la elaboración de bordados ya que lo considera como un negocio muy rentable. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su campaña de siembra y también en la compra de hilos de colores y telas.
texts.en:
Magdalena, age 49, lives with her husband and their six children in her own house. She has had sheep in her stable for over 20 years. She takes the sheep to the field to graze everyday. Her husband and her children share this work. Four years ago she started making handmade embroidery. She also has an expanse of land where she grows potatoes, “olluco” (an Andean tuber), and corn. Once they are harvested, they are sold in the market that is in the city closest to her community. She likes working in the field because it allows her to cover her family’s necessities. That is why she wants to continue growing in agricultural as well as making embroideries, which she considers to be a very profitable business. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she has always demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments. Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. She is grateful to the people who will fund the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy sacks of fertilizer for planting season. She will also buy different colors of thread and fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different colors of fabric and thread to continue embroidering

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es: Doña Elda H. de treinta y dos años de edad, curso el cuarto grado primaria, tiene tres hijos, el mayor de diez años y la mas pequeña de 5, el esposo de ella se dedica a la artesanía y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares, se dedica al comercio (Venta de consumo Diario y Medicina) cuenta con 9 años de experiencia en éste negocio. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y con la ayuda de unas vecinas  organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina AZUCENAS, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes, ya que en el lugar estas flores son muy conocidas. El grupo cuenta con 11 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza de animales, confección de Chumpas y delantales, venta de alimentos y ropas típicas. El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de consumo diario, y de esa forma ampliar su negocio para generar más ingresos. Espera que su negocio sea más grande y pueda genere mas ingresos para su desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Doña Elda H. is 32 years old. She completed the fourth grade of primary school. She has three children, the oldest is 10 and the youngest is 5. Her husband works in crafts, and she helps with some of the family expenses. She works in commerce (selling basic products and medicines) and has 9 years of experience in this business. With enthusiasm and the desire to get ahead, she and a few neighbor women organized a group so that they could apply for a loan. Their community bank is called "Azucenas" (white lilies); the name was chosen by all the members, since these flowers are very well known in this area. The group has 11 women as members. They work at various activities, among them we can mention raising animals, making jackets and aprons, selling food and traditional clothing. Doña Elda H. will use the loan to buy basic products and in this way expand her business to generate more income. She hopes that her business can be larger and that she can generate more income for her personal and family development.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy products to sell

loans.name: Saturdina

texts.es: Saturdina tiene 39 años, vive  con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades del campo, trabaja diariamente junto con su esposo desde altas horas de la mañana, en donde lleva a pastar sus animales a la pradera. Asimismo se dedica a cultivar olluco, papa, habas y cebada, en donde sus hijos la apoyan en esta actividad y a lo largo de los años manifiesta que han ido superando las dificultades tales como la helada. Una vez cosechada su producción, lo lleva a vender directamente al mercado de su pueblo, de esta manera le genera los ingresos que necesita. Por lo pronto desea mejorar la cosecha e incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene en su establo. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y sacos de abono para sembrar, papa, olluco y alfalfa, siendo éste último indispensable para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Saturdina is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. All her life she has been tied to the activities of the countryside. She works with her husband every day beginning in the early morning hours, when she takes their animals to graze in the meadows. At the same time, she raises olluco (a tuberous vegetable), potatoes, beans, and barley; her children help her with this activity. She states that over the years they have overcome difficulties such as frost. Once she has harvested her crops, she takes them to sell directly in the market in her town. In this way she generates the income that she needs. At this time she wants to improve her harvest and increase the number of animals that she has in her stable. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. Furthermore, it makes her happy to be part of her community bank, because all its members are responsible and very united people. She is thankful to the people who will be granters of the loan she is applying for, which will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is applying for, she will invest in the purchase of seeds and bags of fertilizer to plant potatoes, olluco, and alfalfa, since this last crop is indispensable for feeding her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Fe En Dios 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Felicia, the coordinator of her group Fe en Dios 2 & 3 (Faith in God), makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children. She plans to continue enjoying cooking for her family and friends.

Felicia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her personal products business for a year, having started it with her first Esperanza's loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more personal use products such as cosmetics, body cream, powder, soaps and an exhibitor to demonstrate her wares. She will use the additional profits from the loan to buy some things for her home as well as invest in the purchase of some jewelry. She wants to buy a car and have a successful business.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she sought a loan to start a business to earn income to improve her family's standard of living. Felicia's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, body cream, powder and other personal products for her business

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana M., es la propietaria de un negocio de confección  de ropa, elaboración de productos de lencería y cerámica llamada “Confecciones Louly” ella es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 13 años, que ha solicitado un credikiva para comprar insumos y materiales para la confección articulos de lencería como telas e hilos alusivos a la temporada de amor y amistad y para prepararse desde ya para las fiestas de navidades y de año nuevo, comprando insumos apropiados para ello.
Su negocio lo heredó de su madre pero ella le ha ido dando un matiz algo diferente, porque estudió diseño de modas y su énfasis son los cubre lechos,  baja ollas, adornos de cocina y de sala en general, para darle mayor elegancia al lugar donde habitan las familias. Su principal clientela son las amas de casa  y jóvenes para los que también elabora productos acordes a su edad. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, dándose a conocer cada día más y abrir un almacén donde pueda hacer una oferta de los bellos diseños que produce con las más sofisticadas técnicas y mucho amor.
Su desafío mas importante es adquirir gradualmente la infraestructura que requiere para aumentar la calidad de sus productos y mejorar los tiempos de respuesta a sus clientes, como maquinas y equipos. Así mismo Liliana sueña con construir un buen capital para que sus hijos puedan en el futuro estudiar y tener muchas oportunidades laborales de calidad
texts.en:
Liliana M. is the owner of a clothing store. She makes also makes lingerie and ceramic crafts under the business name "Louly Creations". She is a married woman and she has two children, aged 7 and 13 years old. She requests a loan to purchase materials to make crafts, such as fabrics and threads, to get ready for the holiday, new year's, and valentine's day season. She would like to purchase other holiday merchandise. She inherited her business from her mother but she has made it her own.
