She studied fashion design with an specialization in household crafts, including bed spreads, pot holders, kitchen decorations and general living room items to an element of elegance to families' homes. Her clientele is mostly made up of housewives and youth, for them she also makes special age-appropriate products. Her dream is to expand her business and to make a name for herself. She wants to open a store where she will be able to showcase her beautiful designs, crafted with technical expertise and a great deal of attention. Her goal is to gradually improve the infrastructure of her business, a requirement to improve the quality of her products and improve the turn around times for orders placed by her clients. She would need sewing machines and other tools. Liliana dreams of building a good working capital so that her children will be able to enjoy quality work opportunities in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and threads.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Hugo, tiene 37 años de edad, el es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio se dedica a la artesanía pero también presta servicio de taxi a la ciudad del Cusco, el socio solicita el dinero para invertir en el mejoramiento y mantenimiento de sus automóvil.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Hugo, 37, has a live-in partner and two children. He is a craftsman but also provides public taxi services in the city of Cusco. He is asking for funds for vehicle maintenance and repair. He is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO” (Chinchero New Victory) communal bank which is in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. It is 45 minutes from the city. He avails himself of this forum to express his gratitude for the loan as well as to commit to repay it in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es: Doña Julia C. de treinta y nueve años de edad, curso el segundo grado de primaria, ella es viuda su esposo falleció hace 6 años y tiene cinco hijos tres mayores de edad y la mas pequeña de 8 años, se dedica a la Crianza de Animales (Cerdos Y Pollos) para colaborar con los gastos de su familia, tomando en cuenta que sus hijos mayores colaboran con algunos gastos y cuenta con 14 años de experiencia en ésta actividad,  solo que ahora con mayor producción. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y la ayuda de unas vecinas  organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MANANTIAL, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes. El grupo cuenta con 15 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza de animales, venta de Helados, Consumo Diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de Cerdos, y de esa forma incrementar su Producción y así generar más ingresos. Ya que el sueño de ella es que su producción crezca, pero por falta de capital, no ha podido, pero con este crédito crecerá su producción y de esta forma generar mas ingresos para su desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Julia C. is thirty nine years old. She has a grade 2 education. She is a widow, her husband passed away 6 years ago. She has five children, three are independent and the youngest is 8 years old. She raises livestock (pigs and chickens) to contribute to the family's expenses, keeping in mind that her eldest children help out with some expenses. She has 14 year’s experience in the business, only now her production is improved. With great enthusiasm, dreams of improvements, and with the help of one of her neighbors, she has organized a group to request a loan together. The community bank is named "Manatial", a name chose by all the members. The group is made up of 15 women and they each have their unique business, such as: farmer, ice cream sales, grocery store, and traditional clothing store. The loan will be used to purchase pigs to increase her production and improve her earnings. Her dream is to see the production grow even more but with limited capital funds she has not been able to see this happen. This loan will help her increase production and generate a better income, for her personal advancement and for the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Lidia, tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica  a la artesanía, ella elabora diferentes trabajaos y luego los vende, La socia ayuda con este ingreso económico en casa y desea construir su casita, ahora la socia necesita capital de trabajo según manifiesta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para elaborar la artesanía.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Lidia, 34, lives with her life partner and their three children. She is a craftsperson. She makes various crafts to sell. This income helps meet household expenses. She would like to build her house. According to her statement, she needs capital to buy supplies for her crafts. She is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO” (Chinchero New Victory) communal bank located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. It is 45 minutes from the city. She avails herself of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan and to commit to repay it in a timely fashion

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For crafts supplies.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Raúl; tiene 28 años de edad; el socio es soltero y tiene 1 hijo, el socio se dedica a la fabricación de chompas en lana de alpaca, el socio tiene su pequeño taller en Cusco y confecciona chompas de alpaca, El socio trabaja en su taller produciendo chompas de alpaca al por mayor junto a sus operarios y luego los vende en diferentes ferias artesanales y también trabaja a pedido de otros. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca al por mayor teñidas y de colores naturales.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Raúl, 28, is single and has a son. He manufactures Alpaca wool sweaters in a small workshop he has in Cusco. He works in his workshop making Alpaca sweaters in quantity with his staff and then sells them in different crafts markets. He also works to fill third-party orders. He is asking for funds to buy Alpaca wool dyed in a variety of colors and in natural state. He is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO” (Chinchero New Victory) communal bank located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. It’s located 45 minutes from the city. He avails himself of this forum to express his gratitude for the loan and to commit to repay it in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Alpaca wool, both dyed in various colors and natural, at wholesale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Cristina; 46 años de edad, ella es viuda, y tiene 6 hijos, la socia se dedica a la artesanía, la socia es una mujer muy fuerte y muy trabajadora, ella compra la artesanía a otros proveedores de la zona y los lleva a Cusco a vende, de este modo ella puede pedir un mejor precio y no tener mucha competencia frente a los comuneros del lugar ya que este pueblo es netamente cuna de artesanos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor todo tipo de artesanía y telares.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Cristina, 46, is a widow and has 6 children. She is a craftsperson. She is a strong, hard working woman. She buys crafts from other suppliers in the area and takes them to Cusco to sell. This way she can ask for a better price and not have too much competition from the locals since this town is virtually the source of craftspeople. She is asking for funds to buy all sorts of crafts and weavings at wholesale. She is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA-CHINCHERO” (Chinchero New Victory) communal bank located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. It is located 45 minutes from the city. She avails herself of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan as well as to pledge to repay it in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy all sorts of crafts and weavings at wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Rubidia

texts.es: Ana Rubidia R. D. E. es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, cuya vivienda y negocio se ubica en el municipio D. Ilopango,  ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador ella tiene en venta gran número D. productos, en su pequeño bazar que lleva por nombre “bazar Josué”, ella vive únicamente  en compañía D. su esposo. Ana  es una mujer decidida y muy preocupada por su hogar y negocio que le ayuda a saldar muchas D. sus necesidades, siendo una gran ayuda en sus ingresos familiares; el préstamo ha sido solicitado para invertir en el bazar y poder hacer compra D. más productos para sus clientes, tales como ropa, zapatos, accesorios para regalo, botones, hilos, agujas y otros más, y D. esta forma hacer crecer el  bazar y tener mayores ingresos que son necesarios para su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Rubidia R. des Estupinina is an entrepreneurial and hard working person. Her business and her home are located in the municipality of Ilopango, in the San Salvador region. She sells a great variety of products from her small bazaar, named Josue's Bazaar. She lives alone with her husband. Ana is a very decided woman and very attentive to her home and business. Through her business she is able to proviD. for many of their necessities, being an important source of income for the family. The loan requested will be invested in her bazaar, in purchasing more products to offer her clients, such as clothing, shoes, gift wrap and bows, buttons, threads, needles, etc. She will be able to expand her store and see better earnings, a necessity for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general store items.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 36 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Desde que era niña se ha dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería, actualmente lo sigue realizando en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos que ya son mayores, es así que cultivan papa así como algunos cereales y verduras ya que reciben buenas ganancias, lo necesario para el sostén de su familia. Por otro lado, se dedica a la crianza de vacas y ovejas, que son albergadas en su establo, por el cual los saca a pastar al campo. Estas dos actividades involucran a la familia, por ser trabajos que requieren de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y por tal no descansan hasta lograr que su producción aumente y que sus animales se vean bien gordos y saludables. Teodora afirma que le gusta trabajar en el campo porque le agrada disfrutar el paisaje del campo, además esta habituada al ritmo de trabajo que tiene, y por ello desea seguir creciendo en la siembra y en la cantidad de animales que tiene. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de animales y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Teodora is 36 years old and she lives in her own home together with her husband and their 5 children. Since she was a little girl she has worked as an agriculturist and as a farmer. She works together in the business with her husband and two of their grown children. They cultivate cereals and vegetables, these being the most profitable harvests. This business is the source of support for the family. She also raises cows and sheep. She keeps them in a stable but she takes them out to the fields. These two businesses involve the entire family. They require a lot of work and dedication and need constant attention to keep up production and that their livestock be in large and in good health. Teodora loves to work in the fields and she enjoys the landscapes. She is used to the work schedule and she wishes to keep cultivating her fields and keep the same number of livestock in her herds. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is very happy to have the financial support. She has always been very responsible with her payments. She also enjoys being a member of her community bank because all of the members are very responsible and they are all team players. She is grateful to everyone that will contribute tot he loan. The loan will be very useful in the progress of her business. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of more livestock and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and livestock.

loans.name: Antonio Abad

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Antonio; tiene 55 años de edad y el socio es casado y tiene 4, el socio trabaja en artesanía el junto a su esposa se dedican a vender telares, la esposa teje a mano correas de lana de oveja, también ponchos, mantas, gorros y guantes para la venta. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lana para realizar trabajos en tela de oveja. 

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Antonio is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Victoria – Chinchero”, which is located in the District of Chinchero in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco, and lies 45 minutes outside of the city. He is 55 years old, married, and has four children. Antonio is an artisan and also works with his wife selling looms. In addition, his wife makes hand woven sashes out of sheep’s wool as well as ponchos, blankets, caps, and gloves for sale. He is requesting a loan to buy sheep’s wool for producing more woven products. Antonio is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep's wool

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Porfirio; tiene 73 años de edad; el socio es uno de los pintores más antiguos y mas capos en la zona del valle de Urubamba, el socio nació y creció toda su vida en el bello pueblo de Chinchero, el socio realiza bellísimos cuadros paisajísticos y reconocido por su gran y bello trabajo el socio filmo en varios documentales, entre ellos la national geography, el socio tiene el gran sueño de ver a su pueblo salir de la pobreza y que los valores como él, grandes artesanos puedan tener mayor posibilidad de crecer. El socio ahora lleva una vida modesta y sigue trabajando para poder ayudar a su familias e hijos en su educación, el socio invita a todos a que lo visiten en Chincheros y el los guiara por las zonas arqueologías y en todo su bello pueblo, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de pinturas y lápices para sus cuadros. 

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Porfirio, 73, is one of the oldest and most prestigious painters in the Urubamba Valley. He was born in and has lived his whole life in the beautiful town of Chinchero. He paints beautiful landscapes. He has been featured in several documentaries, among them National Geographic, because of his great and beautiful work. His dream is to see his town emerge from poverty and that valuable artisans like himself have the opportunity to grow and develop. He lives a modest life and continues to work in order to help his family and support his children’s education. He invites everyone to visit him in Chinchero and he will guide them through the archaeological sites and everywhere else in his beautiful town. He asks for funds to buy paints and pencils for his art work. Porfirio is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA-CHINCHERO” (Chinchero New Victory) communal bank located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. It is 45 minutes from the city. He avails himself of this forum to express his gratitude for the loan as well as to commit to repay it in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paints and pencils for his works of art.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Edilberto; tiene 33 años de edad; el socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio se dedica a trabajar con la crianza y engorde de animales él se dedica al agro y ve todo el desarrollo y proceso en los animales ovinos, menores, aves de corral y otros. El socio requiere un capital para realizar estudios en los animales para mejorar su raza y engorde. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en los estudios que realizara a algunos animales para su crecimiento sano. 

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Edilberto belongs to the Nueva Victoria – Chinchero communal bank, located in the Chinchero district, province of Urubamba, department of Cuzco, located 45 minutes from the city. He is 33 years old, lives with his common-law wife, and has 2 children. He raises and fattens stock, working in agriculture and overseeing the development of sheep, fowl, small animals, and other. Edilberto needs money to complete studies in his field, in order to improve the breed and the fattening process. He requests a loan to invest in studies he will carry out on some animals for healthy growth. Edilberto expresses his thanks for the loan available via this means, and commits to pay the installments at the times stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en los estudios que realizara a algunos animales para su crecimiento sano.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Fredy; el socio tiene 34 años de edad y es artesano, el socio es un excelente padre y desea todo lo mejor para sus hijos, el nos comenta que su esposa viaja mucho porque es la representante a nivel nacional de las comunidades andinas y la llevan a todas partes y se ausenta mucho dejando a su pequeña al cuidado del padre, el socio trabaja mucho en su taller y en el cuidado de sus menores hijos, el realiza bellísimos trabajos como mantas, ponchos con figuras que representan toda la astronomía inca. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas y materiales para elaborar textiles.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Nueva Victoria – Chinchero. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city.

Fredy is 34 years old and is an artisan. He is an excellent father and wants all the best for his children. He tells us that his wife travels frequently because she is a representative of the Andean communities at the national level. She goes everywhere and is not there much, leaving their small daughter in the care of Fredy. Fredy works in his workshop a lot, as well as in caring for their younger children. He makes beautiful crafts such as blankets and ponchos with figures that represent all of the astronomy of the Inca. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of wool and materials to make textiles.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments in the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool and materials for making textiles

loans.name: Fuerza Y Accion Group

texts.es: La Señora Mercedes es Presidenta del Banco Comunal "Fuerza y Accion", es conviviente y tiene tres hijos en el colegio. Hace un año que trabaja con Edaprospo y hace 6 que tiene un negocio de cosméticos, empezó con productos que ella tenía de varios catálogos y ahora tiene muchos más productos como: cremas, champú y diferentes tipos de cosméticos en general. Usará este crédito para comprar productos de belleza. Le gustaría seguir creciendo y obtener un monto más alto para ayudar a su familia, construir su casa y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives with her partner and has three children who are all in school. She has collaborated with Edaprospo for a year and she’s had a cosmetics business for six years. She started out with several products she had from various catalogues and now has many more products like: creams, shampoos and different kinds of cosmetics in general. She will use this loan to buy more beauty products. She would like to continue growing and to obtain a larger loan to help her family, build her house and help her children with their higher education expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Florentino; el socio tiene 43 años el es casado y tiene 3 hijos, El socio trabaja como gasfitero en diferentes obras, el también presta sus servicios particulares a casas, el socio también tiene su terreno y siembra papas, maíz, habas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas de gasfitería.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Nueva Victoria – Chinchero. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city.

Florentino is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children. He works as a plumber on different projects and he also offers his private services to homes. He also has his own land and plants potatoes, corn, and beans. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of plumbing tools.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments in the stipulated timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plumbing tools

loans.name: Rocío Moserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Rocío tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hermosos niños, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y cerrajería, en su casa que es de caña viven seis personas.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, trabaja sola desde las 9am hasta las 11am, realiza sus quehaceres y vuelve en la tarde de 2pm hasta las 5pm, nos cuenta que muchas veces no puede salir a trabajar porque tiene una bebe de meses y eso le complica a veces su trabajo, pero que busca la forma porque si no atiende a sus clientes los puede perder.  Compra su mercadería en Portoviejo en un lugar donde le dejan a buen precio.  Además tiene un criadero de chanchos a los cuales los compra pequeños, los crías y luego los vende, este negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias.

Este crédito que recibió lo va a invertir la mitad en comprar mercadería (ropa) y la otra parte en comprar chanchos pequeños y alimentos para estos. Está en el Banco hace varios ciclos y le gusta por su seriedad.
 
Sus metas son tener su casa de hormigón y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
The community bank named "May 3" meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Rocio is 26 years old and she lives with her boyfriend. Together they have four beautiful children. Her boyfriend is a construction worker and a locksmith. In their house, made of sugar can sticks, six people live. She sells all types of clothing. She works from 9am to 11 am, then does some house work and works again from 2pm until 5pm. Often she can't go out to work because she has a newborn at home and it interferes with her work schedule. But she always tries to find a way to attend to her clients to not risk losing them. She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo where she gets the best prices. She also raises pigs. She buys the livestock when they are only piglets, she raises them and then sells them. This business has brought her much success. Half of this loan will be used to in the purchase of merchandise (clothing) and the other part will be used to purchase piglets and their feed. She has been part of community bank through various loan cycles and she likes the formality of business carried out. Her goals are to have house made of brick and mortar and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco; situado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad.

La Sra. Guadalupe; tiene 54 años D. edad y ella tiene un hijo la socia es conviviente y trabaja en su tienda D. abarrotes vendiendo productos D. primera necesidad, La socia necesita comprar andamios para organizar su tienda y colocar sus diferentes productos; también debera comprar algunos productos más para implementar su tienda, como por ejemplo arroz, aceite, azúcar, fideos, galletas, harinas, bebidas frias; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su tienda y comprar andamios y algunos víveres D. primera necesidad, para implementar la tienda abarrotes con arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas, galletas y más productos D. abarrotes.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Nueva Victoria – Chinchero. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city. Guadalupe is 54 years old and has a son and a live-in partner. She works in her grocery store selling basic needs products. She needs to buy scaffolding so that she can organize her store and place her different products on high shelves, for example rice, oil, sugar, pasta, crackers, flour and cold drinks. She is requesting this loan to invest in her store by buying scaffolding and some basic food items, like rice, sugar, oil, flour, crackers and other dry goods. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments in the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her store and to purchase scaffolding and supplies to set up

loans.name: Decsi Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Decsi mantiene una relación de unión libre hace ya 25 años, tiene 6 hijos los cuales todos estudian y aun viven en su casa, el esposo se dedica a la venta de legumbres en un triciclo el cual recorre la ciudad para hacer sus ventas.

En los actuales momentos ella trabaja en la venta de legumbres en su casa dice que el negocio es pequeño pero esto le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, trabaja desde 4am hora que junto a su esposo se va al mercado a comprar las frutas y legumbres que estén bien frescas para venderlas en el transcurso del día. Labora hasta las 3pm.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas y verduras. Además de sillas, mesas ollas, y otros artículos para poner una picantería (restaurant). Está en el banco desde hace 10 ciclos y le gusta el banco por que presta el dinero sin muchos tramites.
 
Sus metas son que su negocio sea productivo y comprar un piano para su hijo que quiere ser músico.
texts.en:
The community bank named "May 3" meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Decsi has been with her boyfriend for 25 years. They have 6 children together and they all go to school and still live at home. Her husband sells vegetables from a tricycle that he drives throughout town to make his sales. She also sells vegetables but from her house and she says that the business is small but it helps her contribute towards the family's expenses. She works from 4am, the same time when her husband goes to the markets to purchase their fruits and vegetables, to have the freshest product possible to sell during the day. She works until 3pm. This new loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables, as well as chairs, tables, and other items to set up a small restaurant. She has been a member in the community bank for the past 10 loan cycles and she enjoys this community bank because there isn't a lot of red tape. Her goal is to have her business be more productive and purchase a piano for her son. He wants to be a musician.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables and furniture to set up a restaurant.

loans.name: Trabajando Hacia El Bienestar 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Anselma is the coordinator of her group, Trabajando hacia el Bienestar 1, 2 & 3 (Working to the welfare). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house as she is living in bad conditions right now.
Anselma is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year and a half, and she started it by making breakfasts with a loan she took from another company. She plans to use her new loan to invest in her business by buying chairs and tables for her comedor, where she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. (A comedor is a small restaurant located in a non-commercial area or neighborhood, where people come for lunch or dinner. They are served homemaD. food for a cheaper price than in a restaurant or cafeteria.) Anselma will use her profits to buy a bed and a television. She plans to have a good, successful business because she wants to see her wishes come true and her business is her only hope. 
This Esperanza associate began with us because "I have a business and I need to make my business sustainable". Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Margarita Agustina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya 15 ciclos, dice que le han ayudado mucho sobre todo en momentos difíciles en las que se encontró después del fallecimiento de su esposo hace 15 años,  pero ella aun lo recuerda con tristeza, dice que esto lo compensa con el amor que le brindan sus hijos ya que siete de ellos viven con ella.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, legumbres y frutas en el mercado de Manta. Trabaja tres últimos días de la semana, empieza su labor desde las 4am que parte al mercado de Portoviejo a comprar los mejores productos para llevarlos a sus clientes en Manta, ella regresa  tarde después de vender todo.
 
Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar todos estos productos en especial frejol de palo que es muy pedido y limón que esta escaso y se vende a buen precio.

Su sueño es tener una gran tienda en su casa para no tener que viajar más.
texts.en:
The community bank named "May 3" meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Margarita has been a member of the community bank for the past 15 loan cycles. She says that the loans have helped her immensely especially during the difficult time when her husband passed away. She still remembers him with sadness but her heart is filled again with the love that his children bring her. All seven children live with her. She sells vegetable sand fruits in the market in Manta. She works from Friday to Sunday, starting at 4am when she goes to the market in Portoviejo to purchase the best products to bring back to her clients in Manta. She comes back home only after she has sold all her stock. Thsi new loan will be used to purchase various products, especially corn because it is highly sought out and lemons because there is a shortage and she can sell at a good price. Her dream is to have a large store in her house and not have to travel any more.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, fruits, vegetables, and lemons.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Ines, tiene 31 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, ella es artesana, la socia da clases de alfabetización ella pertenece a un programa de alfabetización en su pueblo para ayudar a las mamas y gente mayor a que puedan aprender a leer y escribir, ella también se dedica junto a otro grupo de artesanos al arte textil ella forma un grupo de 14 personas que tienen a su cargo realizar trabajos en telas de colores y con diseños propios del ande (los diseños que recrean la vivencia diario e estos bellísimos pueblos, ellas colocan montañas nevadas, riachuelos, lagunas, patos silvestres, arboles, casitas de arcilla y adobe, animalitos sueltos disfrutando de la armonía y la paz del lugar) así como es el pueblo de Chinchero. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas para elaborar textiles.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Nueva Victoria – Chinchero. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city.

Ines is 31 years old, has a live-in partner, and has two children. She is an artisan and teaches literacy classes. She belongs to a literacy program in her town to help mothers and adults to learn to read and write, and she also works with another group of artisans on textile arts. She has a group of 14 people that work making colored fabrics with designs specific to the Andes as well as the town of Chinchero. The designs that they recreate are of daily life and the beautiful towns. They add snowy mountains, streams, lakes, wild ducks, trees, clay and adobe houses, and animals free and enjoying the peace of the area. Ines is requesting the loan to purchase wool to make her textiles.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments in the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool to make her textiles

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Elsa ; tiene 42 años de edad, la socia tiene 4 hijos y la socia es artesana y ella lleva todos sus trabajos a Urubamba para venderlos allá, La socia sale de su pueblo para buscar mejor postores para su trabajo, ella es una mujer que siempre sale adelante pese a las pocas oportunidades que el país da a los artesanos y a la situación económica baja que ella tiene sigue prestándose  para poder comprar materiales y continuar con su trabajo y así crecer poco a poco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales y realizar su arte y finalmente viajar a Urubamba a llevar sus tejidos para la venta.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Nueva Victoria – Chinchero. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city.

Elsa is 42 years old and has 4 children. She is an artisan and she brings all of her pieces of work to Urubamba to sell. She leaves her town in search of better bidders for her pieces of work. Elsa is a woman that always gets ahead, despite the few opportunities that the country has for artisans and the poor economic situation. As a result, she has to continue borrowing to be able to purchase materials and continue with her work to have her business grow, little by little. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to make her handicrafts and go to Urubamba after to bring her weavings to sell.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments in the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco; situado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad.

La socia Asunta; tiene 63 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos, La socia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, ella requiere el préstamo para implementar su tienda y comprar productos D. primera necesidad al por mayor; La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite, leche entre otros.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Nueva Victoria – Chinchero. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city.

Asunta is 63 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has a grocery store and needs the loan to set up her store and purchase basic needs items at wholesale price. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, oil, and milk, among other products.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments in the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil, milk, and other products

loans.name: Ligia Aracely

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Tiene 55 años pero tiene muchas energías así es la señora Ligia, está casada hace 36 años y de esta linda relación tuvieron 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero dos de ellos aún viven con ella en su casa.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior de todo tipo, además de camisetas deportivas, ella junto con su esposo atienden su local que tienen en su propia casa, trabajan desde las 8am hasta las 6pm, venden al por mayor a comerciantes de la zona a los cuales les deja a crédito y a buen precio. La mercadería las adquieren en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viajan una vez al mes y en otros casos solo hacen los pedidos y se los envían.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar más mercadería, ya que tiene muchos productos entregados y tiene muchos pedidos por entregar.

 Sus metas son seguir adelante y comprar un buen carro.
texts.en:
The community bank named May 3 meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Ligia is 55 years old but she is full of energy. She has been married for 36 years and from this beautiful marriage came 5 children. They are all grown but two are still living at home. She has a business selling undergarments of all kinds but she also sells t-shirts. She and her husband manage the store located in a section of their home. They work from 8am to 6pm. They sell in wholesale to retailers in the region. They complete their sales in credit and they always offer their merchandise at a good price. They purchase their merchandise in the city of Guayaquil where they travel once a month or more often if they receive special orders. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise. She has filled many orders and she still has many orders outstanding. Her goal is to advance and to purchase a good car.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase undergarments and t-shirts.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Tomasa; la socia tiene 64 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene  un pequeño taller artesanal, ella realiza textiles y ahora desea comprar una arpillera para realizar los textiles y poderlos exhibir, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una arpillera para sus trabajos de textilería.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Communal bank "NUEVA VICTORIA (NEW VICTORY) - CHINCHERO." This bank is located in the Chinchero district, Urubamba province, and Cusco district. It is located 45 minutes from the city.

Member Tomasa is 64 years old, married, and owns a small art shop. She produces fabrics and now she wants to buy sackcloth to make clothes and be able to exhibit them. The loan will then be used to buy sackcloth for her textile work.

The member is thankful for the loan being available through this medium and in the same manner commits to repay the loan in the scheduled payments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sackcloth for her textile work.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco; situado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad.

La socia Marleni; La socia tiene 37 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, La socia es la representante nacional D. pueblos andinos, ella conocedora del buen arte y ser ganadora D. muchos premios por su fino trabajo en textileria, a sido fotografiada y documnetada en diversos documentales y filmes internacionales, llevando el proceso D. su arte a la pantalla, para ellos no es algo normal verse en la televisión, y es que este pequeño y pintoresco pueblo Chinchero, es mágico y atrae miles D. turistas a sus placitas y callejuelas caprichosas, el aire puro las sonrisas cálidas D. los lugareños, son sin duda lo mejor que tiene Chinchero, entonces es por estas razones que innumerables veces se ha visto a gente muy importante paseando en ellas, La socia es muy modesta y sin ningún lujo, ella sonríe feliz a la vida, deseando lo mejor para su pueblo, ella sigue siendo una D. las destacadas artesanas, ella continua estudiando ingles y junto a esto desea comprar materiales e invertir en el taller al que representan en su comunidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar, detergentes naturales, tintes, lanas y otros materiales y sus clases D. ingles.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Marleni, 37, is married and has 4 children. She is a National Representative of Andean Peoples. She is knowledgeable of fine art and has won many awards for her textiles. She has been photographed and documented in various documentaries and international films taking her art processes to the big screen. For them it is not at all usual to see themselves on television. But this small and picturesque town of Chinchero is magic and attracts thousands of tourists to its small squares and whimsical lanes. The pure air and warm smiles of the locals are, without a doubt, the best that Chinchero has. For these reasons very important personages have often been seen strolling through town. Marleni is very modest with no luxuries. She smiles happily at life wishing the best for her town. She continues to be one of its most outstanding artisans. She continues taking English classes and also wants to buy supplies and invest in the workshop that represents her community. She is asking for funds to buy natural detergents, dyes, wools and other materials and for her English classes. She is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA-CHINCHERO” communal bank which is located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department, 45 minutes from the city. She avails herself of this forum to express her gratituD. for the loan as well as to commit to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural detergents, dyes, wools and other materials and for her English classes.

loans.name: Grimaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Grimaldina; la socia tiene 83 años de edad y ella es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, la socia tiene como principal fuente la agricultura y con ello ella cría animales menores, ella también se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y aves de corral, la socia vende sus animalitos cuando considera que ya están listos para irse de casa, ella es una mujer muy dulce y también tiene una tienda abarrotes que sus hijos le han puesto para que ella ya no esté asistiendo a cultivar sus terrenos, ella tiene una vida más tranquila ahora, ella está en el grupo para buscar un motivo de reunión mensual junto a sus vecinos y amigos, La socia invertirá el monto que solicito para implementar su tienda y comprar aves de corral.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "NEW VICTORY - CHINCERO" communal bank. This bank is situated in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco; located 45 minutes from the city. The associate, Grimaldina, is 83 years of age and a single mother with 3 children. Agriculture is her main source of income and along with this the raising of small animals. She is also dedicated to the breeding of pigs and poultry. The associate sells her small animals when she considers that they are ready to leave the house. She is a very sweet woman. She also has a convenience store that her children have built for her so that she no longer has to tend her fields. She has a more tranquil life now. She is in the group to find a way to meet monthly with her neighbors and friends. The associate will invest the amount that she requests to supply her store and to buy poultry. The associate is grateful for the loan granted in this way and likewise promises to comply with her loan payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her store and poultry to raise.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco; situado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad.

La socia Juana; La socia tiene 56 años D. edad, ella tiene 4 hijos y junto a dos D. ellos tiene un pequeño restaurante, ella cocina muy rico y gracias a su excelente sazón, los vecinos son muy leales a su restaurante, ella está implementando poco a poco su negocio, decorándolo, comprando mas vajilla, comprando ingredientes, mejorando la calidad D. sus platos y todo esto para mantenerse en el mercado. La socia  solicita el préstamo para invertir en las mejoras D. su restaurante y comprar ingredientes al por mayor, como arroz, aceite, entre otros.

 La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "NEW VICTORY - CHINCHERO" communal bank . This bank is situated in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city. The associate, Juana, is 56 years of age. She has 4 children and has a small restaurant with two of them. She cooks very rich dishes and, thanks to her excellent seasonings, the neighbors are very loyal to her restaurant. She is growing her business little by little; decorating it, buying more dishes, buying ingredients, improving the quality of her dishes; all this to improve her position in the market. The associate requests the loan to invest in the improvements to her restaurant and to buy ingredients wholesale, such as rice and oil, among others. The associate is grateful for the loan granted in this way and also promises to comply with the loan payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients wholesale for her restaurant

loans.name: Gregoria Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Gregoria, ella es madre soltera de tres hijos uno mayor y dos pequeñitos por los que ella lucha día a día para sacarlos adelante.

Ella es vendedora ambulante, vende ropa interior de todo tipo pero lo que más vende son interiores de hombres. Trabaja  todos los días en la  terminal terrestre desde las 8 am hasta las 2pm en algunos días  y desde las 12pm hasta las 8pm en otros días. Su mercadería la compra en Picoaza en un lugar donde le dejan a crédito y buen precio, dice que  a pesar de la crisis económica le va más o menos bien.

Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 26 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos  y está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que siempre le ha brindado. Este crédito lo va emplear para incrementar su negocio, en especial comprar  camisetas interiores que sus clientes le piden mucho.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local con vitrinas y bien surtido.
texts.en:
The community bank named May 3 meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Gregoria is a single mother of three children. One is independent and two other little ones that still live with her. She struggles every day to support them. She sells undergarments of all kinds but the product that sells best is men's undergarments. She works every day at the bus station from 8am until 2pm. Some days she works from 12 noon until 8pm. She buys her merchandise in Picoaza where she acquires her items on credit and at a good price. Despite the economic crises her business has fared fairly well. She has been a member of the community bank for the past 26 loan cycles and she enjoys it because the loans are very quickly. She is very grateful to Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) for the support they have provided her. This loan will be used to increase her business, especially to purchase t-shirts, product that is always in high demand. Her dreams are to have a well stocked store equipped with display cases.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase undergarments and t-shirts.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Clara; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, ella es separada y tiene 4 hijos, La socia es artesana y trabaja con este rubro, ella paralelamente a esto esta tras comprar un terreno en su pueblo y requiere aumentar a lo que ella ya tiene ahorrado, La socia solicita el préstamo para aumentar y poder comprar su propio terreno.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "NEW VICTORY - CHINCHERO" communal bank. This bank is situated in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city. The associate, Clara, is 36 years of age. She is separated and has 4 children. The associate is an artesan and works in this area. In conjunction with this she is seeking to buy land in her town and needs to add to what she has already saved. The associate requests the loan to add to her savings to be able to buy her own land. The associate is grateful for the loan granted in this way and at the same time promised to comply with the payments according to the schedule stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para aumentar y poder comprar su propio terreno.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Vilma; La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo, ella es comerciante minorista, la socia trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de golosinas, ella es ambulante lleva a la puerta del colegio fiscal todos los días a la salida de los escolares, fuguritas, galletas, refrescos, chupetines, dulces y otros para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de golosinas para la venta.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Nueva Victoria Chinchero community bank. The bank is located in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco, about 45 minutes from the city [of Cusco?]. The member, Vilma, is 28 years old and divorced with one child. She works as a street vendor, selling all kinds of snacks. She sets up every day at the entrance to a school where she can sell "fuguritas", cookies, cold drinks and other snacks. She is applying for a loan to buy products that she will then resell. Vilma is grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Luon

texts.en:
Mrs. Luon T. was born in 1956. She has established a small family in the best territory of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a single mother who has six children, one of whom is married and the remaining five of whom are single.
In order to generate profit, Luon T. travels to the forest to collect or buy chop-wood to resell at her home. To help meet the family's financial crisis, one of her daughters is also employed at a massage club. Luon T. is taking out a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle so that her daughter is able to ride to work without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle for her daughter

loans.name: Shinedorj

texts.en:
Shinedorj is 55 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His three children are all grown up but still live in their parents' house. His eldest daughter, Myagmarsuren, is 28 and works at the Mongolian National Broadcasting Company. His next daughter, Tserendulam, is 23 and works as a salesperson in a shopping center. His youngest son, Otgonbaatar, is 21 and works with his father in his transportation business. Shinedorj’s wife, Adyasuren, works in a hospital as a cleaner.
Before 2000, Shinedorj worked as a truck driver until the company was shut down. Then in the year 2000 he bought a minivan and started his transportation business. He carries people from the east end of Ulaanbaatar city to Narantuul market, the biggest and most crowded market in Ulaanbaatar city.
Shinedorj is planning to build a house for his family. He is asking for a loan because he wants to buy building materials and concrete to start to build the basement of the house this year. He is planning to finish the basement before the winter and continue the building work next spring.

loans.use: To buy building materials and concrete to start to build his house

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeurn S. is 30 years old, married, and has two children who attend the local public school. She owns a small shop in her village where she sells food and fruits to her nearby neighbors. She typically makes around $4 profit each day to meet her family's needs. Her husband works as a porter in the busy market.
Oeurn S. normally hires a motor taxi to travel to and from the market where she buys items for her business. She hopes to have a vehicle, which will allow her to travel without hiring taxis. To achieve her goal, Oeurn S. is requesting a loan to purchase a used motorbike. Any remaining cash from the loan will be used to increase her capital.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Hut

texts.en: Mr. Hut K., 24, is single and works as a fisherman. He usually fishes for eight hours a day in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches kilos of fish each day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retailers in the market. Hut K. currently lives with his elderly mother who organises the daily routine and also helps him in his fishing business. Hut K. will use his loan to purchase additional fishing tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing tools

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en:
Enkhbat is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Enkhbat used to work as a truck driver but since 2002 he has been working in a taxi business. He works for a taxi company and serves customers from the call center. Enkhbat's eldest son, Ishzundui, is 31 and a disabled person. He has been deaf from birth and stays at home helping around the house. Enkhbat’s youngest son, Togtoh, is 16 and studies at college. He has to pay school fees each year. Enkhbat’s wife, Dolgor, weaves ropes made of horse hair and used in gers, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tents. She has her own customers and sells the ropes to them.
Twenty-three years ago Enkhbat’s family suffered a big loss. Their home was burnt down and they lost all their belongings. Enkhbat is requesting this loan so that he can pay his son's school fees and buy some furniture for the house.

loans.use: To pay his son's school fees and buy furniture for the house

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang N. is 30 years of age and is a resident of Siem Reap Province. Hang N. is a good homemaker who spends her time either taking care of her kids or cooking delicious meals for her family. The family's daily expenses are covered by Hang N.’s husband, who owns a car that he uses to pick up tourists who want to visit the temples in Siem Reap Province. Hang N. has a younger sister who lives with them and works as a staff member in a hotel. 

Hang N. will be using her fist loan to buy a used motorcycle to make her family's transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mr. Him H., 26, and his wife, 27, support their family by fishing with fishing implements along the Tunle Sap River. They wake up at dawn every day to gather the fish from their nets, which they put in the water the night before. After that, they re-set the nets in the water to harvest fish again in the late afternoon. After gathering the fish from the river, Him H. hurries to the market so that he can sell at a suitable price. Him H. requests a loan to buy extra fishing tools to be used to increase the fish quantity.

loans.use: To buy extra fishing tools to be used to increase the fish quantity

loans.name: Som-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Som-ol C. (in the photo) is a weaver and her husband, Mr. Chheng Pong, is a farmer. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for over 30 years and have four children:  three sons and one daughter. Som-ol and her husband are old, but they are still strong enough to work. 

Som-ol has asked for a Kiva loan two times already. She is now applying for her third loan of $450 to help her husband purchase fertilizers, fuel oil and seeds for farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, fuel oil and seeds for farming

loans.name: Sothach

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothach H. (in the photo), 50, is a widow with two children--one son and one daughter. Her son is a driver and her daughter is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Sothach has been renting out a space in her house to garment factory workers for ten years. Because her house is located near a garment factory, it’s good for her to operate this business. Some rooms of her house are old and broken down, so Sothach is requesting her first loan of US$ 1,000 to make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chhorn C., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Nareth Ny, 32 (pictured together), live in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1993 and have two children--one son and one daughter. One of them attends school and other one is still very young. 

Chhorn has been a construction worker since 1988, while his wife has been a garment factory worker since 1995. He is asking for his first loan of US$ 300 to add to his own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Mrs. Chak S. is a 42-year-old woman residing in a stone house located in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She was married, but divorced her husband years ago. She now has three children. One of them is already married and lives independently and the other two are single. 

To pursue a daily income, Chak S. has several sewing machines that she uses to sew or repair clothes for her villagers. She also buys cloth and turns it into sets of men's and ladies' clothes. In addition, she hires out clothes to people for their wedding parties. She sometimes receives help with the sewing from her children. 

Chak S. needs a loan to buy cloth and sewing equipment to perform her tailoring service.

loans.use: To buy cloth and sewing equipment

loans.name: Marta Magdalena

texts.es: Marta Magdalena T. D. S. es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable la cual tiene 59 años D. edad, vive con su esposo, hijo y sobrino; el negocio es una pequeña tienda llamada “tienda Magdalena” que se ubica en su vivienda en el municipio D. Soyapango. Marta, es una persona muy emprendedora y decidida a ayudar a su familia, poniendo su pequeño negocio el cual es D. gran ayuda para poder cubrir algunas D. sus necesidades. El préstamo ha sido solicitado para cancelar pedidos pasados, además D. invertir muchos más en nuevos y variados productos que se necesitan en la tienda y sus clientes piden, Marta es una persona humilD. pero D. gran corazón, emprendedora y trabajadora, que vela por el bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en:
Marta Magdalena T. D. Solorzano is a very hard working and responsible woman. She is 59 years old and she lives together with her husband, their son and her nephew. She owns a small store named "Magdalena's Store". It is located in a section of her house in the municipality of Soyapango. Marta is an entrepreneurial woman, focused on helping her family. Having her little store has been a great help in meeting some of their needs. The loan requested will be used to fill orders and to invest in new products for her store, as requested by her clients. Marta is a humble person but she has a big heart, entrepreneurial, hard working and always in search for the best for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable goods.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Batmunkh is 32 years old and lives with his wife Oyunsuren and two children aged 5 and 3 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The two children attend a local kindergarten. Batmunkh is an engraver who specializes in making different religious sets and souvenirs, etc. and sells some of them in State department stores. Some of the items he sells at the Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. 

He started his craft in 1996. His products that commemorate Christ’s birth as well as Buddhist and Shaman items are in good demand from the customers and sometimes he makes things for clients to order. Batmunkh’s future plan is to have his own workshop and to teach his skill to the children. His wife Oyunsuren is a fashion designer and tailor. She makes various clothing according to her own design and sells them on the Narantuul market. 

Batmunkh is hardworking, self confident, and an open-minded person. Two years ago he bought a plot of land and a house but could not make any renovations to the house. The loan which he is requesting will be used for renovation and decoration of the house. He intends to invest some of the money in his and his wife’s business, increasing her working capital.

loans.use: renovation and decoration of the house, also to increase his and his wife's working capital

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en:
Imelda B. is from the village of Cebu San Isidro. She is 49 years old. Imelda is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Imelda is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture selling fruits and vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from vending fruits, vegetables, and snacks in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot S. is a 39-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Battambang in Cambodia. She is a local fish seller. In addition, she sews clothes for her nearby neighbors to make extra profit. Sot S. has a life partner in her husband who is a construction foreman. The family includes two devoted children. Both of them are single and work with their father in the construction sector. Sot S. would like a loan of $600 in order to purchase a secondhand motorcycle which will allow her family to drive to work or anywhere else.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea S., a long-time businesswoman, currently uses her skills and lengthy experience in beauty salon practices to earn a living in Battambang province, where she has her own beauty salon. In her shop, she provides hairdressing, make-up, tailoring, and wedding decorating services to people who are her nearby neighbors. While providing those services, she has begun to sell perfumes and jewelry to some of her clients.

Phea S. is a single mother blessed with three school-aged children who are dependent on her income. She is now requesting a loan to accumulate working capital, which will allow her to improve her profit.

loans.use: To accumulate working capital, which will allow her to improve her profit.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg is a 43-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and two daughters, aged 13 and 20, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Oyunchimeg’s husband used to work in South Korea on labor contract. Two years ago, he came back from Korea and bought a plot of land with his savings and built a house by himself. Oyunchimeg’s eldest daughter studies in Medical College and the youngest one studies in the local secondary school. Oyunchimeg rents a stall in Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells secondhand clothes which come from abroad. She has been running this retail business since the year 2000. She is also one of Credit Mongol's reliable VIP customers. Her family used to live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. She says that a loan from Credit Mongol helped her a lot. Now she has her own house, an established business and a family car. She is a very hardworking, self-motivated and persistent person. The reason she is asking for this loan is she wants to buy 10 bundles of winter clothes from the wholesalers and increase her inventory before the fall. One bundle of clothes weighs around 100 kilos.

loans.use: To buy 10 bundles of clothes from the wholesalers

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly M., 51 years old, is a married woman and mother currently staying at home to be responsible for the household's daily routine. Ly has been earning a small income by buying used goods to resell from home, and she also relies on the income from her husband, who fishes in and around the river. This couple has four children, all unmarried and employed in different occupations.

Ly is seeking a loan of $500, which will enable her to improve the financial capital of her used goods business. Because she was not available when the photo was taken, her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To improve the financial capital of her used goods business.

loans.name: Estrengel

texts.en:
Estrengel R.' main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. He is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Calinaoan. Estrengel has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Estrengel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Estrengel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel D. J. is from the village of Calinaoan. He is 21 years old, married and has 1 infant. Manuel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Manuel is just starting this business.

In 2010, Manuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manuel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Manuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esther Kuresoi

texts.en:
Esther Kuresoi Y. is 27 years old and she supports five members of her family. Her spouse, Pion Y., assists her in farming. She has been successfully farming wheat  for the last five years due to good climatic conditions and a ready market for the wheat in her area.
 
This being her first loan, she is planning to spend it to buy fertilizer and chemicals for her ten acre wheat farm. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand her wheat farming to large scale. Her hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, to be able to educate her children to higher levels of education and to achieve a good living standard. She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her set targets.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel R. is from the village of Poblacion III. She is 23 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Maricel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling mobile phone electronic loads in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas.
