Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel A. is from the village of Poblacion III. She is 42 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Maricel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina Q. is from the village of Poblacion III. She is 37 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Felina owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling pots to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-one years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Felina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Felina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Misak

texts.en:
Misak S. is 22 years old and lives in Vazashen village, Ijevan area, with his parents and a sister. This year he graduated from the European educational regional academy, Ijevan branch, and now he works at Vazashen village administration.

For a long time, Misak and his family have been engaged in animal husbandry and land cultivation. Thanks to farming, they have been able to support their family, buy necessary furniture for their home and pay for Misak’s education.

Misak seeks a 500,000 AMD loan to buy another cow and fodder for his farm animals. He says the Kiva loan will allow him and his family to develop their farming and to increase their family's income.

loans.use: To buy another cow and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Normita

texts.en: Normita R. is from the village of Poblacion III. She is 45 years old and is married with eight school-aged children. Normita owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling pots to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Normita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Normita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.  About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun K. has been spending her life cultivating crops, a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has five school-aged kids. Her husband (in the photo) works in the farm fields, frequently alongside her, and he also travels to fish around the river for extra income. This coming fishing season, Yun K.’s husband doesn’t have enough tools to fish. Thus, Yun K. decided to seek a loan in the amount of $700 to be used to buy fishing tools for her husband to fish. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will cultivate rice crops.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools for her husband to fish

loans.name: Rose Ndavu

texts.en: Rose Ndavu K. is a 35-year-old lady married to Mwaniki K.. They have two children, ages 3 and 10. They live in Kimumu, outside of Eldoret town. Rose has a grocery store where she earn her income. She has been in this business for the past five years with an income of 2,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. Ndavu was introduced to KADET by a friend, and she is applying for her first loan of 10,000 KES with KADET. With this loan, she plans to buy bananas, tomatoes, onions, carrots, pilipili hoho (hot pepper sauce) and Irish potatoes. She hopes to operate a large scale grocery, whereby she can supply hotels (restaurants) and sell the best quality for her customers. In the future, she hopes to extend the same services to the city centre.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, tomatoes, onions, carrots, pilipili hoho and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en: Boldbaatar is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and two boys, ages 8 and 16, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Boldbaatar is a very talented crafty person. He makes engraved morin khuur – a traditional Mongolian musical instrument which is made of cedar wood and horse tail. Mongolian people say that keeping a morin khuur at home brings good luck to the family. Boldbaatar learned this skill from his friend while in the Army service. He sells his instruments in the state department store. He also makes different things from leather, such as pen and key holders, and sells them as well. In the year 2000, Boldbaatar bought a piece of land and did some groundwork to make it flat. Currently his family lives in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). He is building a house for his family and it is 90% complete at the moment. He says that his goal is to complete the house – it is the biggest investment he has made in his life. The reason he is requesting the loan is he wants to buy some building materials to complete the house before the winter.

loans.use: To buy building materials to complete his house before the winter

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mr. Pen S. earns his living and is highly skilled at building stone houses. He goes to work from construction site to construction site around his community, earning $6 per day. He is a single man and he resides with his elderly widowed mother who helps to arrange a daily routine. Pen S. says that he currently pays much money to hire a taxi to travel to his work location. He would like to have his own vehicle, which would allow him to commute to work without hiring a taxi. As he doesn’t have money yet to buy one, Pen S. is applying for a loan in order to buy a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle to commute to his job sites

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson T. Sr. is from the village of Sandiat West. He is 55 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Samson owns and operates a business  raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Samson has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Samson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Samson is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Samson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah I. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are in school. Leah has a business selling yellow bananas. She has been in this business for 7 years and she works 6 days a week. Leah sells her products at the market at the wholesale level. Leah has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of  yellow bananas. The main business challenge for Leah is the rainy season because she works from an open place. Her goals and aspirations for her business are  to start going directly to villages for yellow bananas. Leah lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un Y. is a 46-year-old widowed villager who lives in Kampong Chhnang province. She is the mother of four children: two are employed, one is a taxi driver and one is a garment worker. Her husband died of senility years ago. Although a widow, she is a determined woman who tries to earn money from making clay stoves. She saves up many sets of stoves before selling to her customers. Recently, she got orders for stoves but she doesn't have enough supplies to complete them. Therefore, Un Y. needs a loan in order to purchase clay to make stoves to better meet her buyers' requirements.

loans.use: To purchase clay to make stoves

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S. is 30 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local market for more than two years. She sells fish that she buys in bulk from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. Hem S. is married to Shorn Kimsean, 28, who owns a shop where he provides a glass decorating service. This couple has three children who attend school and help their parents with their work when they are free from studying. Their small family house is getting old and frequently needs repairs. Hem S. has been planning to build a new house to live in, but her savings are insufficient to start construction. Therefore, Hem S. decided to seek a loan to be used to start building a new house.

loans.use: To start building a new house.

loans.name: Sem Pean's Group

texts.en:
There are four borrowers who are taking this loan together. The group's leader, Mrs. Sem P., is 55 years old, married and has two children. She has built a store in front of her house where she sells a few items such as cooked ingredients and sweets to the neighbors for a profit. Her husband, Pek Veth, manages their business as well as fishing at the river. Sem P. will be using her loan from Kiva to purchase extra grocery items to sell. This will allow her to accrue a profit to better meet her entire family’s daily expenses. The other borrowers include:
Mr. C., a fisherman, is asking for a loan to support his business.
Mrs. C. will be using her loan to buy nets and traps for fishing.
Mr. T., a fish catcher, is applying for a loan to buy more tools for fishing activities. (Mr. T. was not available when the photo was taken, so his wife is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase extra grocery items to sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. lives in the Masanafu neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her father). Recently, she changed her business enterprise from poultry farming to hairdressing. She has been in this business for a few months and works six days a week. Sylvia works from her home and so doesn’t pay for her business premises.
Sylvia has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of cream relaxers and braids. Sylvia's main business challenge is seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to own a bridal salon. She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because of its good customer care and low interest charged. Sylvia lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and has no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Goun's Group

texts.en:
This small group loan is made up of four members, all residents in the rural area of Siem Reap Province. The members have selected Mrs. Goun P. as leader. She is 35 years old and earns a living with her husband by carrying fish at the local market. This couple has seven children: two work at the same place as their parents and the remaining five are single. Goun P. and her husband also take time to fish in and around the river. Goun P. is requesting a loan to buy tools for fishing.

The other borrowers who are jointly taking this loan are: Mrs. T. is applying for a loan to buy fishing equipment. Mrs. H. is applying for a loan to buy fishing equipment. Mr. H., a fish porter, is asking for a loan to repair his old house.

Note: the people shown in the photograph are Mrs. Goun P., Mrs. T.’s husband, Mrs. H.’s husband, and Mr. H..

loans.use: To buy tools for fishing

loans.name: Chu

texts.en:
H. Chu Thị is a 33-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling flowers in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.392.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 9.632.000 VND that will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Chu Thị (20201030020) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hoa trong cộng đồng địa pH..  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị & dụng cụ mới để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a member of the Gachie Success group in Faulu Kenya. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him finance his business of servicing lawn mowers. He started the business, which is situated in a very busy location, three years ago and has employed one person. He hopes that he will own a big company in the future. Thus far, he has serviced two loans from Faulu Kenya and successfully repaid them. He has requested another loan of 80,000 KES to start a business selling chicken parts. Benard is married and the father of three children.

loans.use: To start a business selling chicken parts

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a 29-year-old outgoing woman. She is a single mother of one. She runs a salon and a mobile money transfer business. For additional income, she rents out houses. Milka formerly ran a grocery store. She has been running her businesses for three years and hopes to open several beauty shops in the future so as to improve her standard of living. She also dreams of adding rental houses in five years. She is thankful to Faulu Kenya because she bought a container which people use as small kiosk and rented it out in three months. With the Mwangaza group in Faulu Kenya, she has been able to service three loans. She is requesting another loan of 80,000 KES to buy hair chemicals, hair braids and a float for her mobile money transfer business.

loans.use: To to buy hair chemicals, hair braids and a float for her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Đặng

texts.en:

To make a living, H. owns and operates a specialized retail store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic products in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 38 years old and a businessman who sells secondhand clothes and shoes. He started the business four years ago after leaving his job. He has become more focused in his business since joining the Kiserian Victory group in Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy secondhand clothes and shoes. George dreams of expanding his business in the future. He is married and has two children who are in school.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes and shoes

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: M. Nguyễn Thị (20201030021) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. M. owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling internet connection and services in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,600,000 VND a month. In 2007, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. M. is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** M. M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 4.600.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2007, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.ar: المقترضة 36 سنة متزوجة ولها خمسة اطفال، المقترضة انهت الدراسة الابتدائية، لقد تقدمت المقترضة بطلب قرض والغرض منه لتطوير صالون التجميل ولشراء كراسي جديدة للحلاقة ومواد تجميل، للمقترضة خبرية طويلة في هذا المجال بحدود 8 سنوات ، يأتي للمقترضة اعداد كبيرة من النساء بسبب خبرتها وبسبب موديلات الحلاقة الحديثة التي تتبعها، وسيساعدها هذا القرض على تطوير الصالون وهذا سيؤدي الى زيادة دخلها، وتنوي ايضا جلب عاملة اضافية تساعدها في العمل.
texts.en:
The applicant is 36 years old, married, and the mother of five children, with a primary school education. The applicant is seeking a loan to hire an assistant and purchase new hairdresser chairs and cosmetic products among other things for the renovation of her beauty salon. Her considerable expertise (cultivated from eight years of working in hairdressing) and her skills in making up the latest coiffures have already drawn in large numbers of female clients. These renovations will help to increase her revenues.

Translated from Arabic by John Halliwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and new hairdresser chairs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Ruth has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 4 years and she works 7 days a week. Ruth sells her products at the market. Ruth has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more carrots, oranges and watermelon. The main business challenge for Ruth is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow big and to start going directly to farmers. She decided to join MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by acquiring additional capital. Ruth lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of carrots, oranges and watermelon

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking single lady who does dairy farming. She is advantaged because her business is located in a favorable environment and she has a ready market. She also does arable farming for additional income.

Grace is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her to improve her financial status. Through Ikinu Clean Shine group under Faulu Kenya, she previously took out a loan of 20,000 KES. She is now requesting another loan of 40,000 KES to buy another cow.

Grace has five years of experience in her business and she hopes to own more cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Nghiêm

T. owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 4,200,000 VND a month. In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. T. is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** T. Nghiêm Thị (20201030025) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở T. phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán áo quần & giày dép trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 18 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2007, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lê

texts.en: Hà Lê Thị (20201030022) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh province. She is married and has two school-aged children. Hà owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,800,000 VND a month. In 2007, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hà is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Hà Lê Thị (20201030022) là 35 tuổi nữ. Hà đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm H.ng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Hà dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is 34 years old and is married with two children in school. He left his former job and started a business selling charcoal. He has now been in the business for two years.

Since he joined Neema group in Faulu Kenya, Danson has become more focused in his business. He has been guaranteed a loan of 40,000 Kes by his group to add to his stock of charcoal.

In five years time, Danson wants to open more business outlets.

loans.use: To add to his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Tống

texts.en: X. Tống H. (20201030024) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh province. She is married and has two school-aged children. X. owns and operates a business providing general services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over sixteen years and earns approximately 4,800,000 VND a month. In 2007, X. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. X. is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** X. Tống H. (20201030024) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, X. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. X. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 16 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, X. kiếm được khoảng 4.800.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2007, X. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. X. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua vật tư cần thiết để mở rộng dịch vụ được cung cấp. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. X. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old and is married with two children aged 10 and 5. She was previously employed before she started running Joy Kindergarten school. She has now been running her business for one year with two employees.

Esther hopes to enlarge her school and to open a primary school in five years time. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to construct a classroom.

loans.use: To construct a classroom

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.ar: المقترضة 21 سنة عزباء، اكملت الدراسة الاعدادية، ستستخدم هذا القرض لشراء ماكينة خياطة جديدة واقمشة، لديها خبرة جيدة في مجال الخياطة فهي تمارس هذا العمل منذ عام 2004، للمقترضة زبائن كثر من النساء ويقومون بخياطة ملابسهم عندها، وللمقترضة شغف كبير لتطوير عملها.
texts.en:
The applicant (21 years old, single, with a junior high education) would like a loan to purchase fabrics and a new sewing machine. Having practiced tailoring since 2004, the applicant has considerable expertise and several female clients. The applicant is most eager to further develop her work.

Translated from Arabic by John Halliwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: N. Nguyễn Thị (20201030007) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh province. She is married and has three adult children. N. owns and operates a food stall, primarily selling rice products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over twelve years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month. In 2007, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. N. is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** N. Nguyễn Thị (20201030007) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, N. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2007, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh hỗ trợ tài chính cho các thành viên gần gũi trong gia đình của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She sells women’s clothing items, e.g.. jeans, sportswear, etc., in one of the city markets. She started this venture with the help of lending assistance in order to get going. She has now been in business for sixteen years. Currently, her turnover is about 30,000 Grivnyas and her monthly net profit is about 10,000 Grivnyas.

Irina loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given her, not only to provide for herself, but also to help her family. The current loan of 15,000 Grivnas will help her business stay stable this fall season, the financial crisis having affected many small businessmen all around Ukraine.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise assortment

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene N. lives in the Lungujja neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

Irene has a business selling local cough syrups. She has been in this business for nine years, and works six days out of every week. She sells her products retail in a shop and also generates additional income through farming. The main business challenges for Irene include transportation and the ever-increasing prices of raw materials.

Irene has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy menthol and empty bottles to use in making cough syrups.

Irene’s goals and aspirations for her business are to make more profit and to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more  menthol and empty bottles for making cough syrups

loans.name: Ulyana

texts.en:
Ulyana is married with a teenage daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Mukachevo where she sells sportswear in one of the local markets called ‘Ilona’. Ulyana has been in the market for 16 years. Currently, she has 45,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 30,000 Grivnyas. 

Ulyana is requesting a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to increase seasonal merchandise and her turnover capital as a result. She can be characterized as a balanced and prudent entrepreneur. Ulyana never takes risks in business and prefers to stick to reasonable planning strategy. She is an experienced market vendor with many years of work in this sphere of trade. She is hoping to stay afloat for many more years to come.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married with a grown son. He is a businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk selling retail items, i.e. men’s underwear, household textiles, sheets, etc. Mykola runs his trade in the Central Market of his home town. He offers a nice selection of merchandise at reasonable price. Mykola has been running the business for 3 years. Presently, his monthly profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas. 

Mykola is seeking a 7,500 Grivnya loan to purchase 200 socks, 40 towels, 40 blankets and assorted men’s underwear for further retail sale. His son is actively helping run the business. Retail vending is the main source of income for the family. Mykola is happy to be self-employed. He says he remembers back when he used to serve in the military and could hardly make ends meet. Mykola is hoping to keep re-investing in his business and thus open his own little clothing store one day.

loans.use: to purchase 200 pairs of socks, 40 towels, 40 blankets, and assorted underwear

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu B. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Nulu has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Nulu sells her products at the market, retail.    

Nulu has requested  a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings which she will use to buy more bunches  of bananas, from MCDT SACCO. 
The main business challenge for Nulu is seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to farmers for bananas. Nulu lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Sitoi Ole

texts.en:
Sitoi Ole K. is 45 years old. He is married to Sialo K. and he is the father of three children. Sitoi is a wheat farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land as he has been doing for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a friend who is already a registered member of KADET LTD. This will be his second loan and he is planning to spend thirty thousand to buy chemicals to spray his already growing wheat. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Sitoi's dream is do large-scale farming, attain financial independence, and improve the living standard of his family. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to buy chemicals to spray his already growing wheat

loans.name: Tipapa Ole

texts.en:
Tipapa Ole R., 32 years old, supports two members of his family. His spouse is Safina R. and they are blessed with one child. He does wheat farming which he has been doing for the last five years successfully, due to good climatic conditions and a ready market for produce in his area.
 
This being his second loan, he is planning to spend twenty thousand to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his five-acre wheat farm and the remaining ten thousand on spraying the wheat. His plan for the anticipated profits is that he will expand his wheat farming to large-scale farming.

His hope is that he will become a large-scale farmer and own some farm machinery. He is a hardworking man and determined to achieve his target.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his five-acre wheat farm and pay for spraying the wheat

loans.name: Salau Ole

texts.en:
Salau Ole K. is 36 years old and married to Kiraposho K.. He supports five people in his family. Salau is a farmer and has been farming for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming.
He learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through a marketing campaign carried out by KADET staff in the area where he lives. This will be his first loan, which he will use to buy pesticides to spray his growing wheat to prevent it from being invaded by pests. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for wheat.
Salau's hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and have his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy pestcides for his wheat farm

loans.name: Tonkei Ole

texts.en:
Tonkei Ole M. is 45 years old and married to Caroline. He supports five people in his family. Tonkei is a farmer and has farmed his own piece of land for the last seven years.
He learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through a friend who is already a registered member of KADET. This loan of 30,000 KES will be his second loan, which he is planning to spend on chemical sprays for his growing wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.
Tonkei's dream is to practise large-scale farming, attain financial independence, and improve his family's standard of living. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals to spray his growing wheat

loans.name: Kirrunyan Ene

texts.en:
Kirrunya Ene K. is 42 years old. She is married to Maren K. and is the mother of three children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last five years.

Kirrunya learned about KADET LTD through an awareness program run by KADET LTD staff in her area of residence. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend 30,000 KES to prepare the land and plant wheat. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a bigger piece of land. Her future dream is to be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she will farm commercially.  Kirrunya believes she is hardworking and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: to prepare the land and plant wheat

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 27-year-old businessman who buys health products at wholesale prices and sells them to his customers at a profit. He is married to Ann Wanjiru, 27 years old, and they have two children, 2 and 9 years old. Christopher runs his business in Gharu; kikuyu and has been in this business for about four years.

Christopher was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he has no other history with any MFI .He is applying for his third loan of KES 60,000 with KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase more Dynapharm products to add to his stock because this will enable him to serve his customers well. He hopes to expand his business to other surrounding towns.

loans.use: to purchase more Dynapharm products to add to his stock

loans.name: Mary  Wanjiru

texts.en:
Mary Wanjiru, 46 years old, is married to Bernard Nyaga, a 48-year-old farmer. They live in Mwimto in Kikuyu. Mary rears pigs, which she later sells at a profit. She has been in this business for the past three years, earning an income of KES 12,000 per month.

Wanjiru was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she is applying for her fourth loan of KES 47,000 with KADET LTD, having repaid her previous loans successfully. With this loan, she plans to buy more pigs to rear and to supply more piglets and bacon to her clients.

Wanjiru hopes to operate a large scale pig farm, which would enable her to supply more pigs to hotels and cafes and eventually extend the same services to the city centre.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to rear and to supply more piglets and bacon to her clients

loans.name: Mary  Moige

texts.en:
Mary Moige, 40 years old, is married to Kennedy, a civil servant, and they have six children aged between 8 and 20 years old. They live in mwimto;kikuyu. Mary has been running a posho (maize) mill as a primary business and also practicing dairy and  poultry farming as a secondary business. She has been operating these businesses since 2005 and she earns a profit of KES 10,000 per month.

Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a member of KADET microfinance. She applying for her third loan of KES 30,000, which she plans to use to buy sacks of maize to grind and chicken and animal feeds to add to her stock. The income that she hopes to earn will be ploughed back into the businesses. 

In the future, she hopes to eventually increase her dairy cows to ten and to be able to distribute fresh milk to her neighborhood. Her businesses have given much support to her family, especially in providing the necessary basics such as food and school fees for her six children, one of whom was an orphan. Mary is hardworking and hopes to give her children a better education

loans.use: To buy chicken and animal feeds and sacks of maize to grind

loans.name: Roseline Lokina

texts.en:
Roseline Lokina M., 24 years old, is married to Pesi M. and is the mother of three children. Roseline has been farming on her own piece of land for the last five years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women who are already registered members of KADET LTD in her area of residence. This will be her second loan, which she is planning to use to plant more wheat, which normally does well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activities from small scale to commercial. Roseline dreams of doing large scale farming and attaining financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to plant more wheat

loans.name: Oltetia Ole

texts.en:
Oltetia Ole Y. is 32 years old. He is a farmer and supports five people in his family. His spouse is Sialo Y. and they have four children aged between three and ten years old. Sialo is a farmer and she helps Oltetia in his farming activity. Oltetia has been a wheat farmer for the last eight years. This will be his second loan and he is planning to spend the 50,000 KES loan on preparing his five-acre farm for planting wheat.
Oltetia is planning to use the anticipated profit to expand his farming activity by hiring a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production. His hope and dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer who owns a bigger piece of land and that he will become financially stable to support his family.

loans.use: To prepare his five-acre farm for planting wheat

loans.name: Tusiampei  Ene

texts.en:
Tusiampei Ene K. is 49 years old and she supports the three members of her family. Her spouse is Kumpash K. and they are blessed with one child. She does wheat farming, which she has been doing for the last three years successfully due to good climatic conditions and a ready market for the produce in her area. This being her second loan, she is planning to spend 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fertilizer and chemicals for her ten acre wheat farm and the remaining 20,000 KES on spraying the wheat.

Her plan for the anticipated profit is that she will expand her wheat farming to large scale farming. Her hope and dream is that she will become a large scale farmer and own some farm machinery. She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for her wheat farm

loans.name: Salina Chepkemboi

texts.en:
Salina Chepkemboi R. is a 40-year-old lady married to Paul Kipngetich Katam. They have six children, ages 22, 18, 16, 14, 11 and 5 years old. They live in Kipchamo outside of Eldoret town. Salina has a general store where she earns her income. She has been in this business for the past five years with an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. She will use her profit to improve their standard of living.

Chepkemboi was introduced to KADET by a friend. She is applying for her third loan of 27,900 KES with KADET after paying her previous loans successfully. With this loan, she plans to buy three bags of sugar, four boxes of cooking oil and three boxes of bathing soap. She hopes to operate wholesale in town and to have a stable source of income for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil and bathing soap

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto F. vive en casa propia solo sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y están casados, el vive en la calle Venezuela de la zona de san Antonio bajo de la ciudad de La Paz, es jubilado rentista y con su renta el cubre todas sus necesidades, el crédito que solicita es para hacerse un chequeo medico ya que sufre de algunas dolencias en el estomago que los médicos de la caja no pueden curar, por consiguiente el acudirá a un medico particular, es cliente de Impro hace 4 años y forma parte de Kiva por segunda vez, esta satisfecho con el trato y con las tasas de interés.

Por tener un buen historial y por el carácter social califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Humberto F. lives alone in a house that he owns. His children are grown and married. He lives on Venezuela Street in the Lower San Antonio neighborhood of La Paz. Humberto is retired and his pension covers his basic needs. He is applying for a loan to pay health care costs. His doctors have referred him to a specialist because they cannot cure a long-standing stomach ailment and he needs the loan to cover the related costs. Humberto has been an Impro client for 4 years and he is pleased with the terms and the interest rates that he gets. He qualifies for this loan because he has a good borrowing history and because his need for the loan meets the social objectives of the bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical exam.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel Alarcón vive en casa propia en la calle moxos de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, vive con su hija menor, es una persona de la tercera edad y la actividad que realiza es la confección de trajes de varón,  con esta actividad el se solventa sus gastos de alimentación y otros ya que es su única fuente de ingresos, ya fue cliente de Kiva en dos oportunidades es cliente de Impro desde hace 5 años y esta satisfecho con las condiciones que se otorga el crédito.

Por tener un buen historial y por la actividad califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Fidel Alarcón lives in a house that he owns on Moxos Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz. He lives with his young daughter. Fidel is an older man, past retirement age, but he still works as a tailor, making men's suits. The income from his work is his only source of income and it covers his basic living expenses. Fidel has been an Impro client for 5 years. He has received two Kiva loans before and is satisfied with the terms of the loans. Fidel has good work and borrowing histories, factors that qualify him for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fees for completing degree work.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna B. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her sisters. Berna has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for ten  years and she works 7 days a week. Berna sells her products retail from home. Berna lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Berna has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy poultry feed and chicks. 
The main business challenges for Berna include high prices for poultry feed and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a delivery van and also own 2000 chickens.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Porfirio Antonio

texts.es: Porfirio es un padre de familia que tiene 4 hijos y la felicidad de tener trillizas y un hijo varón lo cual lo hace muy feliz al lado de su cónyuge; con su familia vive en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, barrio al sur de Barranquilla, donde se combinas las actividades productivas y comerciales, con el futbol y muchos  escenarios recreativos integrados a la comunidad, entre conjuntos residenciales multifamiliares, viviendas individuales y sobre todo mucha música con sonido compartidatido. Este es el ambiente  donde Porfirio tiene el negocio de preparar y vender comidas rápidas como salchipapas, perros calientes, chorizos, hamburguesas y carnes, que inició desde el año 1997  y desde entonces solo descansa los jueves y tiene un horario de 4:00 P.m. hasta las  3:00 P.m del día siguiente. Su actividad genera 3 empleos y es muy competida, pero aprovecha la afluencia de público de la competencia, para hacerle una oferta con elementos diferenciadores como son los componentes que utiliza en la preparación de sus comidas,, las deliciosas salsas  y el código de higiene que mantiene permanentemente. Desde hace tres años está vinculado a la Fundación Santo Domingo y con esta organización ha logrado mejorar su liquidez, aumentar las ventas y utilidades y sobre todo seguir educando a sus hijos. En la actualidad solicita  su credikiva que es su tercer crédito, pues planea comprar insumos para las comidas rápidas en un mayor volumen y de contado, como salsa y tambien refrigerios, porque desde ya está preparándose para las fiestas que se avecinan como la del amor y la amistad y aun las decembrinas. Su sueño es tener una casa propia para su familia y ver sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y ubicados laboralmente.
texts.en:
Porfiro has four children. He has the joy of having triplets and a son. Together with his wife, this makes him very happy. He lives with his family in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio, a neighborhood south of Barranquilla. That is where productive and commercial activities are combined with soccer and many other recreational settings. These are integrated in the community among groups of multi-family residences and individual houses. Above all, there is a lot of music that is shared. It is in this environment that Porfiro has his business. He prepares and sells food like “salchipapas” (fried potato and sausages), hot dogs, sausages, hamburgers and meats. He started in 1997, and since then he only rests on Thursdays. His schedule is from 4:00 p.m. until 3:00 p.m. the following day. He has three employees, and his business is very competitive. He takes advantage of the competition’s flow of people by offering different ingredients to prepare his food, delicious salsas, and a code of hygiene that is always maintained. He has been with the Fundación Santo Domingo for three years. With this organization he has managed to improve his liquidity, increase his sales and profits, and, above all, continue to educate his children. He is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which is his third loan. He plans to buy supplies to make his fast food, like salsa and snacks, in greater volume and for cash. He is preparing for the approaching holidays like Valentine’s Day and the December holidays. His dream is to have his own house for his family. He also dreams of seeing his children become professionals with jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater volume of supplies for fast foods, salsas, and snacks

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el barrio el calvario de lolotiquillo con su hija de 22 años de edad y sus dos nietos de 11 y 7 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta de tortillas durante toda la semana y en momentos por la tarde elabora hamacas junto a su hija.
Doña María solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz y los materiales que se necesitan para la elaboración de hamacas, como son hilo de seda de distintos colores.
Este crédito le ayudara a aumentar su producción de tortillas y la elaboración de hamacas, aumentando sus ventas y obteniendo mejores ingresos que le ayuden a solventar su situación económica.
Sus aspiraciones son poseer un negocio fuerte y estable en la elaboración de hamacas y la venta de tortillas que le aporte lo necesario para poder superar a su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 55, lives in the Calvario de Lolotiquillo neighborhood. She lives with her 22 year old daughter and her two grandchildren, ages 11 and 7. She is a single mother. She sells tortillas all week, and in the afternoons she makes hammocks with her daughter. María is requesting a loan to buy corn and the materials needed, like different colors of silk material, to make hammocks. This loan will help her increase her tortilla and her hammock production. This will increase her sales. She will get more income to help with her financial situation. Her aspirations are to have a strong and stable business making hammocks and selling tortillas. This will provide what is needed for her family to be able to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and different colors of silk material

loans.name: Miraflores De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Miraflores de San Roque es nueva, tiene como presidenta a la señora Martha, la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Panamericana. 
La señora Martha esta casada y es madre de tres niños. Su negocio es el de la compra y venta de calzados. Realiza esta actividad de manera ambulante, generalmente en la feria de San Roque.
Este primer crédito es por Bs 1000 el mismo que será utilizado para la compra de mercadería, es decir calzados de diferentes tamaños y colores.
Las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son ocho mujeres. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de verduras, tejido a mano, venta de zapatos, venta de comida, tienda de estuquería, venta de ropa, venta de libros, tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
The A.C. Miraflores de San Roque group is new. Martha is the president of the communal bank, which belongs to the Panamericana Community Center. Martha is married and has three children. Her business is buying and selling footwear. She sells in an itinerant manner, usually at the San Roque fair. This first loan is for 1,000 BOB. It will be used to buy merchandise. She will buy different colors and sizes of footwear. Eight women are members of the communal bank. They have different businesses like selling vegetables, weaving by hand, selling shoes, selling food, a store of decorative moldings done in stucco, selling clothes, selling books, and a neighborhood store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Different sizes and colors of footwear

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Doña Ana, es una señora de 35 años  de edad, reside en la Colonia San José, San Francisco Gotera, vive con sus cuatro hijos de las edades de 18, 15, 12, 6 años siendo madre soltera, ella posee un negocio de venta de tortillas y tamales y que atiende desde la cinco de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde para la elaboración de las tortillas, la venta de tamales la realiza una vez por semana, ella tiene ocho años de dedicarse a este oficio.
Ella está solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de leña y maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas y los tamales, con la obtención del crédito Doña Ana se beneficia por que podrá comprar la leña y el maíz por mayor cantidad, encontrando su precio más bajo de lo normal, logrando mayores ganancias en sus ventas, viéndose con mayores ingresos su hogar para cubrir sus necesidades.
Su sueño es poder realizar a sus hijos, dándoles la oportunidad de que estudien y se preparen para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 35-year-old woman residing in Colonia San Jose, San Francisco Gotera. She lives with her 4 children, ages 18, 15, 12, and 6, as a single mother. Ana has a business selling tortillas and tamales, which she attends from 5:00am until 1:00pm, making tortillas. She sells tamales once a week. Ana has been involved in this trade for 8 years. Ana is soliciting a loan to buy firewood and corn to make tortillas and tamales. The loan will be of benefit by allowing her to buy firewood and corn in larger quantities, at a price below normal, and to obtain better earnings on her sales, resulting in higher household income to cover necessities. Ana's dream is to be able to advance her children, giving them the opportunity to study and prepare themselves to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SUPPLIES TO MAKE AND SELL TORTILLAS AND TAMALESVenta de tortillas y tamales

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa B.  es una mujer casada que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 23 y 27 años y habita en el popular barrio Simón Bolívar, lugar donde se vive con mucha música y alegría  el folclor caribe y fue el escenario de uno de los primeros aeropuertos de Colombia. Allí Rosa despliega su capacidad emprendedora entre sus vecinos amigos familiares y referidos, vendiendo mercancías como accesorios y prendas elaboradas en oro golfi y plata, negocio iniciado con $400.000 COP hace aproximadamente cuatro años cuando empezó vendiendo fantasía al por mayor y a crédito. Desde que se inició en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 2 años le ha ido muy bien y gracias a sus ganancias obtenidas con este capital prestado, se encuentra mas solvente económicamente, por eso no deja de soñar con tener un gran almacén, donde exhibir sus variedades y agregarle otros productos como papelería, lencería entre otros; en la actualidad Rosa está aplicando a su credikiva para comprar fantasía al por mayor y vender a crédito sus productos, aprovehando las festividades que se avecinan. Su mayor desafío lo representa el crecimiento saludable de su  hijo y su deseo de tener una casa mejor adecuada, donde pueda tener algún día su negocio tal y como ella lo sueña.
texts.en:
Rosa B. is married with two children, ages 23 and 27, and lives in a working-class neighborhood, Simón Bolívar, where music, happiness, and Caribbean folklore thrive. It was the site of one of the first airports in Colombia. There Rosa demonstrates her enterprising talent among her neighbors, friends, family, and references, selling merchandise such as accessories and jewelry made of imitation gold and silver. The business of selling wholesale novelties on credit was started 4 years ago with $400,000 Colombian pesos. Since she started with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation two years ago, everything has gone very well. Thanks to the earnings made with this borrowed capital, she is more economically solvent. Thus she has not given up dreaming of having a large wholesale store where she can display her products and add others such as stationary and lingerie. Rosa is currently applying for the Kiva loan to purchase wholesale novelties and sell her products on credit, taking advantage of the approaching festivities. Her biggest challenge is the growth and health of her son and her desire to have a more adequate house, where she could someday have the business she dreams of.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase women's wholesale novelties and accessories to sell on credit

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren).
Sarah has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works seven days a week. Sarah sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through selling firewood. The main business challenge for Sarah is seasonality.
Sarah's goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and start going to villages for bananas. Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and market dues.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Chicas Liberales Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Chicas Liberales”, el nombre se escogió por ser un grupo de mujeres con deseos de superación, y crecimiento  personal y porque es una forma de obtener fuerzas día con día y así poder sobresalir continuamente, la mayoría de este grupo se encuentra ubicado en el  Estado de Hidalgo,  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.

Maribel N. R. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 26 años, es madre soltera, estudió hasta el tercer año secundaria, es secretaria y tiene 2 hijos (1 mujer y 1 hombre). Ella se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo. La Señora Maribel tiene 1año con la venta de calzado y solicita el préstamo para la compra nuevos catálogos, así poder elevar sus ventas, ahorrar para  adquirir en el futuro un local comercial para tener un mejor desarrollo y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia viviendo tranquilamente sin verse en la necesidad de trasladarse fuera a trabajar.
Sus clientes nos  comentan que la Señora Maribel N. R. es una excelente vendedora ya que realiza visitas a las casas de sus  vecinas,  y con sus compañeras de trabajo, es una mujer muy  trabajadora, muy amable, de excelente carácter y le gusta mucho a lo que se dedica. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo la Señora Maribel se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad que le dan pues con las ganancias de la venta de calzado ella cree podrá llevar a sus hijos de vacaciones un fin de semana a Acapulco. Y cumplir así el sueño de sus hijos.
María Guadalupe R. J. es tesorera de este grupo. Tiene 26años, tiene la preparatoria terminada. Vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos (10, 6 y 3 años respectivamente).  Ella se dedica a la  venta de bolsas tejidas con detalles de pedrería y fichas de lata de diferentes modelos que inició hace 8 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en más materia prima como comprar hilos y fichas de colores al igual de piedras de mayor calidad y así poder vender más en poco tiempo. Actualmente sale a vender a otros municipios pues en un principio solo su venta fue destinado a vecinas y familiares, poco a poco fue abriendo mercado en el municipio de Tizayuca. Sus clientes  comentan  que la señora  es una persona muy amable, ofrece muy buen servicio y variedad de bolsas, ofrece facilidades de pagos (semanales o de contado) de acuerdo a las posibilidades de sus clientas. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente respaldada y con la oportunidad de salir adelante con su familia además de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa ya  que es  de  escasos  recursos  económicos  y  que  eso le  da  mucha  confianza  parta  seguir  adelante contando con el apoyo de sus padres poder realizar mejoras en sus productos.


Los integrantes del grupo son:
Maribel N. R.    	  Venta de zapatos por catalogo
María Guadalupe R. J.	  Venta de bolsas
Gisela Úrsula M. J. Tienda de Abarrotes
María Asunción V. C. Venta de blancos
Josefina T. Z.	  Venta de zapato
Laura G. O.	  Taller de Costura
Marta Selene Saldaña R.	  Venta de blancos
Liliana Sánchez P.	  Venta de zapato
Martha J. S.	  Venta de ropa por catalogo
Bertha J. S.	  Venta de cosmético
texts.en:
This group is called the "Chicas Liberales" (The Liberal Girls), a name chosen because it is made up of a group of women with desires for success and personal growth; it also serves as a daily source of strength. The majority of the members live in the state of Hidalgo. The group has 10 members. Maribel N. R. is the president of the group. She is 26, a single mom, finished her 3rd year of high school, is a secretary and has two children (1 boy, 1 girl). She has a catalog sales business. Maribel has been selling footwear for a year and is requesting a loan to purchase new catalogs and so increase her sales. The sales will help her save up to rent a shop and develop her business and meet her family's needs without having to go far to work. Her customers tell us that Maribel is an excellent saleswoman who makes house calls to her neighbors. She is hardworking and polite with her coworkers, has an excellent disposition, and loves what she does. As she requests this loan Maribel is very happy for the opportunity she is getting since the extra income from shoe sales will allow her to take her children on vacation to Acapulco. That would fulfill her kids' dreams. Maria Gaudalupe R. J. is the group's treasurer. She is 26, and finished grade school. She lives in a common-law marriage with three children (10, 6 and 3). She has a business selling woven bags with decorations in stone and metal chips that she started 8 years ago. She is requesting a loan to purchase more raw material like thread and colored metal chips as well as higher quality stones thus hopefully selling more in the future. Currently she heads to other towns to sell her goods. At first she only sold to friends and family but little by little she she expanded her market in Tizayuca. Her customers say that she is polite, offers good service, a good variety of products, as well as flexible payment terms (weekly or all at once) depending on her customers' needs. As she requests her loan she feels supported and that she has a chance to get her family ahead aside from helping her husband with the household expenses. Since she is of modest means she feels more confidence going forward, and with her parents' support, to improve the quality of her goods. The members of the group are as follows: Maribel N. R: Catalog shoe sales María Guadalupe R. J: Bag sales Gisela Úrsula M. J: Small grocery store María Asunción V. C: linen sales Josefina T. Z: Shoe sales Laura G. O: Sewing shop Marta Selene Saldaña R: Linen sales Liliana Sánchez P: Shoe sales Martha J. S: Catalog clothing sales Bertha J. S: Cosmetics sales

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the busines (like catalogs, thread and colored metal chips)

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Rita tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 10 años se dedica D. manera independiente a L. agricultura, sembrando maíz y habas que son productos nativos D. su zona, asimismo cultiva papa que es un tubérculo que crece en cualquier parte D. L. serranía peruana. Al cabo D. un tiempo y cuando ya están maduros, son llevados a vender al mercado mayorista D. su zona. Sin embargo cuando tiene que esperar que dichos productos puedan ser cosechados, elL. se dedica al bordado artesanal, siendo su casa un lugar indicado, por ser tranquilo además que está pendiente D. su familia. se siente muy satisfecha con las dos actividades que realiza, ya que le genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos D. L. familia. Para el futuro desea intensificarse en estas actividades, D. esa manera logrará que su economía se más estable. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. sus actividades. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono para L. siembra D. maíz que realizará en las próximas fechas.
texts.en:
Rita is 30 and lives with her husband and child in her own home. For more than 10 years she has worked as a farmer planting corn and beans which are native to the area. She also grows potatoes which grow anywhere in the Peruvian mountains. When the crops are ripe they are taken to the local wholesale market. While she is waiting to harvest she works making artisan embroidery. Her home is ideal for this since it is peaceful and she can take care of her family. In the future she hopes to intensify these activities and so have a more stable income. This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has the financial support as well as thankful to all those people responsible for making the loan possible. The loan will be very helpful in the advancement of her activities. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer for the upcoming corn crop.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertlizer for the upcoming season

loans.name: Emilsa Rosa
