texts.es: Emilsa B., casada y con 2 hijos en las edades de 22 y 23 años, tiene un negocio alrededor del cual se ha congregado toda la familia y con el cual sueña verlo crecer y convertirlo en una gran empresa. Este negocio llamado Body Stromg, es un gimnasio que ella inició cuando su esposo, pensionado de la policía y aprovecho  su aprendizaje en esta institución de técnicas gimnásticas, para ponerlo al servicio de la comunidad invirtiéndole en la infraestructura poco a poco y ha venido funcionando desde año 2006, lo cual le ha servido como una alternativa económica para ayudar a sus hijos a tener la oportunidad de cursar estudios superiores en la Universidad. En este negocio trabaja Emilsa su esposo y gradualmente sus hijos  cuando el tiempo de estudios se lo permite.  Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Emilsa se propone comprar una máquina de pierna y una de cardio y así ofrecerá un mejor servicio y mas cualificado a sus clientes por ser el Gimnasio mas confortable en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Emilsa B., who is married and has two children who are 22 and 23 years old, has a business that all her family have become involved in and she dreams of seeing it grow and turning it into a substantial company. This business is called Body Strong, and it is a gym that she started when her husband retired from the police. She made good use of her studies in the gymnastic skills institute and put them into service for the community and little by little invested in the infrastructure and has been operating the gym since 2006. The gym is an additional income source for her to help her children take courses at the university. Emilsa and her husband work in the business and her children have gradually got involved when they have time from their studies. With her loan from Kiva, which is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Emilsa intends to buy a machine for leg exercises and a cardio machine and so to offer a better service to her clients and make the gym more a part of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar una máquina de pierna y una de cardio para su gimnasio

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Manana 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Regina is the coordinator of her group 'Trabajando para el Manana' 1, 2 & 3 (Working for tomorrow). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to redecorate her house.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking.

Regina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 months, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying women's and men's deodorants and all kinds of cream, especially face cream for women. She also sells bread and ice at her house (people in our villages buy Ice because not everybody has a refrigerator or electricity is not consistent). She will use the profits to redecorate her house and she is planning to build a new bathroom. She dreams of living comfortably in a good house. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she planned to start a business but she need money to start it up. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and inconsistent electricity.

loans.use: to buy  deodorants and various creams (body, hand, face)

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita tiene 30 años, vive soL. en su casa propia. DesD. que era niña se ha dedicado a L. agricultura, ya que fue su principal fuente D. ingreso económico, siendo los productos que más cultivo es L. papa y el maíz. Al cabo D. 6 meses aproximadamente son cosechados, por lo que requiere D. L. ayuda D. peones para que le faciliten L. extracción D. estos productos. Se siente muy contenta D. realizar este trabajo  porque se considera una persona capaz e independiente, y por tal desea ampliar sus campos para cultivar más a fin D. aumentar L. producción. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. sus actividades. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono para su campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Rita is 30 and lives alone in her own home. From her childhood she has farmed, as it was her main source of income. The products that she cultivates the most are potatoes and corn. After about 6 months there is a harvest, for which she requires the help of labourers to facilitate the extraction of these products. She is very happy doing this work because she considers herself to be a capable and independent person. She wants to expand her land in order to cultivate more crops and increase production. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She is grateful to be part of her community bank because all of her peers are responsible and supportive. She thanks those who will lend money toward this loan. It will be very useful in the progress of her activities. She will invest the loan in the purchase of bags of fertilizer for planting.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Cusisiña Group

texts.es:
Cusisiña es el nombre de la asociación que está iniciando su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Cusisiña es una voz aymará que quiere decir “alegrarse".
La señora Maria es la presidenta de la asociación, al igual que varias de sus compañeras este es su segundo ciclo.  Su negocio es el de la compra y venta de perfumes y esencias, comenzó hace 3 años bajo la orientación de su hermano. Actualmente realiza sus ventas en Ferias grandes como la Feria de la zona 16 de Julio, en la ciudad de El Alto y el resto de los días por la tarde en la Ceja de El Alto. 
Madre de dos niños cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para llevar adelante el negocio. 
Este crédito de por Bs 1500 será utilizado para la compra de botellas y esencias.
Integran la asociación comunal nueve mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes de comercio y servicio, como por ejemplo: venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, chofer de transporte público, venta de papel higiénico, tienda de Pollos a la Broster, venta de perfumes y cosméticos, venta de comida.
texts.en:
Cusisiña is the name of this group which is starting its second cycle in the Santiago II Central Office. Cusisiña is an Aymara word which means "to be happy". Maria is the president of the group, and is in her second cycle as are many of her fellow members. Her business is the purchase and sale of perfumes and essences. She started 3 years ago under the guidance of her brother. She now makes her sales in large markets such as the market of the 16 de Julio zone, in the El Alto city. The rest of the days she sells in the afternoons on the outskirts of El Alto. A mother of two, she counts on the support of her husband to carry the business forward. This loan of 1500 Bs will be used for the purchase of bottles and essences. The group is made up of nine women and one man. They all have different businesses in goods and services, for example: cosmetics sales, food sales, public transport driver, toilet paper sales, a fast food store, perfume and cosmetics sales, and food sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bottles and essences

loans.name: Javier Esteban

texts.es:
Javier L. es el propietario de la “Tienda la Renovación”, en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla; allí vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en la edades de 12 y 14 años, e inició con una experiencia de mas de 13 años, cuando trabajaba como empleado de un mercado de abastos, ubicado en el centro de Barranquilla, y posteriormente con su hermana emprendió un negocio de tienda, por unos años mas, hasta que decidió independizarse e iniciar su propia aventura  aprovechando este aprendizaje que hoy aplica a su microempresa.
En su tienda “La renovación”, también vende  mercancías variadas y trabaja con su esposa, la que impulsa el mercado, porque son muy reconocidos en todo el municipio. 
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización en la que fue referida por dos prestatarios vinculados a esta organización y de mucha excelencia. Con su credikiva planea incursionar en la línea de  papelería desechable, piñatería y dulcería potencializando el aumento de su clientela en la temporada de festividades que ya se acerca.
Su meta es adquirir un local propio y adicionarle una distribuidora al por mayor donde ofrecer servicios a domicilio y ver realizados a sus hijos a nivel profesional y especialmente vinculados exitosamente a una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Javier L. is the owner of the “Tienda la Renovación” store, in the Malambo municipality, a metropolitan area of Barranquilla. He lives in Barranquilla with his partner and their two children ages 12 and 14. He started with over 13 years of experience from working as an employee at a food market in downtown Barranquilla. After that, he and his sister started up a store which they ran for a few years, until he decided to become independent and start his own venture, taking advantage of this experience which he now applies to his business. In his store "La Renovación" ["Renewal"], he also sells varied merchandise. He works with his wife, the driving force behind the store, and they are very well-known throughout the municipality. This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he was referred by two excellent borrowers of this organization. With this loan obtained from Kiva, he plans to enter into the areas of disposable paper, piñata sales and candy sales. This will promote an increase in his customer base during the holidays, which are fast approaching. His goal is to acquire his own location and include wholesale distribution to offer home services. Another goal is to see his children reach the professional level, and especially to see them successfully linked to a large company.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: breaking into the areas of disposable paper, piñata sales, and candy sales

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 23 años, vive en casa de un familiar con su tía y sus primos. Desde su niñez empezó a labrar la tierra, siendo ésta heredada por sus padres. Actualmente y con la ayuda de su familia, puede cubrir toda la extensión que tiene cultivando papa, de esa manera puede alcanzar sus objetivos de generarse sus propios ingresos, pero cuando es tiempo de cosecha contrata la mano de obra para que le faciliten la extracción de sus productos. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en el campo, por ser su única fuente económica, además que esta actividad lo independiza y por tal espera continuar así con la esperanza de intensificarse más. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de sus actividades. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para continuar sembrando papa.
texts.en:
William is 23 and lives in the home of a family member with his aunt and cousins. As a child, he started working the land that he inherited from his parents. Currently, with the help of his family, he is able to cover all of his land with potato crops, thus achieving his goal of generating his own income. However, when it is harvest time he hires labourers to help with the harvesting of his products. He says that he enjoys working in the fields, as this is his only source of income; furthermore, this activity has made him independent, so he hopes to continue farming more intensively. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support, and he is grateful to be part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. He thanks those who will lend money toward this loan; it will be very useful in the progress of his activities. With the loan that he is requesting, he will invest in the purchase of bags of fertilizer in order to continue sowing potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer to continue sowing potatoes

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos Ii  Group 1 & 2

texts.en:
Martira is the coordinator of her group "Unidas venceremos II" group 1 & 2 (Unite to win). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to live well.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying watching television, especially Latin novels.

Martira is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 2 years, though she has been selling clothing for more than 5 years, starting with the loans she received from Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy a display case to show her candies and also she needs to invest in clothes. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her children and to save because she wants to buy land and build her home.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because the loans are to do business, and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and inconsistent electricity.

loans.use: to buy an display case for her sweets production

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo tiene 46 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. A Máximo siempre le ha gustado sobresalir en cualquier actividad que se le presente, es así que cultiva café, ya que en el valle donde vive, crece de manera natural, además por ser uno de los productos que mayor demanda tiene en el mercado y por tal aprovechó para dedicarse a este negocio. Se siente contento por las buenas ganancias que le genera y eso le favorece para la manutención de su familia. Otro de los negocios que también se dedica es la producción y comercialización de piña, de esa manera diversifica ante sus demás competidores. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposa, sin embargo cuando es temporada de sembrío y cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, que le ayudan en la extracción de su producto final, siendo estos vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción de café y piña con la necesidad de que pueda apalear futuras demandas y de esa manera tenga un posicionamiento fuerte en esta actividad. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además está contento con su banco comunal, debido al buen desempeño de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café y piña, para ello adquirirá insumos y abono.
texts.en:
Máximo is 46 years old and married with two children. The family resides in their own home on the edge of the Peruvian jungle in the town of Quimbiri. Máximo has always enjoyed excelling in any opportunity that presents itself. For example, coffee grows naturally in the valley where he lives, so that's why he grows coffee. It is one of the most sought after products in the market so it is advantageous to engage in the coffee growing business. Máximo favors growing coffee because its sales produce good earnings in order to support his family. He is also involved in other businesses such as producing and marketing pineapple, thus diversifiying his products to keep ahead of other competitors. Máximo is usually self-employed, but he sometimes gets help from his wife. However, when it is sowing and harvest season, he has workers to help him harvest the crop, which is later sold in the collection centers in the area. This is Máximo's fourth loan with MFP and he is committed to completing his payments on time. He is also happy to work with his community bank because of its good performance. With the requested loan, he plans to invest in properly maintaining his coffee and pineapple plantations by purchasing agricultural inputs and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his coffee and pineapple plantations

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria es una señora que se dedica a la lechería, tiene 42 años, casada tiene 5 hijos.

Gregoria tiene 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno, de las cuales produce casi 50 litros de leche cruda cada dia. La señora Gregoria siempre esta buscando mejor oportunidades, es asi que se compro una vaca y empezó a vender su leche casa por casa dia a dia y con el tiempo  ha logrado comprarse hasta 4 cabezas de ganado lechero y ya tienes clientes fijos a quienes les entrega la leche, es asi que la Sra Gregoria se levanta muy temprano ordeña las vacas y les dejas pastoreando mientras va a vender su leche, luego regresa a su casa para prepara el almuerzo y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, luego se encarga de pastorear cortar alfalfa (alimento para el ganado vacuno) y luego al finalizar la tarde nuevamente realiza el proceso de ordeñar a las vacas y con esa leche prepara Yogurt, que también lo comercializa.

Es asi que la Sra. Gregoria se apersono a Cidre solicitando un crédito para la compra de cascara de soya para que su ganado pueda producir mayor cantidad de leche y asi generar mas ingresos y poder dar a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria dedicates herself to dairy farming. She is 42 and married with 5 children. Gregoria has four heads of cattle that produce nearly 50 liters of raw milk every day. She is always looking for better opportunities, which led her to purchase a cow and sell its milk going door to door, day after day. With time, she has succeeded in purchasing four heads of milking cattle, and she already has regular customers that she sells the milk to. Gregoria gets up very early in the morning to milk the cows, then she puts them out to pasture while she goes to sell the milk. Later she returns home to prepare lunch and send her children off to school. Then she takes care of herding the cattle to graze alfalfa (food for cattle). When the afternoon draws to an end, she milks the cows once more. She uses this milk to prepare yogurt, which she also sells. Gregoria comes to CIDRE [the field partner] requesting a loan to purchase soybean husks so her cattle can produce a greater quantity of milk. This way, she can earn more income and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soybean husks for her cattle

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Micaela is the coordinator of her group Luz y Progreso 1 & 2 (Light and progress). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to finish building her house.

Micaela is excited to be taking her 3rd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost three years. She started selling natural juices and fried food. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying sodas, fruit, bread, ham, cheese, some vegetables and other stuff. She has a cafeteria and small snack shop where you get sandwiches, fried food, juice and other fast foods. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save, because she wants to build her house and make some changes to her business locale. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to improve her business, and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and inconsistent electricity.

loans.use: to buy sodas and other goods

loans.name: Yasira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yasira es casada, tiene 2 niños: Yader de 9 años en 3er grado de primaria y Yasnari de 4 añitos en 3er nivel de preescolar; trabaja para el EMPA como Auxiliar de contabilidad desde hace 8 años.

Esta solicitando  su 8vo credito con el objetivo de realizar mejoras a su casa repellandola y poniendo las ventanas, ya que le hace falta instalarlas y de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia. 

Cabe señalar que Yasira ha ido levantando su casa poco a poco con los creditos obtenidos en AFODENIC, por lo cual se siente muy agradecida con la institucion y espera que en el futuro le siga apoyando para terminar su sueño de tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Yasira is married and has 2 children: Yader, who is 9 years old and in 3rd grade, and Yasnari, who is 4 years old and is in the 3rd level of pre-school. She has worked for EMPA as a junior accountant for 8 years. She is requesting her 8th loan, which she plans to use to make improvements to her house including plastering and putting in windows. She needs to have the windows installed so that she can provide better comfort and security for her family. It is worth noting that Yasira has been improving her home gradually with loans obtained from AFODENIC, and for this she feels very grateful to the institution. She hopes that in the future they will continue to support her so that she can realize her dream of having a decent home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plaster and put in windows

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel es casado con la Sra. Ada Paola Martinez, no tienen hijos. Don Manuel trabaja para ENACAL como maestro de electromecanica desde hace 8 años, ademas tiene un negocio de nintendo en su casa el cual es atendido por su esposa.

Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de realizar mejoras a su casa ubicada en el Residencial, como es emberjar las puertas y ventanas para brindar mayor seguridad a su propiedad.  

El mayor sueño de Manuel es poder contar con una vivienda con todas las condiciones para cuando lleguen los hijos porderles brindar comodidad.
texts.en:
Manuel is married to Ada Paola Martinez, and they have no children. Manuel has worked for ENACAL teaching electromechanics for 8 years. In addition, he has a Nintendo business in his house that his wife runs. He is requesting his 6th loan with the objective of making improvements to his house, located in the El Residencial neighborhood, such as putting iron grilles over the doors and windows to provide better security for his property. Manuel's main wish is to be able to have a home with all the improvements complete so that when his children arrive he can provide them with a comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to put iron bars on the doors and windows

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Ella forma parte del grupo "MUjeres Emprendedoras" fomado por siete personas residentes D. la zona D. San Juan Bautista en el distrito D. Comas al norte D. Lima. Sus compañeros la eligieron como Secretaria D. Actas D. la Junta Directiva del grupo.
La Sra. Mercedes se dedica al servicio D. costura. hace 20 años, inició prestando servicio D. costura a sus familiares, vecinos, amigos con una máquina que su esposo le obsequió, empezó confeccionando faldas y blusas, como le gustaba ésta actividad estudió un curso D. alta costura, con lo que se animó a poner su taller D. costura, siempre con el apoyo D. su esposo. Ahora su ha modernizado su taller el cual está ubicado en su domicilio, tiene personal D. apoyo cuando tiene muchos pedidos.
Con el préstamo solicitado comprará una máquina remalladora para poder perfeccionar aún  más el acabado D. sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes, 54, is married with 3 children. She is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras community group, an association of seven people from the San Juan Bautista neighborhood of Lima. Her fellow members chose her to be the secretary of the group. Sra. Mercedes operates a tailoring business. She started 20 years ago with a sewing machine that her husband gave her, making skirts and blouses for friends and family. She liked the work so much that she took a course to learn to make clothes which, in turn, inspired her to set up her own tailoring business, counting on her husband's support all the while. She has now updated her workshop--which is located in her house--and has extra helpers when she has a lot of orders. Sra. Mercedes will use this loan to buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to do even more elaborate work than before.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine for tailoring business.

loans.name: Moeses

texts.es: Moeses tiene 37años, está casado y tiene dos hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. Moeses se dedica al cultivo de café, negocio que tanto esfuerzo le ha dedicado y ahora le genera las ganancias que necesita para la manutención de su familia. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, incluso el número de compradores va en aumento lo que significa que deberá producir más café. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero de vez en cuando recibe la ayuda de su familia, sin embargo en temporada de cosecha necesita de sus peones, con la finalidad de que los pueda facilitar en la extracción de su producto final. Usualmente su producto de café los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad y a precio competitivo. Su plan a futuro es comprar un terreno, con la necesidad de que haga una vivienda, para que luego lo rente a terceras personas, esto le permitirá generarse ingresos extras. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, debido a la puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos, con la necesidad de que pueda darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Moeses, 37, is married and has two children in his care. The family lives together in the beautiful Cusco jungle in the town of Quimbiri where they own their own house. Moeses is a coffee grower, a business that he’s put much effort and dedication into and that now generates profits he needs to support his family. He enjoys his work very much. As a matter of fact, the number of buyers is increasing so he must increase his coffee production. He usually works by himself and sometimes his family helps him. However, during harvest he has to hire laborers in order to bring in the final harvest. His coffee production is usually sold to the regional coffee gathering centers at a competitive price. His plan for the future is to buy a lot to build a house on to rent out to third parties as a source of extra income. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he commits to continue to repay responsibly. He is very satisfied with his communal bank because they are punctual with their payments. He will use the requested funds to buy supplies and manure in order to adequately care for his coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure to use on his coffee plants.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua M. prepares 'kenkey' (a fermented dough staple) at Elmina. Akosua has received seniior high education.  She is divorced and has four children.  Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to prepare 'kenkey' for distribution. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy more bags of maize to prepare  'kenkey' to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married and living with her eight dependents. She has no educational background. Ama sells fried fish at Elmina. She uses her earnings to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Ama will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es: Policarpio tiene 42 años, está casado y tiene 6 hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Policarpio se caracteriza, por ser una persona humilde y con mucho carisma, ese fue su mayor ventaja frente a la competencia, ya que el negocio al que se dedica es la producción y comercialización de café y piña. Es consciente que la competencia es fuerte, es por ello que trata de mejorar en la calidad y cantidad de dichos frutos, por ser productos que les otorga estabilidad económica y familiar. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su querida esposa, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su querida esposa, pero cuando requiere de mayor esfuerzo contrata peones para que les facilite la extracción de café y piña.  Su plan a futuro es construir su propia casa a base de material noble, con la finalidad de que pueda brindar comodidad a su familia. Este es su quinta cuota con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además está contento con su banco comunal, ya que existe un clima cordial en cada reunión mensual. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de abono, con el propósito de darle mantenimiento a sus plantaciones de café y piña, asimismo invertirá en la limpieza de sus campos, quitando la maleza y mala hierba.
texts.en:
Policarpio is 42 years old, married, and has six school age children. They reside in their own wooden house in the beautiful rainforest of Peru, located in the town of Quimbiri. Policarpio is characterized as being a humble person with great charisma. These features were his biggest advantage over the competition because his business deals with producing and marketing coffee and pineapple. He is aware that competition is strong, which is why he attempts to improve the quality and quantity of his crops in order to give his family economic stability. He usually works in conjunction with his beloved wife, who sometimes helps him, but when necessary, he hires laborers to harvest the coffee and pineapple. His future plan is to build a house of high-quality materials, so that his family can be more comfortable. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he promises to faithfully complete his payments on time. He is also happy with the community bank, as there is a cordial atmosphere at each monthly meeting. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase fertilizer for his coffee and pineapple plantations, and to also clean up the fields by removing weeds.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to weed his farmlands

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María Luisa, tiene 60 años, es viuda y tiene 8 hijos, todos mayores D. edad. Ella forma parte del grupo "El Trinfo", formado por 7 integrantes residentes del distrito D. Carabayllo. Sus compañeros la eligieron como Fiscal D. la Junta Directiva del grupo por sus características D. responsabilidad y honestidad.
La Sra. maría Luisa se dedica a la preparación D. queques los cuales ofrece y venD. en una fábrica cercana a su casa a los trabajadores.
hace quince años inició ésta actividad,. por las necesidades económicas que tenía en ese entonces, comenzó vendiendo golosinas y compraba los queques ya preparados, hasta que uno D. sus hijos la animó a que ellos mismas hicieran la preparación para tener un poco mas D. ganancia.
Con su trabajo ha podido afrontar gastos para mejorar su salud, estudios D. sus hijos que ahora son profesionales y apoyar a uno D. sus hijos con el cuidado y mantención D. su nieto.
Una D. sus próximas metas es viajar a Argentina, para apoyar a su hija que tiene un negocio D. comidas.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. queques.
texts.en:
María Luisa, 60, is a widow; she has 8 adult children. She is a member of the “El Triunfo” (Triumph) communal bank which has 7 members residents of Carabayllo district. Her fellow members elected her Overseer on the group’s Board of Directors because of her responsibility and honesty. María Luisa prepares Bundt cakes that she sells to employees at a factory near her home. She began this activity 15 years ago due to the economic need she faced then. She started selling sweets and pre-maD. cakes until one of her children encouraged her to start making them herself in order to increase her profits a bit. Her work has maD. it possible for her to face expenses related to improving her health, for her children’s education (they are all now professionals), and to help one of her sons care for and support her grandson. One of her next goals is to go to Argentina to help her daughter who has a food business. The received loan will be used to buy ingredients to make her cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her pastry business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua N. is married and has one child. Ekua sells 'kenkey' (fermented maize dough) and cassava at Elmina. She has been through junior high school. Ekua uses her income to pay utility bills as a way of helping her husband support the family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase additional bags of maize to produce 'kenkey' and to distribute to her demanding customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans on plowing the proceeds back into her business.

loans.use: purchase additional bags of maize to produce  'kenkey' and to distribute

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. sells smoked fish at Elmina. Abena has received no form of education. Abena has been selling smoked fish for five years now. Her earnings are used in settling her utility bills and accommodations. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en:
Drocella was born in 1961. She has fourteen children, two of whom are now married and three of whom are adopted. 
Drocella sells fabrics and offers rental wedding gowns. She has been in this business since 1978. She is requesting a loan to buy more fabrics for sale and other wedding gowns for renting out. She hopes to make more profits in this venture.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and wedding gowns

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are two months old and three years old. Both her children are not yet in school as they are not yet of school age according to the schools in her neighborhood. Eugenie sells a variety of products such as packed water, biscuits, cartons of water, matches, Vaseline etc. and some foodstuffs such as rice and tomatoes. Eugenie is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua B. sells second-hand bedsheets and children’s wear. She is married and has four children. She has received senior high education. Efua uses her income to take care of her children.  She will use the loan to purchase more used clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: purchase more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 34 años de edad, convive con su actual pareja, y fruto de ellos tienen tres hijos; Tany, Roy y Jhon, de 14, 7 y 2 años respectivamente. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de san francisco, donde tienen su propia casa. Raúl asegura que las técnicas de riego y de cultivo que aprendió de sus padres lo ayudaron mucho y por tal se muestra agradecido con ellos, ya que le permitió mejorar la calidad de piña que cultiva, y eso le da mucha ventaja para su comercialización, Está feliz por los buenos resultados económicos que sigue recibiendo, por ello desea adquirir nuevos terrenos para aumentar la producción de piña. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja, pero en temporada de cosecha, tiene a cargo de sus peones con la finalidad de que lo puedan extraer y trasladar su producto de piña, hacia los centros de acopio de su misma localidad, para su respectiva venta.  Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera oportuna, además tiene un buen concepto de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en darle mantenimiento a sus plantaciones de piña, con el propósito de que preserve la calidad de su producto.
texts.en:
34-year-old Raúl lives with his wife and their three children: Tany, Roy and Jhon aged 14, 7 and 2 respectively. They live in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle, in the town of San Francisco, where they own their own home. Raúl maintains that the irrigation and farming techniques that his parents taught him have helped them a lot. That’s why he has been very grateful to them. They have allowed him to improve the quality of the pineapple he grows, giving his business an advantage.
He is happy with his business’s continued success, which is why he wants to acquire new land to increase his pineapple production. He usually works together with his wife, but at harvest time he hires labourers to pick and transport his produce to the local collection centres to then sell on.
This is his first MFP loan, which he is committed to repaying on time. Furthermore, he respects and is committed to his communal bank. He plans to invest the requested loan in maintaining his pineapple crops in order to preserve the produce’s quality.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his pineapple crops

loans.name: Junis

texts.en:
Junis is 48 years old and has six children between the ages of two and twenty-seven years old. Her eldest child completed primary school, but wasn't able to afford to continue studies. Three of her children are in school while the rest are not yet in school.
Junis is hardworking and loves her family. She has a store in which she sells various products such as tea leaves, soap, cooking oil etc. She has been in this business for six years and her business is going well. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more products. Junis' wish is to have enough savings and her dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy goods to fill her store

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 42 years old, married to a driver, and has six children. Her children are between the ages of three and twenty-two. Five of her children are in school while the youngest is not yet of school age.
Vestine's business is well-known because she sells crops that are in high demand in her homestead, such as tomatoes. She is requesting a loan to buy more products for her store because she hopes to make more profit given more capital.

loans.use: To buy more crops to fill her store

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is a mother of five children aged between one and fourteen years old. Two of her children are in school while the others are not yet of school age according to the school policies near her home. 
Vestine sells beer and a non-alcoholic drink known as Ubushera, which is made out of a cereal crop known as sorghum. She is requesting a loan to buy more beer and more sorghum to make the local drink, Ubushera.

loans.use: To purchase more beer and sorghum

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 37 years old, married, and has six children who are between the ages of 6-15 years old. All her children are in school. Alice and her husband are grateful to be able to pay their children’s school fees and medical insurance.

Alice sells various products such as biscuits, brooms, shopping buckets and basins. She buys her goods at the cheapest price in the city and therefore sells it at a reasonable price which increases her clientele. She hopes to work hard and have a branch in the city where she hopes to make more profit. Alice is asking for a loan to increase her inventory in order to make more profit.

loans.use: Purchasing more inventory.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua C. is married and has five dependents. She has been educated up to the junior high level of education. She cooks 'kokonte'(cassava flour) at Elmina for sale. She helps her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. She wishes to use the loan to purchase cassava to process into 'kokonte' for sale.  Ekua plans on reinvesting her new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: purchase cassava to process into 'kokonte' for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Fuertes Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María Candelaria tiene 53 años de edad, tiene un hijo el que ha sido motor y motivo para salir adelante y trabajar duro para poder brindarle estudios y profesión. Ella forma parte del grupo "Mujeres fuertes y unidas", integrado por 10 personas residentes del distrito de Comas, sus compañeros la eligieron Presidenta de la Junta Directiva del grupo.
La Sra. María Candelaria trabaja desde muy pequeña apoyando a sus padres y luego inició vendiendo bebidas en su casa, sin tener un ambiente dedicado a bodega, poco a poco fué juntando su capital hasta que pudo comprar una vitrina donde colocó sus dulces y así fué creciendo su tienda de abarrotes de nombre MUSA.
Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa de tres pisos, pagar los estudios superiores de su hijo y mantener una buena salud.
Con el préstamo recibido ambientará y comprará andamios y vitrinas para su tienda.
texts.en:
María Candelaria, 53, has a son who has been the motivating force for her to get ahead in life and work hard to provide him with schooling and a profession. She is a member of the “Mujeres Fuertes y Unidas” (Strong and United Women) communal bank. It has 10 members who are residents of Comas district. Her fellow members elected her President of the group’s Governing Board. From a very early age she worked helping her parents and then started selling beverages from home even though she didn’t have a specific area set up as a store. Gradually she amassed capital until she was able to buy a display case to exhibit her candies and thus her grocery store, called Muse, grew. Her work has made it possible for her to build her three story house, pay for her son’s higher education and maintain good health. The granted loan will be used to buy shelving and display cases for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy display cases and shelving for her store.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame E. sells onions, salt, tomatoes, plantain and cassava in Elmina. She is single and uses her income to pay for her accommodation and utility bills. Maame has been through junior high school. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest in the sale of other varieties of vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Araba Rita

texts.en: Araba Rita A. is married and has four children. She has no formal education. Araba sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) in Elmina. Araba uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Araba Rita will use this loan to purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for distribution. Araba plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for distribution

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: Rosendo, de 55 años de edad, es viudo y tiene un hijo. Viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tiene su propio techo. El trabajo al que se dedica es el cultivo de café, por ser un producto que crece en abundancia en el valle donde vive, y del que hasta el momento le está generando buenas ganancias. Sin embargo no estaba contento con un solo producto, es por ello, que con los ahorros que tenía disponible, pudo aventurarse en el  cultivo y comercialización de piña, negocio del cual no se arrepiente, puesto que le esta dando buenos beneficios económicos. En el presente su negocio agrícola está tomado buena presencia en su valle, ya que siempre cumple con sus clientes potenciales, es así que se siente contento con lo que viene logrando, ya que le permite llevar felicidad a su familia. Por lo general trabaja en compañía de su hijo, pero en tiempo de cosecha necesita de peones que le facilite de la extracción de sus productos. En el futuro anhela ampliar su producción de café, ya que es un producto que está bien cotizado a nivel nacional e internacional, de esa forma pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma de pagos, además visualiza un clima cordial en su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos, de esa manera pueda mejorar la calidad y cantidad de sus plantaciones de café y piña.
texts.en:
55-year old Rosendo is a widower and has one son. They live in the neighbourhood of Quimbiri which is located in the Peruvian rainforest where Rosendo owns a house. He earns his living by growing coffee because it is a crop that grows well in the valley where he lives, and has up to now generated a good profit for him. However, he wasn’t satisfied with growing only one product so with his savings, he ventured into growing and selling pineapples, a move he doesn’t regret, as it has also provided him with economic benefits. Rosendo’s farming business is well regarded in the valley as he always treats potential customers well. He feels good about what he has achieved as it gives him the opportunity to make his family happy. Generally his son works alongside him, but at harvest time he hires extra labourers to help with the work. In the future he wishes to increase his production of coffee as it is a much sought-after commodity both within the country and overseas. This will enable him to improve his standard of living. This is Rosendo’s second loan with Kiva partner MFP, so his prompt repayments are assured. He gets on well with the members of his community bank. With the loan he plans to buy supplies and fertilizer so he can improve the quality and quantity of his coffee and pineapple fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer for his coffee and pineapple fields

loans.name: Geogina

texts.en: Geogina M. sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and banku (a local dish made from corn dough) in Elmina. She is married and has two children. Geogina has not had any formal education. She is able to support her husband in taking care of the children. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of corn to make kenkey and banku for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of corn to make kenkey and banku for sale

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Rufino, de 40 años, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propio techo a base de madera. A pesar de que tuvo primaria incompleta, Rufino asegura que  “la agricultura fue su escuela”; ya que con ello aprendió el negocio agrícola, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de café en donde sus compradores asiduos están satisfechos por la calidad de sus productos. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda e su familia, pero en tiempo de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, con la necesidad de que extraigan su producto en menor tiempo, siendo éstos vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su producción en otras zonas estratégicas con el propósito de minimizar costo y tiempo, de esa manera pueda tener un posicionamiento fuerte en su valle. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además esta fortalecido y entusiasmado con su banco comunal, ya que la trae muchas ventajas positivas. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos con la necesidad de que lo pueda dar un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
40-year old Rufino is married and has four school-aged children. They live in the neighbourhood of Quimbiri on the edge of the Peruvian rainforest. He owns a house made of wood. Although he did not complete his primary education, Rufino explains that ‘the farm was his school’. This is where he learnt how to farm, specifically how to grow and sell coffee. His regular customers are pleased with the quality of his products. Rufino usually works by himself and on occasion he gets help from family members. At harvest time he takes on extra laborers so that the harvest can be completed quickly and he can sell the coffee in the warehouses near where he lives. In the future he wants to expand into different areas in order to minimize costs and time, giving him a strong presence in the valley. This is Rufino’s sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to pay back the money according to the schedule. He is happy with the support and enthusiasm of his community bank which has provided him with many advantages. With the loan he plans to buy supplies and fertilizer so he can give his coffee fields appropriate care.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee fields

loans.name: David 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Santiago is the coordinator of his group David 3, 4 & 5 (David). He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner. He says that his most difficult challenge is to have his residence in the Dominican Republic, He is from Haiti and he wants to have more than a visa. In the meantime, he plans to continue to enjoy eating and working.
Santiago is excited to be taking his third loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has a mobile/walking business making miscellaneous sales. He has had this business for four years, starting with a loan he got from a lender in his community. Santiago plans to use this new loan to invest in his business by buying underwear, pants, shirts, skirts and personal use products. He will use the profits to invest in his business and save as he is planning to buy some land where he can build a house.
This Esperanza associate began with us because he liked the facilities and the rate, which was lower than others. His story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). His group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where the economy is dominated by sugar cane and upscale tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy underwear, skirts, pants, personal products, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es: Juan Manuel es un padre de familia, por lo que a pesar de tener 73 años, todavía tiene el espíritu de salir adelante. Inició desde hace 7 años y desde entonces solo descansa los domingos  y tiene un horario de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, pues actualmente ha tenido pedidos de gran variedad de productos, pues  en la actualidad solicita su crédito para la compra de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas entre otras cosas. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is a family man. Although he is 73 years old, he still wishes to make progress in life. He started work when he was seven years old, and even now only takes Sundays off. He works from 7am to 6pm selling a variety of merchandise. Currently he has orders for a wide range of goods so he is seeking a loan to buy clothing, footwear, cosmetics, sheets etc. His greatest wish is to expand his business so that he can improved his family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 42 años, está casada y tiene cinco en hijos en su haber. Juntos viven en la  hermosa selva cuzqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. Victoria, recalca que lo mas importante en un negocio, es “la disciplina, la perseverancia y la creatividad”; ya que con ello su negocio de abarrotes, está teniendo mucha pegada en su querido barrio, además trata de introducir productos de vanguardia, con la finalidad de que pueda diversificar frente a la competencia, es por ello que sus clientes se sienten satisfechos por la calidad y precio accesible de los productos que ofrece. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en tiempo de vacaciones escolares recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Su rutina de trabajo es de lunes a domingo, a partir de las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche y su punto de venta lo realiza en su mismo barrio. En el futuro ella anhela seguir ampliando su negocio de abarrotes, con la finalidad de que pueda ofrecer productos de vanguardia, según a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal, debido al compañerismo que existe en cada uno de los socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería de primera necesidad, con el propósito de que atienda la demanda de forma efectiva.
texts.en:
Victoria, 42, is married with five children. The family lives in their own home in the beautiful jungle of Cuzco, located in the town of Quimbiri. Victoria emphasizes that the most important thing in a business is, "discipline, perseverance, and creativity." With that motto, her grocery business is having a large impact on her beloved neighborhood. She is also trying to introduce cutting-edge products with the purpose of diversifying in the face of competition. Her customers are satisfied with the quality and affordability of the products that she offers. She is normally self-employed, but is assisted by her sons during school holidays. Her routine is to work Monday through Sunday from 5:30 am to 9:00 pm and point of sale is done in the same neighborhood. In the future she longs to expand her grocery business to offer cutting-edge products that align with the tastes and preferences of her customers. This is Victoria's fifth loan with MFP and she is committed to continue completing her payments on schedule. She also thanks the community bank because of the camaraderie of each of the members. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase basic products to effectively keep up with demand.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic products to better stock her store

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder, de 25 años, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Reside en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propio techo a base de madera. Wilder, es un joven que le gusta explorar cosas nuevas. Es así que incursiono en la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de piña y café, en donde viene consolidándose en su localidad, incluso su margen de ventas va en aumento, esto es debido a la calidad de sus productos y al precio competitivo que ofrece. Trabaja en conjunto con su familia, en donde le brindan su apoyo incondicional, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones con la necesidad de que los pueda facilitar la extracción de su producto final, siendo llevados al  mercado de si zona. Anhela tener su propia tienda de venta de celulares, con la finalidad de obtener más ganancias y cambiar su estilo de vida. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está orgulloso de pertenecer al banco comunal, debido a la solidaridad que existe en los socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, para que le brinde un cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Wilder is 25 years old and single without any children. He lives in his own wooden house, in an area called Quimbiri, located near the Peruvian jungle. Wilder is a young man who likes to explore new things. This is how he began to work in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation and sale of pineapples and coffee. His sales and profits have been increasing thanks to the quality products he sells and the competitive pricing he offers. Wilder works together with his family, who give him unconditional support. However, in harvest time he hires laborers to pick and transport the goods to the market. Wilder's goal is to one day open his own shop to sell mobile phones, and be able to earn enough money to change his lifestyle. This is his six loan with MFP, and he commits to continue with his timely payments. He is proud to be a member of the communal bank where there is a strong sense of solidarity among the members. With the loan he is requesting, Wilder will purchase supplies and fertilizer to care for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizer for his coffee and pineapple crops

loans.name: Zoila Carmensa

texts.es: Zoila Carmensa tiene 75 años,  su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Zoila ya tiene experiencia con créditos pues ha sido muy satisfactorio para su negocio. Ella es una madre muy abnegada y responsable  la ubicación de su negocio es en su misma casa de habitación, decidida a ayudar a su familia, poniendo su pequeño negocio el cual es de gran ayuda para poder cubrir algunas de sus necesidades. El préstamo ha sido solicitado para invertir  en pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y cosméticos que se necesitan en la tienda y lo que sus clientes le solicitan es una persona humilde pero de gran corazón, emprendedora y trabajadora, que vela por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila Carmensa is 75 years old and runs a small shop. She has experience with micro loans and her business has benefited from them. Zoila is a very responsible and self sacrificing mother. She runs her store from inside of her own home, and the income helps to cover some of the basic costs for her family. The loan will be used to purchase pants, blouses, skirts, dresses and cosmetics which she needs in her shop, and which her customers request. Zoila is a humble person with a big heart. Hardworking and enterprising, she watches out for the well being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small shop which she runs from her home

loans.name: The Women´s Bank "women Of Power" Group

texts.en:
The four women members of this group live in Pococí, Limón, located in the hot and humid Caribbean region of Costa Rica. The group was formed at the beginning of 2007; however, this will be the members' first loan with Fundación Mujer. The loan consultant who has been working with this group has described the members as hardworking entrepreneurs with the desire and ability to improve the standard of living for themselves as well as their families. A major limiting factor for the women of this group has been a lack of access to working capital. This loan will help to address this problem. 

The members of this group are involved in agricultural activities such as the rearing and sale of animals. Specifically, this loan will be used to finance the purchase of livestock such as pigs, chickens and cows as well as animal feed. 

Anaís F. Valdéz is a 41-year-old mother of five who lives with her partner and two sons. Anaís is the elected president of this group. She has a business rearing and selling cows. She plans to use this loan to buy a calf and, if there is money left over, some honey and salt. Anaís starts her day in the following manner: she wakes up early at 3:45 AM to tend to the animals on her plot of land. After feeding the animals and cleaning out their pens, at around 5:30 AM, Anaís prepares breakfast for her two children and husband and cleans the house. Anaís has the goal of increasing her production levels in terms of the amount of livestock she sells. She would like to increase her income in order to augment her own standard of living as well as that of her family. 

With respect to her fellow group members, Anaís explains that she knows them all very well, as the members are mostly neighbors who have lived in the same community for a very long time. The name of this group, "Women of Power", is derived from the power the members find in their personal faith. These members feel that their faith will drive them forward unconditionally. Anaís explains that the group lending model is beneficial because it allows women peers to act as loan guarantors for each other, without collateral or proof of a salary. The disadvantage is that each person may become responsible for another person’s inability to make repayments or the failure of another person´s business.

loans.use: For the purchase of livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es: Arístides, de 55 años, vive a lado de su esposo Heraclio de 56 años y de su hija mayor de los 6 que tiene en total, pues el resto viven independientes con sus propias familias. Desde muy joven empezó ha trabajar y siempre pensaba alcanzar el progreso a lado de su familia, es por eso que en la actualidad labora en su restaurante y prepara comida para los trabajadores de una empresa de transportes. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues sabe cocinar distintos platillos que son la delicia de sus habituales comensales, que no solo la buscan por la exquisitez de sus comidas, si no también por los económicos precios que ofrece. El paso del tiempo le ha permitido captar clientes fijos que le pagan diario y también una vez por semana, es por eso que tiene capital estable que le permite comprar sus ingredientes sin problemas. Sabe que si se lo propone este pequeño negocio, que ha implementado con gaseosas, podrá ampliarse más, es por eso que para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una pequeña tienda de comestibles dentro de su restaurante. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y promete será cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece a todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Arístides ya tiene pensado invertir el crédito dinero solicitado en la compra de  ingredientes al por mayor que necesita para continuar con la preparación de comida, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Aristides is 55 years old and lives with her husband Heraclio. They have 6 children together. The eldest daughter still lives with them, and the others live with their own families now. From the time she was very young Aristides has worked and has always thought of improving the quality of life for her family. Today she works in her restaurant preparing meals for the workers of a transportation company. She likes her work a lot, and she knows how to cook special dishes for her regular diners, who come to her not only for her great food, but also for the good prices she offers. Over time, she has developed a good base of customers who pay her every day or every week, which enables her to continuously purchase the ingredients she needs without difficulty. She knows that she could grow this business, and in the future she would like to set up a small general market inside. This is Aristides' 4th loan with MFP, and she commits to continue with her monthly payments. She also appreciates all of the people who provide the support for her to continue with her work. She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients wholesale, and continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients she uses in her small restaurant

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillerma tiene 43 años, vive  en compañía de su esposo Julio de 48 años, y de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales el primero es mayor, y los otros estudian en el colegio. Cada día es una lucha constante, y eso bien lo sabe esta trabajadora mujer, que desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la preparación de postres y tortas que comercializa a clientes fijos que tiene en las tiendas y negocios aledaños al lugar donde vive. Trabaja en sociedad con una vecina, y dice que las ganancias que obtienen son considerables, pues solo preparan las tortas 3 veces a la semana, y solo ocupan parte del día, entre preparar y repartir, y esto permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a las labores de su hogar. Sueña además que algún día logre instalar una empresa formal dedicada a la preparación de postres y tortas, pero sabe que solo logrará cumplir este anhelo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo constante. Es el quinceavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete ser cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas como siempre, ya que quiere continuar progresando; y también esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Guillerma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que necesita para continuar preparando tortas, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Guillerma is 43 years old and lives with her husband Julio, who is 48 years old. They have 3 children together, two of them still attend school. Guillerma is a hardworking woman and knows that every day is a constant fight to stay ahead. 3 years ago she began preparing pastries and tortes and selling them to regular shops and businesses near where she lives. She runs her business together with her neighbor, and she says their income has been good. They make tortes 3 times a week, and preparing them and distributing them only takes a part of the day, so that they have time to take care of their homes as well. Guillerma dreams of one day being able to set up a formal bakery business, but she knows that she will only reach this goal through a lot of effort and constant work. This is her 15th loan with MFP, and she commits to comply with her payments as she always has, continuing to grow her business. She is very grateful to all of the people who provide the support for her to continue in her work. Guillerma will use the loan to purchase ingredients she needs to prepare her pastries and tortes.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients she uses to prepare her pastries.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 36 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo Esteban de 38 años y de sus 3 hijos que son menores de edad y estudian en el colegio. Esta laboriosa mujer se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortas y kekes, en sociedad con una amiga. Los días de trabajo se da tres veces por semana, en la mañana prepara  y por la tarde reparte a sus clientes fijos. Con el tiempo este negocio ha ido creciendo por lo que ha logrado comprar 2 hornos industriales que le facilitan el trabajo. Hoy no solo se dedica a preparar por pedidos sino para grandes eventos, como matrimonios y fiestas de cumpleaños, etc. Dice que le gusta mucho este trabajo porque es tranquilo y puede relajarse mezclando los ingredientes necesarios para obtener deliciosos postres que vende a buenos precios, es por eso que esta muy entusiasmada con su negocio, pues las ganancias le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Además como es una mujer emprendedora, tiene planeado comprar mejores  instrumentos para mejorar la calidad de la preparación de sus tortas y kekes. Es el 15 avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo ya que desea seguir progresando, también esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Marina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes e instrumentos que necesita para continuar en la preparación y comercio de tortas y kekes.
texts.en:
Marina is 36 years old. She lives in her own house in the company of her husband, Esteban, who is 38 years old, and her 3 young children who are students.

This hardworking woman works making and selling different cakes, in association with a friend. She works three days per week – in the morning she makes the food and in the afternoon she delivers it to her regular customers. Over time, her business has grown and allowed her to buy 2 industrial stoves for her work. She currently prepares her food not only by request, but also for large events such as weddings, birthday parties, etc.

She says that she likes this job a lot because it’s calm and she can relax while mixing the ingredients needed to make the delicious desserts that she sells at good prices. This is why she is very happy with her business, and her earnings allow her to help her husband with the household expenses. In addition, since she is an enterprising woman, she has plans to buy better tools to improve the quality of making her cakes.

This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she promises to make her repayments on time since she wants to continue moving ahead. She is also very grateful for all of the people that made this loan possible and will allow her to continue working. Marina plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of ingredients and tools that she needs to continue with the preparation and sale of cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and tools for making cakes.

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es:
1.La Sra. Antolina C. de Orué propietaria de un copetín y kiosko con mas de 15 años de antigüedad ubicado en la Ciudad de Asuncion de 3 Hijos una que se halla trabajando en España y ayuda al sustento de su madre y la mas pequeña que se halla en edad escolar y se halla cursando la Universidad y los gastos son solventados por la Sra. Antolina.
Es de condición muy humilde pero posee muy buenas referencias es una persona trabajadora y responsable.
Solicitó a la Fundación Paraguaya asistencia crediticia para refacciones del hogar y aumentar el inventario de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Antolina C. de Orué is the owner of a snack place and kiosk that has been around for more than 15 years and is located in the city of Asunción. She has three children – one lives in Spain and helps support her mother and the smallest is school-aged and is in college, which Antolina pays for.

She comes from very humble conditions but she has very good references. She is a hardworking and responsible person.

She is applying for financial support from Fundación Paraguaya for home refurbishments and to expand her inventory of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment for housing improvements and the purchase of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús es casada, junto a su compañero de vida tienen 2 hijos a su cargo, su actividad es un cafetín, hace más de 13 años trabaja en este negocio.  Por lo que es una mujer muy emprendedora y además necesita generar ingresos para su familia. La ubicación de su negocio es en el ingenio, pues es una madre abnegada y se responsabiliza por sus 2 hijos. El financiamiento es para la compra de refrescos, golosinas, galletas, comidas y refresco. El sueño de Teresa es mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús is married. She and her life partner have 2 children. She works in a small cafe. She has been doing this work for the past 13 years because she is a very enterprising woman and also because she needs the income for her family. Her business is located in a plant. She is a self-sacrificing mother and is responsible for her 2 children. The loan is to buy sodas, candy, cookies and meals. Teresa's dream is to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Mirta

texts.en:
Mirta is a 60-year-old mother of two who lives with her husband and two children in La Valencia, San Rafael, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Mirta has a business selling catalogue items such as clothing, shoes, cleaning products and kitchenware, amongst various other items. In the evenings, Mirta offers services in clothing repairs and alterations to members of her community. Mirta plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of inventory items (clothing) that she can sell via catalogue in her community. At the moment, she has no working capital and the only inventory she has in stock is cleaning products. She would like to diversify her inventory stock in order to attract more customers and more revenue. 

Mirta wakes up early every morning in order to carry out her domestic tasks. During this time, clients arrive at her house to buy various catalogue items. When she is done sewing, Mirta leaves her house and continues to sell her products door-to-door in her community. Mirta´s goal is to one day own a famous store in a centralized location from which to sell her various products.

loans.use: For the purchase of various catalogue items such as clothing and shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es docente de doble turno, a la vez cuenta con una micro empresa que es la producción de ladrillos común, esto los realiza con la ayuda de colaboradores, (empleados).
Con estos dos trabajos ella puede salir adelante y brindarle las comodidades necesarias a su familia.
Solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva un crédito para la compra de arcilla, materia prima principal para su producción de ladrillos, teniendo este en cantidades la producción es segura y por ende el ingreso también está asegurado durante todos los meses
texts.en:
Gloria is a double shift worker. In addition to being a school teacher, she is a small business owner. She produces bricks with the help of collaborators (employees). With the two jobs, she can get ahead and provide her family with the basic necessities. She requests a loan from the Paraguay Foundation and Kiva to purchase clay, the principal raw material for bricks. With large quantities of clay, production is secure, and therefore, income is also assured each month.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clay

loans.name: Amigas Inseparables Group

texts.es:
“Amigas Inseparables” es el nombre de la asociación que está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Santiago II. “Amigas Inseparables” está integrado por siete mujeres y un varón.   

La señora Valentina es la presidenta de la asociación, al igual que todas sus compañeras este es su primer ciclo dentro de una asociación.  Su negocio es la venta de comida, específicamente “salchipapas”, comida rápida que agrada a muchos por su bajo precio y composición: salchichas trozadas y papas fritas.

La venta de “salchipapas” es a partir de las 5 de la tarde, en un snack, que compró hace seis meses, en aquella oportunidad inicio su negocio sola.

 Madre de cuatro niños cuenta con el apoyo de su hija para llevar adelante el negocio. 
Este crédito por Bs 2000 será utilizado para ampliar el snack.

Integran la asociación comunal siete mujeres y un varón. Cada quien con un negocio diferente, como por ejemplo: venta de comida, venta de pollos a la broster (pollo frito), costura de enaguas, venta de pantalones, venta de manteles, tienda de Pollos a la Broster y chapista (arreglo artesanal de abolladuras en la carrocería de los autos).
texts.en:
“Amigas Inseparables” (Inseparable Friends) is the name of this communal bank that’s starting its first cycle in the Santiago II Focal Center. It is composed of seven women and one man. Valentina is President. Like the other members of the group this is her first cycle within a communal bank. She sells food, specifically “salchipapas” (fried potatoes with fried sausages or fried chicken), a fast food that is very liked because of its low price and composition: pieces of sausage and fried potatoes. She starts sales at 5pm in a snack bar she bought six months ago. Back then, she started her business on her own. She has four children and her daughter helps her run the business. The loan is for Bs 2000 which will be used to enlarge the snack bar. The communal bank has 7 women and one man. Each has a different business, for example: food sales, fried chicken sales, skirt making, pants sales, tablecloth sales, Broasted-style chicken sales and a car body repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge the snack bar.

loans.name: Mario Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Mario Raúl S. es soltero y vive en el barrio  las mercedes de la ciudad de Atyra.

 El  señor  Mario es comerciante y tiene una fotocopiadora, librería, compra-venta de celulares y venta de recarga de saldos para celulares en su salón comercial.

 Su negocio comenzó con un pequeño capital  que le facilito su madre, en aquel entonces para comenzar su pequeño negocio, y luego viendo la demanda de artículos de librería por la ubicación del negocio en frente de 2 colegios, anexó a su negocio una pequeña librería. 
Gracias a su constancia el negocio fue creciendo y hoy día cuenta con una clientela formada.  

Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por el apoyo obtenido para su actividad y mediante ello, podrá aumentar sus mercaderías brindando un buen servicio a  la comunidad y a la vez aumentando su ingreso.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de impresoras nuevas y celulares.
texts.en:
