Mario Raúl S. is single and lives in the Las Mercedes neighborhood of the city of Atyra.

Mario is a businessman and has a photocopier, office supplies, he purchases and sells cell phones, and also sells pre-paid cell phone credit in his business area.

His business began with a small amount of money that his mother gave him to start his small business. Later, after seeing the demand for office supplies due to the business’ location in front of two schools, he added a small office supply shop to his business. Thanks to his perseverance, the business has been growing and today he has an established customer base.

He thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for the support provided for his business. As a result, he will be able to increase his merchandise, providing good service to the community and increasing his income at the same time.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of new printers and cell phones.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new printers and cell phones

loans.name: Maura Paula

texts.es:
Maura de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Hace 15 años atrás ella comenzó con su tienda de vivieres, uno de sus primeros productos fueron galletas y snack. Debido a la demanda de los víveres ella comenzó a comprar enlatados, arroz y aceite poco a poco con esfuerzo y después de separarse de su esposo amplio la tienda. Ahora trabaja con ayuda de sus dos hijos mayores desde las 07h30am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder surtir mejor su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, enlatados etc. En el futuro quiere surtir mejor su tienda y tener una papelería aquí llamada “Bazar”.
texts.en:
Maura is 43 and she lives on the outskirts of the Paraíso de Guayaquil area, characterized by unpaved and mountainous streets. 15 years ago she began with her general store and one of the first products were cookies and snacks. Due to the demand for the items she began to buy canned goods, rice and oil. Little by little, with effort and after separating from her husband, she enlarged the store. Now she works with the help of her two adult children from 7:30 am to 7:00 pm every day. To be able to better stock her store she wants to use the loan to buy rice, canned goods, etc. In the future she would like to have better merchandise in the store and to have a stationery shop called “Bazar” (Bazaar).

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: rice, canned goods

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de venta de jora de maíz (se usa para preparar la chicha) y también se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas como zanahorias, tomates y lechugas y después lo vende en el mercado modelo de Urubamba en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere tener un puesto en el mercado para vender las hortalizas. La socia solicita el préstamo para tener capital de trabajo y poder comprar fertilizante y abonos para cultivar las hortalizas.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria, 22, is divorced and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of ‘jora de maíz’ (used to prepare chicha, a drink made from fermented corn). She also farms vegetables like carrots, tomatoes and lettuces which she then sells in Urubamba’s Modelo Market in an ambulatory way. She wants to have a stand in the market to sell her vegetables. She is asking for funds to have working capital and be able to buy fertilizers and manure for her vegetable crops. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have working capital to buy manure and fertilizers for her vegetables.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de venta de artesanías en las ferias que se realizan en los diferentes distritos de Urubamba, por medio de este pequeño negocio puede sacar adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere tener un local para vender la. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  artesanía como sombreros, mantas y muñecas. 

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the “Mainique” communal bank. The bank is located in the Mainique district in the Urubamba province and Cusco department. Hilda is a 30 year old single mother with one son. She alternates her daily activities with her work selling handicrafts at fairs in the different districts of Urubamba. Through this small business she can help her son get ahead. She wants to have a store to sell the handicrafts. Hilda requests the loan to purchase handicrafts such as sombreros, blankets, and dolls. Hilda is thankful to those who form part of this dream through the loan, and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts such as sombreros, blankets, and dolls

loans.name: Secundino Antonio

texts.es:
Secundino es un pequeño comerciante de venta de verduras y frutas desde hace tres años, se dedica a la venta para seguir apoyando a su familia.
Negocio que inicio con dinero propio proveniente de su jubilación, nace la iniciativa de vender frutas y verduras ya que lo que le pasan al mes no se ajusta ya que la canasta básica esta a altos costos.
Atreves de los financiamientos ha logrado hacer mejoras a su casa, son diez ciclos  de préstamo que Afodenic ha dado y que ha mejorado su vivienda,  en la sala, cuarto, construcción de un cuarto y ahora podrá comenzar a construir otro cuarto para lograr mejor espacio.
Comprara materiales como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines, lo que ajuste y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Secundino is a small fruit and vegetable merchant and has been for the past three years. He works in sales so that he can continue supporting his family.

He began the business with money from his retirement and he thought to sell fruits and vegetables since what they give to him each month isn’t enough because the basic foods a family needs are expensive.

Through the loans, he has been able to make improvements to his house. AFODENIC has given him ten loans and he has made improvements in his living room and bedroom, has built another room, and now he can began to build another room to have more space.

He will purchase materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and beams to begin the project.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a room and have better living conditions for his family

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor Huamaní S. Santos vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad , su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en avenida Buenos Aires Ica ,El solicitante se dedica a brindar servicios de chofer de taxi por el cual alquila la unidad vehícular durante cinco años. El cliente presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales por tal mótivo se propone otorgarle el crédito que ocupará para sus gastos personales y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Huamaní S. Santos lives with his wife and their 2 year old son. His home is located on Buenos Aires Ica Avenue. He works as a taxi driver with a vehicle he has been renting for 5 years. His clientele offer good personal and work references and for that reason he commits to pay back the loan he will use for personal expenditures and the improvement in his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: GASTOS PERSONALES

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Urubamba”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cecilia Elizabeth; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 4 hijos; La socia es docente y trabaja como profesora de inicial; ella a su ves alterna sus actividades con la crianza de cuyes, ella desea organizar su espacio y comprar mas cuyes, tambien la socia alquila dos de sus habitaciones y de este modo tiene un dinero extra; La socia comprar follaje para sus cuyes, la socia principalmente quiere mejorar el negocio de crianza de cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y follaje para los animales.
 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” ["New Vision of Urubamba"] communal bank. The bank is located the Urubamba district, in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco. This borrower is Ms. Cecilia Elizabeth. She is 53 years old, widowed, and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities between raising animals like guinea pigs, while also working as an elementary school teacher. She also rents rooms. She is a very enterprising woman who likes to work in all of these businesses because this is how she will be able to help her children get ahead. Ms. Cecilia Elizabeth wants to improve her business of raising guinea pigs. She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and greens to feed the animals. This borrower is grateful to those who, through this means, form a part of her dream. She also promises to comply with her repayments according to the established plan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and food for the animals

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
El Sr. Dionisio E., oriundo de  Coronel Oviedo, tiene 51 años, está casado con la sra María Victoria, y tuvieron  4 hijos, de los cuales contó que ha tenido momentos muy difíciles ya que 3 de sus hijos fallecieron el último tenía 8 años y falleció de una enfermedad llamada Aneurisma, los otros dos fallecieron antes de nacer.
El es de profesión chofer y ha trabajado en Coronel Oviedo , en una empresa de Distribución de productos  de gaseosa y Cerveza, durante 6 años, luego desde el año 1985 lo enviaron como encargado de una  sucursal que habilitaron en  la ciudad de Canindeyu, donde se quedó 14 años.
Según manifiesta en ese tiempo él se había comprado un camión doble eje y un camioncito para 5.000 Kilos, para realizar sus propios repartos, y así fue durante algunos años, luego empezó la enfermedad de su hijo,  por quien efectuó muchos gastos , ya que su hijo se llegó a internar y no encontrándose la cura falleció en el año 1993, y como le había quedado muchas deudas decidió vender uno de sus camiones y su casa, que tenía en el centro de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, y esto le llevó a buscar otros recursos y emigrar a otro lado,  entonces se dedicó a la preparación y venta de cigarros de hoja de tabaco, para lo cual empezó a ganar mercado en la ciudad de Asunción, ya que iba y venia a la misma para la venta de sus productos, fue allí que decidió mudarse , y así lo hizo, llegó  y al principio vivía en un inquilinato, hasta que compró para su terreno propio en la ciudad de Villa Elisa donde reside actualmente.
Sigue trabajando en la elaboración y ventas de cigarros, en  distintos puntos de la ciudad; también hace 4 años le agregó a su Micro empresa la compra y venta de muebles sobre pedidos, que según él le da muy buenas ganancias, y puede hacerlo inclusive  desde su casa, sin necesidad de estar mucho tiempo fuera de ella.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de muebles y hojas de tabaco para la fabricación de cigarrillo.
Esta muy contento con los créditos recibidos ya que para él es una fuente muy importante para la adquisición de sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Mr. Dionisio E., a native of Coronel Oviedo, is 51 years old. He is married to Mrs. Maria Victoria and they had 4 children. Sadly, they have had very painful times in their lives as 3 of their children died. The last child was 8 years old and died of an aneurysm; the other two died before birth. He is a driver and worked in Coronel Oviedo for a soda and beer distribution company for 6 years. In 1985, they sent him to mange the company’s Canindeyu branch where he remained for 14 years. At that time, he had purchased a tandem axle truck and a small truck with a 5,000 kilo cargo capacity in order to make his own deliveries. And so it was for some years. Then his son became ill and was hospitalized and he accumulated many expenses. They were not able to find a cure and he died in 1993. As he still had many debts, he decided to sell one of his trucks and the house that he had in the center of Coronel Oviedo. This led him to seek other resources and relocate to the other side of the city. Then he prepared cigars made from tobacco leaves for sale in Asuncion where he began to gain a market for his product. Since he was traveling back and forth to the city to sell his products, he decided to move there. When he first arrived, he lived in a tenement. Later, he bought his own land in the city of Villa Elisa where he now lives. He continues making and selling cigars in various parts of the city. Four years ago, he added the purchase and sale of furniture on order to his micro-business which he says gives him a good profit. He is even able to work from his home and rarely needs to go out. He is requesting the loan to buy furniture and tobacco leaves for making cigars. He is very happy with the loans he has received. They are a very important source of funds for the purchase of his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture for re-sale and tobacco leaves to make cigars.

loans.name: Mario Pedro

texts.es: El Señor ingreso a la institución el año 2004 con el grupo solidario Raza de Bronce, trabajando 12 secuencias y actualmente se independiza con el crédito individual con la garantía del mismo grupo anterior. El señor es una persona responsable con sus pagos, con el dinero del crédito  desea implementar su taller de lavados de autos maquinaria. Don Mario esta casado con la señora rosa tiene tres hijos a los cuales hace estudiar con mucho esfuerzo con la actividad que tiene de chofer asalariado, su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona villa victoria. Tiene muchos deseos de superación para su persona, mas para  sus hijos, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario is married to Rosa and he has three children who he keeps in school through much effort as a salaried driver. He joined the institution in 2004 as a member of the “Raza de Bronce” (Race of Bronze) communal bank participaing in 12 cycles. Currently he is going out on his own with an individual loan but backed by the same previous group. He is a responsible person with respect to repayments. He will use the requested funds to set up a car wash. His home is in the Villa Victoria neighborhood. He has a strong wish for self improvement and even more so for his children. He is very grateful to the institution for the support given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a car wash.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de profesora del nivel inicial, ella trabaja en el distrito de Pachar provincia de Urubamba que queda ubicado 30 minutos de Urubamba y tambien tiene un pequeño restaurant donde prepara almuerzos, la socia quiere mejorar su restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar sillas y mesas para el restaurant.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Isabel, 47, is a single mother of a son. She combines her daily activities with being an elementary school teacher. She works in Pachar district, Urubamba province, located 30 minutes from Urubamba. She also has a small restaurat where she prepares lunches. She wants to improve her restaurant and is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs for it. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this forum to thank those who participate in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Urubamba”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Florencia; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de compra y venta de verduras y pasto para alimento de cuyes y conejos, la socia trabaja en forma independiente y vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 6.00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m  por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un local para vender las verduras y pasto. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras y pasto al por mayor.
 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Florencia belongs to the communal bank, "Nueva Visión de Urubamba," or ‘New Vision of Urubamba.’ The bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the Urubamba province and Cusco department. Florencia is 58 years old and widowed with 5 children. She schedules her daily activities around her business of buying and selling vegetables and alfalfa to be used as feed for guinea pigs and rabbits. Florencia works independently selling in the Urubamba market from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. Through this small business, she provides the best for her children. She wants to have a store to sell the vegetables and alfalfa. She requests the loan to purchase wholesale vegetables and alfalfa. Florencia is grateful to those who have become part of her dream through the loan, and she commits to making the payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale vegetables and alfalfa

loans.name: Maida

texts.es: La Sra. Maida vive en la Urbanización El Recreó en la zona del Plan 3000, ella se dedica a la venta de comida que prepara en su casa y saca a vender durante las noches en su mismo domicilio, además de vender en su casa ella prepara a pedido comida para eventos sociales, ella es muy conocida por el buen servicio que brinda además de ser responsables y trabajadora. Su esposo trabaja como taxista en transporte urbano, ellos tienen 3 hijas que asisten a primaria. La Sra. Maida necesita del crédito para poder comprar una nueva heladera y un freezer para poder almacenar la carne y verduras que compra, ya que con los que contaba se le arruinaron un corte de energía eléctrica que hubo en el barrio.
texts.en:
Maida lives in the El Recreo Urbanization in Plan 3000 zone. She sells food that she prepares at home and sells outside her house in the evenings. Besides selling outside her home she also prepares food on special order for social events. She is very well known thanks to the good service she provides as well as for being very responsible and hardworking. Her husband is employed as an urban taxi driver. They have three daughters that go to primary school. Maida needs funds to buy a new refrigerator and a freezer to store the meat and vegetables she buys because the ones she used to own were ruined due to an electrical short in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and a freezer.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de artesanía, también se dedica al negocio de venta de anticuchos en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 3:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y artesanía vende los días sábados y domingos, su esposo trabaja en una panadería y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un local donde pueda vender los anticuchos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para hacer los anticuchos y también para comprar mercadería de artesanía. 

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda, 31, is married and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with crafts sales. She also sells anticuchos (skewered, grilled meat) itinerantly from 3pm until 10pm. She sells the crafts on Saturdays and Sundays. Her husband works in a bakery and together they support their children. She would like to have a fixed locale from which to sell the anticuchos. She is asking for funding to buy ingredients for the antiuchos as well as to buy crafts merchandise. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy anticucho (skewered, grilled meats) ingredients and also to buy crafts merchandise.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. David   se dedica a la elaboración de bolos ( productos que tienen una forma de refresquitos en  tubo) en la fabrica que se encuentra en su domicilio  cuyo propietario es su tío, el trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 17:00 y posteriormente se va a la universidad a realizar estudios, el cliente proviene de padres separados por tanto aprendio a ganar su propio dinero y de alguna manera  llegar a ser independiente. El dinero que esta solicitando necesita para la compra de una maquina embazadora para la elaboración de sus productos y de  alguna manera llegar a tener su propio dinero invertido, es muy trabajador y esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
David makes bolos (refreshments packaged in plastic tubes) in a factory located in his home which belongs to his uncle. He works from 8am until 5pm and then goes to his university classes. His parents were separated so he learned how to earn his own money and ways to be independent. The funds he’s asking for are to buy a packaging machine for his products and somehow have his own money invested. He is very hard working and very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a packing machine.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Urubamba”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Reyna; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es madre soltera  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de compra y venta de prendas de vestir, ella vende en forma independiente en el mercado de Urubamba, ella vende pantalones, blusas, faldas y chompas para niños y adultos, la socia quiere tener un local para poder vender las prendas de vestir. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como polos, pantalones y blusas.
 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Reyna, 27, is a single mother of one son. She alternates her daily activities with clothing sales. She sells independently in Urubamba’s market. She sells pants, blouses, skirts and sweaters for children and adults. She wants to have a fixed locale in which to sell her clothes. She is asking for funds to buy mechandise like polo-style shirts, pants and blouses. She is a member of the “Nueva Vision de Urubamba” (Urubamba’s New Vision) communal bank located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy polo-type shirts, pants and blouses.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Urubamba”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de compra y venta de prendas de vestir, ella vende en forma independiente y la ropa  trae de lugares como Tacna y Bolivia, ella vende pantalones, blusas, faldas y chompas para niños y adultos, la socia quiere tener un local para poder vender las prendas de vestir. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería (ropa).
 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda, 23, lives with her life partner and their child. She alternates her daily activities with selling clothes. She sells independently and gets the clothing from such places like Tacna and Bolivia. She sells pants, blouses, skirts and sweaters for children and adults. She wants to have a fixed locale in which to sell the clothes. She is asking for funds to buy merchandise (clothes). She is a member of the “Nueva Vision de Urubamba” (Urubamba’s New Vision) communal bank located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Irene; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de venta de artesanías y venta de verduras, ella realiza los dos negocios, la venta de artesanía lo realiza en las ferias que hay en la provincia de Urubamba y la venta de verduras la realiza en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 5:00a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a su hijo, ella quiere tener un puesto para vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  artesanía y para comprar verduras como tomate, zapallo, zanahorias y lechuga al por mayor.
 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Irene, 34, is a single mother of one child. She alternates her daily activities with crafts and vegetable sales. She carries out both businesses. She sells the crafts at Urubamba’s provincial markets and she sells the vegetables in Urubamba’s market from 5am until 4pm. These small businesses allow her to support her son. She wants to have a stall in which to sell the vegetables. She is asking for funds to buy crafts and to buy vegetables like tomatoes, pumpkin, carrots and lettuce at wholesale. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs funds to buy crafts and to buy vegetables like tomatoes, pumpkin, carrots and lettuce at wholesale.

loans.name: Mujeres De Maiz Group

texts.es: Doña Reina V., es casada, D. cuarenta y cuatro años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a la escuela, tiene ocho hijos, dos mayores D. edad y seis menores a quienes ella tiene que cubrir todos los gastos ya que hace ocho años se separaron con su esposo y ella lucha para salir adelante con sus hijos, se dedica a la artesanía (Confección D. Pants y Sudaderos), cuenta con 24 años D. experiencia en ésta actividad. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación y la ayuda D. unas sobrinas y vecinas  organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MUJERES D. MAÍZ, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes y porque tiene relación con la cosecha del lugar. El grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza D. animales, confección D. ropas deportivas y  venta D. ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra D. tela, y D. esa forma incrementar su negocio y así generar más ganancias. Ya que ella considera que existe demanda pero por falta del capital, no ha podido cubrir estos pedidos, pero ha salido adelante con ayuda D. créditos y espera que su negocio sea más granD. y pueda genere más ingresos para su desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Reina V. is 44 years old and married. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school. She has 8 children; 2 are grown up and independent, but the other 6 are dependent on her. Reina has been separated from her husband for 8 years and struggles to proviD. for her children. She makes handmaD. artisan crafts (pants and saddle blankets). She has 24 years of experience with this kind of work. With enthusiasm and the desire to improve her life, as well as the help of her nieces and neighbors, Reina is organizing this group to request a loan. The community bank is called MUJERES D. MAÍZ (Women of Maize), a name chosen by the members because it refers to the local harvest. The group consists of 10 women who work in various activities such as raising livestock, making athletic clothing, and clothing sales. Reina will use the loan to buy fabric, which will increase her business and thus generate additional income. There is demand for her work but Reina hasn't been able to meet this demand due to lack of capital. With financing, she hopes to see her business grow and generate more income for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “José Carlos Mariátegui”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eloy; el tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo, el socio trabaja como mototaxista (hace servicio de taxi pero en moto),el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m el quiere sacar adelante a su hijos por medio de este empleo, el socio quiere comprar un carro. El socio solicita el préstamo para  arreglar la moto y comprar repuestos. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Eloy 28, is single and has son. He works as a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) driver from 5am until 8pm. He wants to be able to support his children through this work. He wants to buy a car. He is asking for funds to repair the motorcycle and buy replacement parts. He is a member of the “José Carlos Mariátegui” communal bank located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. He avails himself of this platform to express his gratitude to all those who share his dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladis; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de venta de artesanías, ella vende las artesanías en las ferias que se realiza en la provincia de Urubamba, ella quiere tener un local donde vender las artesanías ya que por el momento  está vendiendo en forma ambulatoria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  artesanía al por mayor.

 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gladis, 26, is a single mother of two children. She alternates her daily activities with crafts sales. She sells quite a few crafts in the markets that take place in Urubamba province. She wants to have a fixed locale to sell her crafts because for the time being she sells them in an ambulatory manner. She is asking for funds to buy crafts at wholesale. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafts at wholesale.

loans.name: Liz Danisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “José Carlos Mariátegui”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liz Danisa; ella tiene 32  años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta sandalias y venta de aceituna, ella vende en forma independiente en el centro comercial del distrito de Urubamba desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, su esposo es chofer que hace servicio de taxi en Urubamba y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un local para vender sus sandalias. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar sandalias al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Liz Danisa, 32, lives with her significant other and their three children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of sandals and olives. She sells independently in Urubamba’s shopping center from 8am until 6pm. Her husband provides taxi services in Urubamba and together they support their children. She wants to have a locale in which to sell her sandals. She is asking for funds to buy sandals at wholesale. She is a member of the “José Carlos Mariátegui” communal bank located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals at wholesale.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Faustina; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de venta de artesanías en el distrito de Urubamba, ella vende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m  en forma independiente, la socia quiere tener un local donde pueda vender las artesanías. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  artesanías como carteras, mantas muñecas y trabajos en arcilla.
 

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Faustina, 36, is married and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with crafts sales in Urubamba district. She sells from 6am until 6pm independently. She wants to have a locale to sell her crafts. She is asking for funds to buy crafts like purses, blankets, dolls and clay items. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafts like purses, blankets, dolls and clay items.

loans.name: Mayra Ivette

texts.es:
Mayra es una joven  dedicada, de 26 años de edad, de profesión docente, vive con sus padres aun, el cual apoya para tener una vivienda segura.
Trabaja desde hace cuatro años, en el colegio. Como objetivo es poder ir a la universidad y poder terminar su carrera universitaria para lograr mejores beneficios.
Con esta solicitud de crédito que opto es para hacer un muro frontal, lo que vendrá a mejorar sus condiciones de terreno, como mejor seguridad de la vivienda.
Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro y lograr comenzar. Contenta ya que hará posible esta mejora que no había logrado hacer porque no contaba con  dinero suficiente, y que hoy por medio del financiamiento le es posible.
texts.en:
Mayra is a dedicated young woman. She is 26 years old and has been a teacher for four years. She lives with her parents, whom she supports by helping provide safe housing.  A goal of hers is to go to college to finish her degree to be able to qualify for greater benefits. Mayra is requesting the loan in order to have a front wall built, which will offer added security to their home as well as improve the condition of the property. To get started, she plans to purchase construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, gravel and iron. Mayra has not been able to make these improvements due to lack of funds, but she is glad now that the loan will make it possible.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as stone, sand, cement and iron to build a front wall and to achieve better home security.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “José Carlos Mariátegui”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Francisco; el tiene 48  años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, el socio trabaja en construcción civil en forma independiente y su esposa tiene un restaurant y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el restaurant pintando las paredes y refaccionar el baño. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar  materiales para arreglar el restaurant de su esposa. 
	
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Francisco, 48, lives with his life partner and their 5 children. He works independently in civil construction and his wife has a restaurant. Together they support their children. He wants to improve his wife’s restaurant painting the walls and refurbishing the restroom. He is asking for funds to buy materials to do so. He is a member of the “José Carlos Mariátegui” communal bank located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. He avails herself of this platform to express his gratitude to all those who share his dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to improve his wife's restaurant.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Olimpia; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de crianza de pollos y gallinas, ella compra cuando son pequeños los pollos y los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en el mercado del distrito de Urubamba, ella trabaja en forma independiente, su esposo trabaja como albañil y juntos sacan adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio de crianza de pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  pollos y gallinas y también para comprar alimentos para los animales.
 

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Olimpia, 23, lives with her life partner and their child. She alternates her daily activities with raising chicks and chickens. She buys them when they are young and fattens them up for subsequent sale at Urubamba disrict’s market. She works independently and her husband works as a bricklayer. Together they support their son. She wants to expand her chicken raising business and is asking for funds to buy chicks and chickens as well as animal feed for them. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks and chickens as well as animal feed for them.

loans.name: Eusebio Maximo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “José Carlos Mariátegui”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eusebio Máximo; el tiene 48  años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo, el socio trabaja albañil en forma independiente y también se dedica a cultivar productos en su pequeño terreno, el cultiva papa, maíz, verduras, el socio quiere mejorar el terreno de cultivo. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para su terreno de cultivo. 	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eusebio Máximo, 48, is married and has one child. He works independently as a bricklayer but also farms his small plot of land. He grows potatoes, corn and vegetables. He wants to improve his farmland and is asking for funds to buy seed, manure and fertilizers to do so. He is a member of the “José Carlos Mariátegui” communal bank located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. He avails himself of this platform to express his gratitude to all those who share his dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Leydi Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leydi; Josefina ella tiene 42 años de edad y es madre soltera  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de botica donde vende medicamentos y perfumes, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la botica queda en  una de las calles de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  mercadería para la botica.

 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Mainique" communal bank. The bank is located in the Mainique district, belonging to the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. This borrower is Ms. Leydi Josefina. She is 43 years old and a single mother with one son. She alternates her daily activities with a drugstore business, where she sells medications and perfumes. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. The drugstore is located on one of the streets in Urubamba. Ms. Leydi Josefina would like to expand her business. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her drugstore. Ms. Leydi Josefina is grateful to those who, through this means, form a part of her dream. She also promises to make her payments according to the established repayment plan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her drugstore

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “José Carlos Mariátegui”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de jugos, la socia tiene una jugueria en el mercado de la provincia de Urubamba y su esposo se dedica a la venta de relojes en forma independiente, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de relojes y para comprar  fruta para hacer los jugos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Roxana, 31, is married and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of fruit juices. She has a juice shop in Urubamba province’s market and her husband sells timepieces independently. She wants to expand her business and is asking for funds to buy timepieces and to buy fruits to make juices. She is a member of the “José Carlos Mariátegui” communal bank located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy timepieces and fruit to make juices.

loans.name: Juana Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Marisol; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende en forma independiente en las diferentes ferias que se realizan en el distrito de Urubamba, su esposo trabaja como albañil, la socia quiere tener un local donde vender las artesanías. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  mercadería para la artesanía.

 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Mainique" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Mainique, belonging to the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. This borrower is Ms. Juana Marisol. She is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling crafts. She sells independently in the different markets held around the district of Urubamba. Her husband works as a mason. Ms. Juana Marisol would like to have a permanent spot to sell her crafts. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her crafts business. Ms. Juana Marisol is grateful to those who, in this manner, form a part of her dream. She also promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for crafts

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Humberto; el tiene 48  años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el socio trabaja como maestro de construcción en la municipalidad de Urubamba y su esposa vende artesanía en el distrito de Urubamba, el socio quiere tener un negocio de artesanía mas grande. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar mercadería de  artesanía para el negocio de su esposa. 
	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Humberto, 48, is married and has two children. He works as a master builder in Urubamba and his wife sells crafts in Urubamba district. He wants to have a larger crafts business so is asking for funds to buy merchandise for his wife’s crafts business. He is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. He avails himself of this platform to express his gratitude to all those who share his dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafts for his wife's business.

loans.name: Jazmina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jazmina tiene la edad de 38 años, procreo dos hijos, siendo madre soltera, se ha dedicado al comercio, venta de cosmético, ropa el cual trabaja por catálogos y lo que le encarguen.
Inicio con ayuda de su hermano que está en los Estados Unidos de América, envió productos Avon de allá. Luego con las ganancias se afilio ala Avon de aquí Nicaragua.
Pues no ha sido fácil, captar los clientes, pero ha logrado con el tiempo su clientela, el cual trabaja con el fin de poder dar a sus hijos un futuro mejor ya que tiene que cubrir todas las necesidades de ambos hijos.
Tiene poco productos es por eso nace la iniciativa de este financiamiento para darle un giro mejor a su negocio con el aumento de productos y así poder vender más y lograr mejores beneficios de ganancias lo que mucho le hace falta ya que su hijo mayor está cursando la universidad lo que para ella es importante que juntos logren el objetivo.
texts.en:
Jazmina is 38 years old and has 2 children. A single mother, she has dedicated herself to catalog sales of clothing and cosmetics. She started with the help of her brother, who lives in the U.S. and sent her Avon products to sell. With money from these initial sales, she became affiliated with Avon here in Nicaragua. It hasn't been easy to build a customer base, but she has done so over time, with the goal of providing her children with a better future. Jazmina has few products and hopes to give her business a jump start with financing for more inventory. The revenue from increased sales is especially needed now that her oldest child is attending college, an important goal for both her and her child.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various Avon cosmetics to increase sales.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de cultivo de hortalizas, su esposo trabaja como estibador de triciclos en el mercado de Urubamba y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para la construcción de su  casa para comprar materiales de construcción.

 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luisa, 30, lives with her life partner and their two children. She alterntes her daily activities with vegetable farming. Her husband works loading and unloading three-wheeled cargo vehicles in Urubamba’s market. Together they support their children. She wants to do some home improvements and is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María es comerciante de ropa en un centro de compra Roberto huembés inicio hace trece años con apoyo de su esposo, hoy en día su hijo mayor la sigue ayudando para mantener en equilibro en el negocio.
El modulo es alquilado, paga agua y luz por aparte, pero se vende, hay días buenos y días en que se vende poco.
Opto al financiamiento para aumentar el inventario y comprar mayores cantidades y así poder comprar variedad de ropa, el cual ha logrado la captación de clientes. Sus planes es seguir con su venta de ropa ya que es su medio de sobrevivencia.
Lo que comprara: ropa de damas juvenil,  ropa interior de dama, en variedades de colores y estilos, lo cual espera que sus ventas mejoren. Y poder cubrir pagos de la joven que le ayuda a vender como sus gastos.
texts.en:
Ana María sells clothing in Roberto Huembés shopping center. She started her business 13 years ago with the help of her husband and today continues running the business with the help of her oldest child. The store space is rented and she pays water and electricity bills separately. Ana María sells everyday, but there are good days and bad days. She opted for financing to increase inventory and the variety of her products, which will help her gain more customers. Ana María plans to continue her clothing business, as it is her main source of income. She will buy clothing for younger women and women's underwear in a variety of colors and styles, in the hopes of improving sales and covering the salary of the young woman who works for her as a sales assistant.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various women's clothing, such as underwear, to increase sales.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana Silva tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa hace mas de 18 años que tiene este negocio por lo que siempre busca la forma de generar ingresos. Las ventas se dan de manera ambulante, pues así tiene la oportunidad de ofrecerles a sus clientes una gran variedad de prendas de vestir, calzado y cosméticos. Pues solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio y así ofrecer una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Ana Silva is 30 years old and has had her clothes selling business for more than 18 years and is always looking for ways to generate income. She is a mobile merchant, which gives her the opportunity to provide her customers with a large selection of clothing items, shoes, and cosmetics. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy supplies for her business and be able to offer a large variety of items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es: Pedro (presidente del grupo) tiene 43 años D. edad y 2 años trabajando con Edaprospo ,y la señora Clelia (tesorera) tiene 58 años y 9 años trabajando con Edaprospo, ambos son parte del grupo “Crecer” el cual ya lleva 9 años desD. que se fundó, en la última oportunidad fue conformada por 10 personas, además el grupo se formo por la amistad y ganas D. progresar D. los vecinos D. la zona y el nombre fue idea D. la señora Clelia por la idea D. crecimiento no solo en el sentido económico, sino como personas. El Sr. Pedro ah trabajado por 8 años haciendo transporte privado, la Sra. Clelia trabaja ya 10 años en la venta D. comidas, además D. poner una librería la cual está implementando poco a poco, sus ingresos le sirve para mantenerse y pagar el tratamiento D. su columna, espera prontamente construir y mejorar su casa e implementar su librería. Ambos están felices por la ayuda que reciben D. Edaprospo que les brinda un capital para su trabajo y esperan que se les aumente su negocio y la capacidad D. crédito que les brinda Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Pedro, group President, is 43 years old. He has been collaborating with Edaprospo for two years. Clelia, 58, is group Treasurer and she’s been working with Edaprospo for 9 years. Both are part of the “Crecer” (To Grow) group which was founded 9 years ago. During its previous cycle it had 10 members. The group formed thanks to the wish several neighbors had to strengthen their friendship and prosper together. The name for the group was Clelia’s idea because the idea was to grow not only economically but as persons too Pedro has worked in private transport for 8 years and Clelia has sold prepared meals for 10 years in addition to starting a bookstore that she’s been equipping bit by bit. Her income helps her support herself and pay for her back treatments. She hopes to build and improve her house and stock her bookstore. Both are happy for the help they receive from Edaprospo which provides them with capital for their work and they hope their business will grow as well as their credit capacity from Edaprospo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Teresa tiene 33 años, además de 5 años lavando la ropa de otras personas trabajo que se da de manera esporádica, también tiene 2 años en la labor de empleada domestica,  ya desde hace ya 1 año que trabaja con Edaprospo, el cual le ayuda en la compra de su capital que son las telas con la cual hace las fundas para muebles en su pequeño taller, últimamente ah incursionado en la venta de productos Natura el cual le genera los ingresos que junto a la pensión que le da el padre de sus hijos, puesto que está separada, mas el dinero de el tallercito logra mantener a sus 3 hijos que aun tiene a su cargo. Ella espera poner un negocio de venta y repartición de gas, para esto necesita más capital pero sabe que lo conseguirá si sigue así, pues su grupo Madres Laboriosas son muy responsables y las 7 socias que lo conforman son amigas y se dan la mano para alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Teresa, 33, has been taking in laundry for over five years; this is sporadic work, though. She has also been employed as a domestic employee for two years. She has collaborated with Edaprospo for a year. Edaprospo helps her buy fabric with which she makes slipcovers for furniture in a small workshop. Lately she has started to sell Natura brand products which generate extra income that together with the support she gets from her children’s father (she is separated) plus the money from the little workshop allows her to support the three children she still has in her care. She hopes to open a gas distribution business but needs more capital to do so; she knows that she will accomplish this if she continues as she is going. Her group is “Madres Laboriosas” (Laborious Mothers) and they are a very responsible group of 7 members who are friends and give her a hand so that she can reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Darling Aracely

texts.es: Darling Aracely tiene 27 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues tiene mucha experiencia en interactuar con sus clientes, por lo que ha demostrado ser una joven responsable al pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio, pues ha sido muy productivo.  Este crédito es para la compra de cosméticos, ropa, calzado entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Darling Aracely is 27 years old and sells general merchandise. She has had this business for more than nine years and has lots of experience interacting with her customers. [Darling] has proven herself to be a responsible young woman who makes her payments on time. This is not the first time she has gotten financing for her business and iIt has been very productive. She will use the money from this loan to invest in cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: Maria D. Los Angeles P. Moreyda tiene su bodega desD. hace 10 años al frente D. su casa. DesD. el inicio ella trabaja sola y venD. verduras, pollo, pan, leche, etc. Le gustaría ampliar más y tener productos como perfumes y más regalos. Hace 4 años que trabaja con Edaprospo y diga que los préstamos la ayudan a sostener su negocio, a ampliar más y también la ayudan a construir su casa. Ella quiere que sus dos hijos jóvenes estudien porque ella diga que está trabajando para ellos.
texts.en:
María D. Los Ángeles P. Moreyda has had her general store for 10 years in front of her house. From the start she has worked by herself selling vegetables, chicken, bread, milk, etc. She’d like to expand a bit M. and incluD. products such as perfumes and gift items. She has collaborated with Edaprospo for 4 years and she says the loans help her sustain her business, to expand it and also have helped her build her house. She wants her two young children to study because she says she’s working for them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Marife Dula Group

texts.en:
Marife D. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin Mis. Occ. She is 29 years old and the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marife D. Group.

Marife is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Marife joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Marife is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will again be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marife from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.en:
Gudelia P. is from the village of Binuangan. She is 52 years old. Gudelia is married and has four children. Two of them have jobs, and two of them are in school. To make a living, Gudelia works in someone else's specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Gudelia has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gudelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gudelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Gudelia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Gudelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the twelfth loan that Alicia has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

In 2007, Annabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Annabel is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan that Annabel has taken out from PMPC. loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo D. R. is from the village of Sampaguita, Solana, Cagayan. He is 52 years old, married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Domingo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Domingo has been engaged in his business for over 34 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Domingo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27,000 PHP from ASKI. Domingo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan that Domingo has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
